loans.name: Lucila Petronila

texts.es:
Señora Lucila Petronila García P. is 45 years old. She lives in the district of Moche in La Libertad, Peru. She finished high school. She has 2 children who still depend on her financially.

Señora Petrolina raises different types of animals such as cows, pigs, calves and rams which she sacrifices weekends to sell the meat throughout the city to all of her clients. She is well-known in the area for the good quality of meat she sells.

Señora Peta is a founding member of the group/club called 'San Borja'. This is where she obtained her first loan and she paid it off in 4 months. She was able to purchase food to feed her animals.

With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase a calf and well-balanced food to feed it and later sell it. Señora Petronila dreams about buying a piece of land that she can used for only raising animals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucila Petronila García P., tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad - Perú. Estudió secundaria completa; tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella. La señora Petrolina se dedica a la crianza de distintos animales como vacas, terneras, cerdos y carneros los que sacrifica los fines de semana para vender y repartir su carne en Moche a sus clientes que ha podido conseguir desde que empezó con este negocio; se ha hecho muy conocida por la calidad de carne que vende. La señora Peta es socia fundadora del Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja” en el cual obtuvo en el mes de noviembre un préstamo de S/.1000.00 para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, le sirvió para comprar el alimento para sus cerdos, y dos borregos los cuales engordó para venderlos en las fiestas de fin de año. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses comprará un torito y alimento balanceado para engordarlo y venderlo a mayor precio. La señora Petronila sueña con ambientar un pequeño terreno para criar animales menores en especial pollos de doble pechuga.

loans.use: To purchase a calf  and to purchase well-balance food to feed it

loans.name: Cristina Yamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina Garcia is 39 years old married with three kids. Her husband is a construction worker. Ten years ago she started her business selling tortillas, frijoles, cheese, and cream. She starts cooking and selling her tortillas at 5 am and she finishes her day by 7pm. Her humble family looks forward to the future and to achieve their goal of buying a mill. She’s requesting a credit to buy corn and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cristina G., de 39 años de edad vive en Laureles Norte con su esposo quien es Albañil y juntos cuidan a sus 3 hijos, doña Cristina es una madre preocupada y atenta a las necesidades de su hijos, desde hace 10 años tiene un negocio de venta de tortilla, frijoles cocidos , queso, cuajada y crema. Desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche pasa echando tortilla para vender y mandar a ventas de comidas que le encargan, sus clientes la comen recién hechas, Viven con humildad pero con mucha ilusión de salir adelante, su sueño es comprar un molino. Solicita un crédito para comprar quintal de maíz y frijoles lo que le resultaría más económico.

loans.use: To buy corn and beans

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita has two children, a 22 yr old son and a 19 yr old daughter. Her son works hard to help support the family and her daughter is a single mother. Mrs. Rita works as a factory worker and this job has enabled her to build her home. She’s requesting a loan to tile her house floor.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rita, siempre preocupada por el bienestar de su familia y tener una casa bonita la que ha mejorado poco a poco a su gusto, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte solamente con sus dos hijos de 22 y 19 años de edad, es su hijo mayor quien ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su hija de 19 años es madre soltera y aun no trabaja por lo que es su madre quien la apoya. Doña Rita trabaja en una Zona Franca como operaria y su jornada de trabajo aunque es cansada le da gracias a Dios por tener un trabajo que le ha ayudado a sustentar a sus hijos y a ella misma ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de un esposo. Con la ilusión de ver su humilde hogar mas cómodo y bonito solicita un préstamo para poner ladrillos en el piso de su vivienda.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy tile for her house floor

loans.name: Yvelisse

texts.en:
Yvelisse is thirty-two years old and the mother of two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. Her husband works at a nearby electro-mechanical shop. To complement her family’s income, Yvelisse sells silver jewelry to women of the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo.

The entrepreneur explains that she needs to augment her stock so as to better satisfy her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy customer-recommended products. That will allow her to increase her sales volume and her revenue, and Yvelisse will be able to support her family.

loans.use: To acquire silver jewelry for re-sale in her community

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en:
Marleny is a young and budding entrepreneur. She sells pants and shoes to women of the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domino. She operates the business mostly out of her parents' house, but sometimes she visits friends to sell her goods. Marleny explains that she’s recently finished high school and in a short time she wants to study marketing at the university.

With her loan, Marleny will purchase customer-recommended products in order to augment her sales volume and her revenue. Marleny hopes that her business’ growth will help her achieve her goal of becoming a professional.

loans.use: Funds will be invested to buy clothing for her small business

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo is 27 years old, single and earns a living as a jeweler and merchant. He completed his High School education at a public school in his native city of Luque.

Alejo used to work in his parent's butcher shop where he used to deliver the customer's orders. Currently he has a small workshop in his house, where he makes different types of gold and silver jewelery such as bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc.

In the future, Alejo would like to obtain a college degree and open a large jewelery store in his city's downtown area, since he has great skills and has several clients that order pieces every month which they resale.

The loan will be used to purchase materials such as pure silver, copper, wire and a few tools he is in need of.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Alejo es soltero tiene 27 años es de profesión joyero y comerciante; culmino sus estudios secundarios en un colegio nacional de su ciudad natal, Luque.

Alejo trabajaba con sus padres en la carnicería que poseían, en donde el realizaba los repartos de pedidos de clientes. Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa, en donde reliza todo tipo de joyas en plata y oro, como brazaletes, collares, anillos, etc.

En el futuro le gustaría seguir una carrera universitaria y montar una joyería grande en el centro de la ciudad, ya que posee muy buenas técnicas de trabajos y varios clientes que mensualmente le solicitan joyas para vender.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales tales como plata pura, cobre, alambre y algunas herramientas que necesitaba.

loans.use: Purchase precious metal such as silver, gold and a few tools.

loans.name: Ernesto Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Ernesto is a man of 42 years, who lives in Laureles South with his wife and their 6 year old son who studies in primary school, like the stressed man who worries about his family, he works delivering bread by bicycle in different zones close to his house, he wants to take advantage of his work time so that he can obtain a better income that will allow him to care for his home, he is thinking of investing in his business by purchasing a motor that he can add to his bike so that he will be able to make deliveries faster and cover more ground and he will be able to work later at night, he can work between 5 and 9 PM that is the time when his clients are at home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Ernesto es un hombre de 42 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur junto a su esposa que es ama de casa y su hijo de 6 años que estudia la Primaria, como el hombre esforzado y preocupado por su familia que es, trabaja repartiendo en bicicleta el Pan en diferentes zonas cercanas a su casa, preocupado por aprovechar al máximo su tiempo de trabajo y obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan hacer unas mejoras necesarias para su casa que esta dañada por el tiempo, ha pensado en invertir en su negocio comprando un motor que le adaptara a su bicicleta para repartir mas rápido y abarcar mas territorio antes que se le haga muy noche, en vista que el empieza a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la tarde hasta las 9:00 de la noche que es la hora que sus clientes ya están en sus casas. Por lo que su crédito es para comprar ese motor como inversión en su negocio, así tendrá mayor velocidad en su trabajo

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his bicycle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Mrs. Angela is 51 years old, she is a friendly woman that lives in Laureles South with her husband and their 3 children, her son of 20 years works and supports himself and her daughter of 23 years is married and her grandchildren have filled her life with happiness. She has a small neighborhood store in which she sells grains, soda, toilet paper, and other hygiene products to her community. She is appreciated by her community and she helps her neighbors giving them credit that they pay by their due dates. She requests a loan to invest in her business by purchasing grains such as rice and beans that are staples in her store, at her age she is a hardworking woman, her husband works in quality control in a sack business and he invests his salary in the store, a business that will guarantee them an old age without necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Ángela de 51 años de edad, es una señora amable y gentil que habita en Laureles Sur junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, su hijo de 20 años trabaja y le apoya y su hija de 23 años de edad es casada y llena de alegría su vida con sus nietos. Tiene un a pulpería en la cual le vende a su comunidad granos básicos, gaseosas, papel higiénicos y otros productos de higiene. Es una persona apreciada por su comunidad y apoya a los vecinos mas conocidos dándoles crédito para que le paguen en sus fechas de pago. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio en compra de granos básicos como arroz y frijoles que son de mucho movimiento en la venta, a su edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, su esposo trabaja en control de calidad en una empresa de sacos y le da su salario para que lo invierta en la pulpería que es el negocio que a ellos les garantizara una vejez sin necesidades.

loans.use: To purchase grains for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue to increase her work capital

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Mrs. Marlene is a woman of 35 years who lives in the Spring region, she is a single mother and the head of her family, her children are 18 and 12 years old and are her biggest motivators each day, she works to further her family selling clothes in her neighborhood and in different zones, she sells cosmetics and clothes which she purchases at a low price and sells on credit, she has been in this business for 10 years. She requests a loan to better her business, with it she will be able to purchase better merchandise and have more to offer. It has not been easy for her to succeed with her children, alone, but she feels that her sacrifice has been worth it and her efforts can be seen in her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marlene es una mujer de 35 años de edad que habita en el barrio la Primavera, es madre soltera y cabeza de familia, sus hijos de 18 y 12 años edad son su mayor motivación en el día a día, trabaja para sacar a delante a sus hijos por su cuenta vendiendo ropa en su barrio y en diferentes zonas francas, vende cosméticos y ropa la cual compra a precio de mayorista y vende al contado y al crédito, tiene 10 años de estar en este negocio. Solicita un crédito para capitalizar su negocio, con el cual podrá comprar mayor mercadería y tendrá mucho más que ofrecer. No ha sido fácil para ella salir adelante con sus dos hijos, sola, pero siente que ha valido la pena su sacrificio y su esfuerzo al ver a sus hijos educándose.

loans.use: To purchase better merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Bemilda Esperanza

texts.es:
Benilda is 59 years old and lives in Waspan North, with her husband who is now retired and the money he receives they use to pay for the house expenses, her 4 children are older and independents, they support them monthly with a little money. She has had a small neighborhood store for 40 years which she started with her savings and now it is a fountain of support for her and her husband. She requests a loan to purchase various products such as groceries, basic grains, and other things to benefit the store, at her age this work represents for her a success and it has helped to pay the expenses of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Benilda de 59 años de edad habita en Waspan Norte, con su esposo quien ya esta jubilado y el dinero que recibe se lo entrega para que lo administre en el gasto de la casa, sus 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes le apoyan mensualmente con un poco de dinero. Tiene 40 años de tener una pulpería la cual inició con sus ahorros y ahora es la fuente de sustento de ella y su viejito a como de cariño le dice a su esposo. Solicita un crédito para comprar productos varios de alimentos, granos básicos y surtir mejor su pulpería, a su edad este trabajo representa para ella un logro ya que cuando lo inició era ama de casa y fue de su iniciativa que ahora tiene este pequeño negocio que mantiene sus gastos y los de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, a young entrepreneur of 25 years old, lives in Waspan North with her husband whom she married at a young age, her husband took her from her parents when he was 21 and she was only 13. They have 2 children, one is 12 and the other is 5, this has made her mature fast because she is in charge of her husband and her new family, 10 years ago her mother left her the business that consisted of a small neighborhood store. With her husband, they are able to maintain this store and it grows bit by bit. Since her husband works as a typographer in a printing company they have plans to start their own printing business and to grow the store. She requests a loan to invest in her small business and to purchase grains and hygiene products.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, joven emprendedora de 25 años de edad, vive en Waspan Norte junto a su esposo con quien se caso a muy temprana edad, su esposo se la robo a sus padre a los 21 años de edad y ella tenia apenas 13 años. Procrearon 2 hijos uno que hoy tiene 12 años y el menor de 5 años de edad, esto llevó a la joven a madurar de manera rápida ya que debía hacerse cargo junto a su esposo de su nueva familia, hace 10 años su madre le dejó su negocio que consistía en una pequeña pulpería en vista que se fue a trabajar fuera del país. Junto a su esposo lograron mantener esa pulpería y hacerla crecer poco a poco. Siendo que su esposo trabaja como Tipógrafo en una Imprenta tienen planes de montar su propia Imprenta y hacer crecer mas la pulpería. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de perecederos y compras granos básicos y productos de higiene para surtir la venta.

loans.use: To purchase products and grains.

loans.name: Erika Massiel

texts.es:
Ericka M. is a young woman of 24 years, she lives in the Spring neighborhood, she is married, her husband works in a big private business. To help with the expenses, for the last 3 years she has dedicated herself to the sale of cosmetics, a business that she began with a loan that her mother gave her, with her quality and commercial activity she has maintained a clientele and has acquired others through recommendations, she has future plans to open a small store of various feminine products and to have children that will make her life even happier. She requests a loan to purchase beauty products so that she can sell them before people start taking their vacations at the beach, this time is important for her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Ericka M. es una joven de 24 años de edad, vive en el Barrio la Primavera, casada, su esposo trabaja como bodeguero en una empresa privada grande del país. Para apoyar en los gastos, desde hace 3 años se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos, negocio que inició con un préstamo que su madre le hizo, con su calidez y actividad comercial ha mantenido su clientela y captado por recomendación otras, de esta manera dentro de sus planes futuros esta abrir una tiendita de variedad de productos femeninos y tener pronto hijos que alegren aún mas su vida. Solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de belleza e irlos a vender antes que empiecen las vacaciones de playa, esta época es importante para sus ventas, en donde tiene pedidos que cumplir.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Flor Yajari

texts.es:
Señora Flor Yajari S. V. is 29 years old. She finished high school. She has one son who still depends on her financially. She lives in the district of El Porvenir in La Libertad, Peru.

She sells clothes for women, men and children. She also has a gift shop where she sells teddy bears, home decor, picture frames, etc. She purchases her merchandise in Lima where she can buy good-quality items to sell. This is why she gets a lot of requests from her clients because she only sells good quailty merchandise. She has been doing this for the past 4 years. She used to work for other peple, but she decided to have her own business.

Señora Flor belongs to a club/group called "Lord's Women". She received her first loan from them which she used the money to purchase clothes to fullfil her orders.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will travel to Lima to purchase popular summer clothes such as jean skirts, shorts, t-shirts and collar shirts. Her biggest dream is to one day buy a locale in the city of Trujillo where she can open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor Yajari S. V. tiene 29 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el distrito El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niños, así también vende regalos como: peluches, adornos, porta retratos, etc. Cuando le hacen regular pedido viaja a la ciudad de Lima para traer modelos exclusivos y a veces de mejor calidad, es por eso que se ha hecho muy conocida por lo cual le hacen bastante pedidos. Hace cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que le va muy bien. Anteriormente trabajaba para otras personas y no tenia ninguna utilidad, es por eso que tuvo la idea de colocar su propio negocio. La señora Flor pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mujeres del Buen Pastor” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varias prendas que le hicieron pedido. Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses viajara a la ciudad de Lima para comprar media docena de faldas Jean, shorts, pescadores y bermudas. Esta prendas son mas usadas por la temporada de verano. Su mayor sueño es comprar un local en la ciudad de Trujillo para ambientar una tienda.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Ilza Buenaventura

texts.es:
Señora Ilza Buenaventura G. V. is 42 years old. She finished up to the 4th grade. She has 3 children who still depend on her financially. She lives in the district of Florencia Mora in La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank called "God Guides Our Steps II".

She used to sell beauty products and made handbags, but since she wasn't able to spend time with her family, she decided to only sell beauty products. Señora Ilza has been selling beauty products for the past 3 years. She was acquiring clients little by little, and a lot of them wanted for her to sell to them through credit. She accepted her mother-in-law's invitation to become a member of the communal bank called "God Guides Our Steps".

She purchased beauty products with her previous loan so that she could have enough in inventory for the holiday season.

with this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase products such as perfumes, colognes, and cosmetics. Señora Ilza would like to keep her sales up so that one day she can afford to install a cement roof over her house.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ilza Buenaventura G. V. tiene 42 años, solo estudió hasta 4º grado de secundaria, tiene tres hijos y actualmente 2 dependen de ella, vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú, pertenece al banco comunal “Dios guía nuestros Pasos II”. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a vender productos de belleza y a confeccionar carteras pero con el tiempo limitado que tenia para atender a su familia decidió dedicarse solo a la venta de productos de belleza. La señora se dedica a este negocio hace más de 3 años; poco a poco fue aumentando la cantidad de sus clientes y muchos le solicitaban que les vendiera al crédito por lo que tenía necesidad de mayor capital por eso aceptó la invitación de su suegra de integrarse al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” El anterior préstamo de S/. 500.00 lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para tener en stock ya que por campaña navideña le solicitaban varios de éstos productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará sus productos: perfumes, colonias y cosméticos. La señora Ilza quiere seguir incrementando sus ventas, así también anhela mucho construir el techo de cemento que le hace falta a su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products for her business

loans.name: Leonor Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Leonor Isabel Rodríguez D. A. is 49 years old. She finished fifth graD.. She only has one son who still depends on her financially. She lives in the district of Florencia D. Mora, in La Libertad, Peru.

Señora Leonor has a small restaurant which she runs out of her home. She serves lunch and dinner every day. She started by selling home-cooked meals from door to door. Then, she got a little place outsiD. her sister-in-law's house selling home-cooked meals in the evenings, and in the mornings she would dedicate her time washing clothes from her neighbors. Little by little she became known throughout the community, and most of her clients would tell her to open her own business from home, and so she did.

She belongs to the communal bank called 'God Guides Our Steps' where she obtained her first loan. With this money she was able to purchase all sorts of ingredients/supplies to cook.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase a bucket of cooking oil, a sack of sugar and rice, and refreshments.

Her biggest dream is to expand her business by buying more tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leonor Isabel Rodríguez D. A. tiene 49 años D. edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado D. primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depenD. D. ella. Vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Leonor tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el que ofrece almuerzos y cena todos los días. Su negocio se inició como ambulante, vendía en un pequeño sitio afuera D. la casa D. su cuñada, vendía por las tardes cachangas, picarones y papa rellena y por las mañanas se dedicaba a lavar ropa D. algunos vecinos que le solicitaban. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y varios clientes le sugerían que abra un local, pues así lo hizo y desD. entonces tiene mayor acogida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Con este dinero compró todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el préstamo D. S/. 600.00 el cual lo pagara en cuatro meses comprará un balD. D. aceite, una bolsa D. azúcar, un saco D. arroz y gaseosas D. todo tipo. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio, implementar con mas mesas y sillas.

loans.use: To purchase basic food ingredients

loans.name: Pacaycasa Group

texts.es:
The Communal Bank Paycasa is a bank that was established approximately 7 years ago. At the present time it has 15 cycles and 21 members. The members of the communal bank are from the Pacaycasa district , which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. The members of the bank note that thanks to this institution they have learned to save, to be responsible and punctual.

The members have different businesses such as the sale of sweets, groceries, fruits, cereals, purchase and sale of cochinilla (an insect used to make natural pigments), tara (a Peruvian native plant used to make leather tanning powder), tuna (the fruit of a cactus plant), brick manufacturing, sale of food, raising animals and agriculture.

Each member has a different story as is the case of Otilia, who is a longstanding member of her communal bank and sells sweets at the school's gate and prepared food on Sundays. Justina, on the other hand, has a small grocery store. She started by selling sweets on the streets and little by little started setting up her store.

The members need different loan amounts. Some are for 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles for a total amount of 11,700 soles in loans for the communal bank. The loans will be used to purchase noodles, rice, cooking oil, milk, eggs, potatoes, tuna, tara, cochinilla, apples, oranges, bananas, cookies, candy, chocolates, sand and to pay the laborers.

The savings would be used to buy homes, grow their business capital and for their children's education. The dreams of the members are that their children become professionals, that the member's daughter that is ill gets better, to expand their businesses and to be able to purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Pacaycasa es un banco que se inició hace 7 años aproximadamente. Actualmente tiene 15 ciclos y 21 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal son del distrito de Pacaycasa, que queda a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Las socias mencionan que en el Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales, y a ahorrar.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de golosinas, abarrotes, frutas, cereales, compra y venta de cochinilla, tara, tuna, fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, venta de comida, crianza de animales menores y la agricultura.

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso de Otilia que está muchos años en su Banco Comunal, Otilia vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio y además vende comida los días domingos. Por otro lado Justina tiene una tienda de abarrotes, al inicio vendía golosinas de manera ambulatoria y poco a poco fue implementando su tienda.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total de 11,700 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, leche, huevo, papa, tuna, tara, cochinilla, manzana, naranja, plátano, galletas, caramelos, chocolates, arena y para el pago de los peones.

Los ahorros los utilizarán para comprar su casa, incrementar el capital de sus negocios y los estudios de sus hijos. Los sueños de las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, la curación de su hija, tener un negocio más grande y comprar su carro.

loans.use: The loans will be used to purchase noodles, rice, cooking oil, milk, eggs, potatoes, tuna, tara, cochinilla, apples, oranges, bananas, cookies, candy, chocolates, sand and to pay the laborers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the communal bank Ayllu, which means "Familia" in Quechua. She has been a member for 7 years and has learned how to save and be responsible with her money.

Maria is 30 years old and is a single mother of three children. She sells propane gas from a store she rents and has employees that deliver her product to customers. Additionally, Maria has a tire shop where her employees fix and sell tires. She needs a loan in the amount of 1500 soles to purchase a motorcycle for the delivery of propane gas.

Maria's dreams are owning her store (instead of renting), expanding her business, building her house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa “Familia” en quechua hace 7 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y ser responsable.

Maria es madre soltera, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda donde vende gas propano, en un local alquilado y también reparte a domicilio para lo cual cuenta con empleados. Además Maria tiene una llantería, donde cuenta con empleados que brindan servicio de arreglado y venta de llantas.

Maria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una motocicleta para el reparto de gas.

Los sueños de Maria son tener local propio, mejorar su negocio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle for the delivery of propane gas.

loans.name: Isabel's Group

texts.es:
Miriam and Isabel have been members of the Communal Bank Ayllu, which means "Family" in Quechua for one and two years respectively. As members of the bank they have learned to save, to be responsible and punctual.

Miriam is 22 years old and is a single mother to a one year old boy. She sells Salchipollo (French fries with chicken) at the entrance of her house. She also tends to a small grocery store she's had for about a year and that is growing little by little.

Isabel, on the other hand, is 48 years old, married and has five children. She bakes breads traditional to the region, and sells them at the entrance of her house.

Maria and Isabel need loans in the amount of 1500 and 600 soles, which will be used to purchase sodas, milk, sugar, rice, flour and shortening. Their dreams are to have financial stability, improve their businesses and build their houses.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam e Isabel pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa “Familia” en quechua hace 1, 2, años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Miriam es madre soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Miriam venD. salchipollo en la puerta D. su casa y hace 1 año tiene una tienda D. abarrotes que poco a poco esta creciendo.

Mientras que Isabel es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Isabel elabora panes típicos D. la zona en su casa y lo venD. en la puerta D. su casa.

Miriam e Isabel necesitan préstamos D. 1500 soles y 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas, leche, azúcar, arroz, harina y manteca. Los sueños D. Miriam e Isabel son tener estabilidad económica, mejorar sus negocios y construir su casa.

loans.use: To purchase sodas, milk, sugar, rice, flour and shortening.

loans.name: Lourdes Zenobia

texts.es:
Lourdes has been member of the communal bank Ayllu, which means "Family" in Quechua, for four months and is now learning how to save her money.

Lourdes is 32 years old, is separated and has 2 children. She owns a car which is used to provide transportation services between provinces and towns in the Ayacucho region. Lourdes travels constantly with her own car in order to verify the earnings personally. She needs a loan in the amount of 1500 soles to invest it in repairs and maintenance for her car.

Lourdes dreams are to own another car, build her house and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa “Familia” en quechua hace 4 meses, ella menciona que esta aprendiendo a ahorrar.

Lourdes es separada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Lourdes tiene un carro que realiza transporte interprovincial a diferentes pueblos de la región de Ayacucho, Lourdes viaja constantemente con su carro para verificar personalmente los ingresos. Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación y mantenimiento de su carro.

Los sueños de Lourdes son tener otro carro más, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in repairs and maintenance for her car.

loans.name: Mariela Cena

texts.es:
Ms. Mariela Cena L. C. is 40 years old, is single and doesn’t have children. Mariela studied to be an elementary school teacher. She is presently working as a teacher at a private school. She also has her own business. She lives in the district of El Provenir in the Province of Trujillo in the department named La Libertad- Peru.

She earns a living selling “ Avon” beauty products. Her friends or acquaintances order her products from “Avon”. She also buys other products that they ask her for and she keeps them in stock to sell them for a higher price. It’s been 5 years since she’s been in this business and it has gone real well. People are always looking for her and even go to her house to place orders.

She is a member of the communal bank “ Mujeres del Buen Pastor” a place where she received her first loan of 300 soles and with this money she bought beauty products: scented shampoos and lip liner.

With the loan of 1000 soles that she will pay back in four months she will buy foot powder, fragrances, facial cream, makeup and jewelry.

Her big dream is to have her own stand in the city of Trujillo, where she will offer all of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señorita Mariela Cena L. C. tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene ningún hijo; ella tiene la carrera de educación primaria, actualmente se encuentra laborando en un colegio particular; además de tener su propio negocio. Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de “avon” le hacen pedidos sus conocidos y vecinos así también compra algunos productos para tener en stock y venderlo a mayor precio. Hace cinco años que se inicio con este negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien, siempre la buscan en su domicilio para hacer algún pedido.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Buen Pastor” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró algunos productos de belleza: shampoo colonias y lápiz de labio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprara talco de pies, fragancias, crema facial, maquillaje y joyas.

Su mayor sueño es tener un stand en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo, donde ofrecerá todos sus productos.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Yanet's Group

texts.es:
Miriam and Yanet have been members of the Communal Bank Ayllu, which means "Familia" in Quechua for 4 and 8 months respectively. Mirian is 27 years old, lives with her partner and has a 1 year old son. Along with her sister, Miriam has been raising and fattening cattle for about a year. The cattle is purchased in the animal fair and she sells them in the city of Lima. Additionally, Miriam and her husband have auto mechanic shop.

Yanet, on the other hand, is 30 years old, married and has two children. She has a small alterations shop at her home and also works as an assistant at a garment workshop. Additionally, Yanet also has a small grocery store.

Miriam and Yanet need loans for 600 soles and 1500 soles. They will be used to purchase balanced food for animals and a flat-bed sewing (mending) machine. Their saving will be used to start a new business and to set up her own garment workshop. Miriam's dreams are to have a store where she sells lubricants, to build her house and that her children become professionals. Yanet's dreams are to have her own garment workshop, build her house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam y Yanet pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa “Familia” en quechua hace 4, 8 meses respectivamente.

Miriam es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Miriam junto a su hermana se dedican al engorde de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza hace 1 año, el ganado es comprado en las feria de animales y la venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Lima. Además Miriam junto a su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz.

Mientras que Yanet es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Yaneth tiene un pequeño taller de composturas de prendas de vestir en su casa y también trabaja como ayudante en un taller de confecciones. Además, Yanet tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Miriam y Yanet necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento balanceado para animales y comprar su maquina remalladora.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para iniciar un nuevo negocio e implementar su taller de confecciones. Los sueños de Miriam y Yanet son tener una tienda de lubricantes, taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase balanced food for animals and a flat-bed sewing (mending) machine.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelida is 41 years old. She has advanced studies and she specialized in accounting. But she never excercized her career because of personal reasons. She has three children who depend on her. She lives in the district of El Cortijo, in the province of Trujillo, in the department La Libertad in Peru.

Nelida has a small stand in the marketplace “El Cortijo” where she sells beauty products, and gifts like: ornaments, stuffed animals, dolls, etc, and she has also installed a small bookstore where she sells notebooks and school supplies. Before she invested in this business she used to sell clothing that she bought in Lima. She stopped selling clothing because she got pregnant and so then she was unable to travel to Lima. She then began selling various products from her stand.

Mrs. Nelida belongs to the communal bank “ Nuevo Peru” where she received her firt loan of 300 Soles and with that money she bought several products that were on sale in the catalogs of “Esika.”

With the loan of 800 soles, wich she will repay in six months, she will invest in buying school supplies uniforms for the school campaign.

Her biggest dream is to have a stand in the city of Trujillo where she will sell beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelida tiene 41 años de edad, ella cuenta con estudios superiores en la carrera técnica la especialidad de contabilidad pero no ejerció su carrera por motivos personales. Tiene tres hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

En su pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado zonal El Cortijo vende productos de belleza, regalos como: adornos, peluches, muñecas, etc., además, ha instalado una pequeña librería en el que vende cuadernos y útiles de escritorio. Antes de ingresar en este negocio se dedicaba a la venta de ropa por el cual viajaba a Lima para traer algunos pedidos que le hacían anticipadamente pero abandono el negocio porque salio embarazada y no podía viajar; por lo cual consiguió un puesto en donde ofrecer varios productos.

La señora Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos en oferta de los catálogos de “esika”.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en seis meses lo invertirá en comprar útiles escolares y uniformes de colegio para la campaña escolar.

Su mayor sueño es alquilar un stand en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo, en el que venda productos de belleza.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Edita Sebastiana's Group

texts.en:
Silvia, Feliciana and Edita have been part of the Legioncito Comunal Bank for 3,5 and 3 years respectively.

Silvia is 31 years old, married with 3 children. Three years ago Silvia opened a little grocery store in her home.

Felicia is 48 years old with 1 child and single. Felicia travels to different Ayacucho fairs where she sales fruits and from there she brings cereal, animals and other products to sell in her home town.

Edita is 48 years old widow with 4 children. She sells typical food at the door of her rented house. In the evenings she sells desserts. Edita washes clothes by hand to make more money.

Silvia, Feliciana and Edita need a loan of 400 soles, 1200 soles and 600 soles, respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, eggs, pigs, wheat, pasta, potatoes and meat.

The dreams of Silvia, Feliciana and Edita are to have their own established business, to build their own house and to send their children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia, Feliciana y Edita pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legioncito hace 3, 5, 3 años respectivamente.

Silvia es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Silvia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 3 años con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Por otro lado Feliciana es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Feliciana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de Ayacucho, donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, productos que son vendidos en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Edita es viuda, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Edita vende comida en la puerta de su vivienda que es alquilada, por las noches vende picarones (postre). Además Edita lava ropa ajena.

Silvia, Feliciana y Edita necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 1200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, huevo, ovejas, cerdos, cebada, trigo, fideo, papa y carne.

Los sueños de Silvia, Feliciana y Edita son que sus hijos sean mejores que ellas y profesionales, tener casa propia y que su negocio sea próspero.

loans.use: Silvia, Feliciana y Edita necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 1200 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, huevo, ovejas, cerdos, cebada, trigo, fideo, papa y carne.

loans.name: Norma Marcela

texts.es:
Señora Norma Marcela López R. is 43 years old and studied completely through secondary school. Now she has three kids but only one still depends on her. She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Perú.

Señora Norma travels on Tuesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays to the district of Casa Grande in the province of Ascope in La Libertad, Perú. She makes sales with a little travelling shop that she attained many years ago. She takes advantage of the summer to carry around all types of sandals, which she sells at a very affordable price that's within reach of her clients. She began her business together with her husband. Before she worked for other people in shoe shops, and while she worked there, she learned how to make this product. From there grew the idea of opening up her shoe business.

She is a member of the community bank "Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos" (God Guides Our Steps), where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With that money she bought all the material necessary to make sandals for children and adults.

With the loan of 300 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she has planned to buy five dozen shoe soles, eight meters of leather, glue, and special boxes for shoes.

Her great dream is to have a bigger shop for making all types of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Norma Marcela López R. tiene 43 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Actualmente tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Norma viaja los días martes, sábados y domingos al distrito de Casa Grande en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú, vende en condición de ambulante en un pequeño sitio que consiguió hace muchos años. Aprovecha el verano para llevar todo tipo de sandalias el cual lo vende a un precio muy cómodo, que esta al alcance de sus clientes. Su negocio lo inicio junto con su esposo. Anteriormente trabajaba para otras personas en talleres de calzado; mientras permaneció allí aprendió a elaborar este producto. De esa manera nace la idea de emprender el negocio del calzado.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo el material necesario para elaborar sandalias para niñas y adultos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses tiene pensado comprar cinco docenas de planta, 8 metros de cuero, pegamento y cajas especiales para calzado.

Su mayor sueño es tener un taller mas grande para elaborar todo tipo de calzado.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products for making shoes.

loans.name: Santos Doris

texts.es:
Santos Doris A. G. is 30 years old. She studied up to her first year in secondary school. In present day she is single and doesn’t have any children. She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, in the providence of Trujillo, and in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She sells gelatin and flan every morning in the market of La Hermelinda. She’s been selling gelatin and flan for 18 years. In a large container she carries the cups of gelatin and goes around the market selling it. She was shy at first, but quickly adapted. Now not only does she sell things in cups, but in also in bags which sell at a more affordable price.

She is a member of the communal bank, “ Dios Guia Nuestros Pasos” where she obtained her first loan of 300 Soles. With that loan she bought ingredients necessarily for making flan and gelatin. With an upcoming loan of 800 Soles, which she pay back in 4 months, she hopes to buy a case of a thousand spoons, cups and two large sacks of gelatin, flan and sugar.

Ultimately she hopes to increase her business and sell flan and gelatin all over the city.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Santos Doris A. G. tiene 30 años de edad, estudio hasta el primer año de secundaria. Actualmente es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Ella vende gelatina y flan todas las mañanas por el mercado La Hermelinda. En una fuente lleva los vasos de gelatina, recorre por todo este mercado en busca de clientes. Desde la edad de 18 años se dedica a este negocio empezó con 50 vasos de gelatina, al principio tenia un poco de vergüenza. Poco a poco se fue adaptando al negocio, posteriormente elaboraba en mayor cantidad. Ahora no solo reparte en vasos sino también en bolsas y a un precio más cómodo.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el que compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de gelatina y flan.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprara un millar de cucharas, un millar de vasos, dos sacos de gelatina y flan, y azúcar.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio, contratar personas con el fin de repartir la gelatina por otros mercados, y si es posible por toda la ciudad.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy ingredients for preparing her desserts.

loans.name: Doris' Group

texts.en:
Haydee, Martha and Doris have been part of the Legioncito Comunal Bank for 2,2,1 years respectively. They learned to be responsible, punctual and mainly to save.

Haydee is 37 years old with 2 children. Haydee makes empanadas and desserts, which are baked in a rented oven, and sells them in street fairs.

Martha is 36 years old, married with 2 children. Martha has a small convenience stO., which is run from her home. Additionally she makes chocolates, which are exported to Colombia. Her son helps her in this activity.

Doris is 23 years old, married and has 1 child. Doris sells spices, which she makes herself, in the “Las Americas” farmers market.

Haydee, Martha and Doris need a loan of 600 soles, 400 soles and 400 soles, respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of flower, sugar, chocolate, nuts, pepper and cumin.

The dreams of Haydee, Martha and Doris are to have their own established business, to build their own house and to send their children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Haydee, Martha y Doris pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legioncito hace 2, 2, 1, años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar y administrar bien el dinero.

Haydee es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Haydee hace empanadas y otros postres que son horneados en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Nery García ambulantemente.

Por otro lado Martha es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Martha tiene una bodega surtida en su casa. Además, Martha hace chocolates rellenos D. manjar, productos que envía a Colombia, actividad que realiza con su hijo.

Mientras que Doris es casada, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Doris venD. condimentos en el mercado Las Américas, productos que elL. misma prepara.

Haydee, Martha y Doris necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. harina, azúcar, chocolate D. cobertura, manjar, ají, maní, pimienta, comino.

Los sueños D. Haydee, Martha y Doris son tener una empresa, brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos, construcción D. casa y mejorar su calidad D. vida.

loans.use: Haydee, Martha and Doris need a loan of 600 soles, 400 soles and 400 soles, respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of flower, sugar, chocolate, nuts, pepper and cumin.

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es:
Santos Victoria G. M. is 52 years old. She was unable to complete primary school. She has 6 kids, whom depend on her. She is very optimistic towards what she does. She lives in the district of Florencia, providence of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She earns a living by selling bread, cakes, and other goodies. Despite having ups and downs in her business, she’s been able to get back on her feet, and now in addition to selling bread, she sells rice, milk sugar, oil and other items.

She is a member of the communal bank “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II” (guide guide our steps). She was invited to join by a neighbor. She obtained her first loan of 300 Soles, which she used to buy flour. With the other loans that she received she was able to make large quantities of bread and to make her business grow. She went from making bread from 5 sacks of flour to making it with 25 sacks. With her prior loan she made hundreds of loafs of bread. Also, she took advantage of the Christmas season, and she was able to sell a lot and make money.

With a loan of 500 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy two sacks of flour, sugar, lard, yeast, salt and firewood. Her biggest dream is to own a bakery in her neighborhood and distribute bread throughout her district.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Santos Victoria G. M. tiene 52 años de edad, con grado de instrucción primaria incompleta y con 6 hijos actualmente 2 dependen de ella, es una señora muy optimista en su negocio. Vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo. Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Ella desde hace muchos años se dedica a la elaboración de pan, roscas, bizcochos y pasteles a pesar que tuvo algunas caídas en el negocio se ha vuelto a levantar y ahora no solo vende pan sino también algunos productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.

La señora Santos ingresó al Bancos Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II” por invitación de una vecina; obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró harina. Con los otros créditos que recibió elaboró pan en mayor cantidad y el negocio fue creciendo antes elaboraba pan solo con 5 sacos de harina y actualmente lo hace con 25 sacos. Con su anterior préstamo elaboro cientos de panes ya que aprovecho la campaña navideña la cual le fue muy bien.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el que pagara en cuatro meses comprará 2 sacos de harina, azúcar, manteca, levadura, sal y leña ya que su mayor sueño es tener una gran panadería a disposición de su barrio y también distribuir pan en todo su distrito.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy ingredients for preparing her goods.

loans.name: Telvina

texts.es:
Telvina C. Garcia D. A. she is 59 years old. She studied to only the third graD.. She has two children, but neither one of them depend on her. She lives in sector El Cortijo, in the province of Trujillo, and in the department La Liberated-Peru.

She has a place in the market El Cortijo, where she sells vegetables, condiments and other food items. She trys to buy the best products and supplies at the best prices in order to please her customers and make a profit. She buys her products from a marketplace called “La Hermelinda”. She goes there every morning before she opens her business. She has had her business for a very long time, but before she got the stand, her business was ambulatory.

She belongs to communal bank “Nuevo Peru”. She received her first loan from the communal bank for 300 Soles. With this money she bought a little bit of everything in order to have more variety in her stand.

With the loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 2 large sacks of rice, 1 large sack of sugar, one box of oil, legumes, tuna and variety of vegetables

Her dream is to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Telvina C. García D. A. tiene 59 años D. edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado D. primaria. Tiene dos hijos pero ninguno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Tiene un puesto ubicado en el mercado zonal El Cortijo, en el que venD. verduras, abarrotes y condimentos; para tener una mayor utilidad compra al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” todos los días muy temprano antes D. abrir su negocio. Hace muchos años que tiene este negocio a diferencia que antes vendía en condición D. ambulante.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compro D. todo un poco para tener variedad en su puesto.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 que los pagara en cuatro meses comprara dos sacos D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, una caja D. aceite, menestras, atún y verduras en general.

Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio más granD..

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Victoria Margarita

texts.es:
Victoria is 48 years of age, and she graduated from high school. She has three sons but only supports two of them. She lives in the district El Cortijo, in the province of Trujillo and in the department La Libertad.

She sells fuels in the local market “El Cortijo”. She sells kerosene, rum, charcoal, briquettes, alcohol, and petroleum. She buys at wholesale prices in the local market “La Hermelinda” in order to sell at a higher price. This way be able to earn a profit. She and her husband also have another business, which is buying and selling products for hardware stores. They take trips to the city of Lima to buy the products and then sell them to different hardware stores in the city of Trujillo. Her business started when she realized that stands where for sale in the market place. She started by selling groceries, but there was a lot of competition. She then had the idea to sell fuels and presently she is the only person that these products.

She is a founding member of the communal bank “Nuevo Perú”. She received her first loan of 300 Soles. She used this loan to buy different fuels but only a small quantity of each one.

With the loan of 1,500 Soles, which she will pay off in four months, she will buy half a cylinder of kerosene, a big bag of charcoal, a can of rum, and buy 50 briquettes. Plus she will buy a small quantity of hardware products.

Her biggest dream is to install a hardware store in her neighborhood or in the local market “Tacora” located in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Victoria tiene 48 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene tres hijos pero solo dos dependen D. ella. Vive en el distrito El Cortijo en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad.

Ella venD. combustible en el mercado zonal “El Cortijo” tal como: kerosene, petróleo, alcohol, ron, carbón y briquetas. Compra al por mayor en el mercado La Hermelinda para vender a mayor precio y D. esa manera tener ganancias. Aparte junto con su esposo tiene otro negocio que es la compra y venta D. productos D. ferretería por el cual viaja a la ciudad D. Lima para comprar, lo distribuye por las diferentes ferreterías D. la ciudad D. Trujillo. Su negocio se inicia cuando se entero que vendían puestos, empezó vendiendo abarrotes pero había mucha competencia así que tuvo la idea D. vender combustible y actualmente es la única que ofrece estos productos.

La señora Victoria es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero para comprar combustible D. todo un poco.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comparará medio cilindro D. kerosene, un saco D. carbón, una lata D. ron y medio ciento D. briquetas además una parte lo destinara para comprar un poco D. productos D. ferretería.

Su mayor sueño es instalar una ferretería en su domicilio o por el mercado “tacora” ubicado en la ciudad D. Trujillo.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy products for sale.

loans.name: Yessy Lidia

texts.es:
Yessy Lidia Rodríguez Ángeles is 27 years old, single and does not have children. She studied to be a primary school teacher and she works at a private school. She also owns her own business. She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, in the province of Trujillo and in the department of La libertad, Perú.

She has a small store where she sells items that everyone needs and wants, like soft drinks, beer and school supplies. In addition, she prepares and sells treats. Since she finished her education at the university, she began to save the salary that she made as a teacher and invest the money in starting her store. By doing this she has been able to help her mother and brothers.

She belongs to the communal bank “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” (God Guide Our Steps). She obtained her first loan for 300 Soles through this bank and she was able to purchase five boxes of beer and soft drinks.

With a loan of 700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy school supplies to resell, since the school year in just beginning Perú. She will also buy four boxes of soft drinks and various food items, like milk, oils, sugar, rice, noodles, etc.

Her dream is to be the principal of the school where she is presently a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Yessy Lidia Rodríguez Ángeles tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene ningún hijo; estudio superior completa la carrera de educación primaria, actualmente se encuentra laborando en un colegio particular, además de tener su propio negocio. Vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú.

Tiene una bodega en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, cerveza y un poco de útiles escolares. Además prepara marcianos y raspadillas. Desde que termino su carrera universitaria se dedico a ejercerla con el sueldo que ganaba fue ahorrando para implementar una bodega, de esa manera ayuda económicamente a su madre y hermanos.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró cinco cajas de cerveza y gaseosas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 que los cancelara en cuatro meses comprara útiles escolares ya que aprovechara la campaña escolar además comprará cuatro cajas de gaseosas y una variedad de abarrotes: leche, aceite, azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su mayor sueño es ser directora del colegio en el que actualmente trabaja.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia, Elvira and Karina have been part of the Legioncito Comunal Bank for 1 year, 4 months and 4 months respectively. They learned to be responsible, punctual and mainly to save.

Sofia is 32 years old with 3 children. Sofia and her husband have a small mechanical heavy machinery shop. In addition, Sofía is planning on starting a new business of selling machinery parts.

Elvira is 19 years old and single. Elvira sells clothes. She brings them from Lima. Additionally Elvira and her sister buy toys wholesale and resale them in street fairs.

Karina is 24 years old and has 1 son. Karina buys chickens from the farms and sells them in the fairs. Karina is working on having her own farm.

Sofía, Elvira and Karina need a loan of 400 suns, 400 suns, 1200 suns respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of coats, trousers, chickens and school supplies.

The dreams of Sofía, Elvira and Karina are that their children would go to college, to build their own house and to have a farm.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Sofía, Elvira y Karina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legioncito hace 1 año, 4 meses, 4 meses respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables y puntuales.

Sofía es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Sofía junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico de maquinaria pesada. Además Sofía iniciará un nuevo negocio de venta de repuestos en un local alquilado.

Por otro lado Elvira es soltera y tiene 19 años, Elvira vende ropa, sus productos son traídos de la ciudad de Lima. Además por campaña trae juguetes que vende junto a su hermana en la feria de las Nazarenas.

Mientras que Karina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Karina vende pollos para criar, los compra en las granjas y los vende en las ferias. Karina esta implementando su propia granja.

Sofía, Elvira y Karina necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 400 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, pantalones, pollos bebes y para los útiles de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Sofía, Elvira y Karina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa, tener una tienda propia y una granja.

loans.use: Sofía, Elvira and Karina need a loan of 400 suns, 400 suns, 1200 suns respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of coats, trousers, chickens and school supplies.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a very hard-working woman and mother of three children, and she is responsible for supporting all the family. Her husband is a public employee and doesn’t have a good salary. “I’m the leader of the house”, she says.

Petronila sells a collection of chic pants, blouses, slippers and shoes to women of the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo. As she doesn’t have a locale to run the business out of, the entrepreneur visits friends, neighbors and other people of the surroundings in order to sell her goods.

Petronila’s dream is to have a very big clothing store "with millions of products and thousands of loyal customers". With her loan, Petronila will purchase more goods to add to her stock.

loans.use: purchase of clothing to supply her small business

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Doctora

texts.en:
Doctora P., mother of four children, is a budding entrepreneur who lives in the Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. One year ago, she took from FSMA a loan with which she started a small business selling silver jewelry. The entrepreneur invested the funds wisely and she has managed to make her business successful. Currently she has a well-established clientele which is growing.

Doctora plans on using her loan to enlarge her stock, adding new styles of earrings and rings which are in high demand by her customers. Doctora’s business supports her children’s education and the rent for the family’s house.

loans.use: purchase of silver jewelry for her small business

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Huklla Llamkasun Group

texts.en:
“Huklla Llamkasun” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with educational services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level). People who live there also face the cold, difficulty growing crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Huklla Llamkasun” is located in the community of Añancusi in the district of Acoria, province of Huancavelica. The translation of the Quechua-name of the group is “Let´s work as if we were one”. The main activities of the population are growing tropical fruits at lower altitudes and corn, potatoes and wheat at higher altitudes. At still higher altitudes, the people are dedicated to raising bulls and cows, with alpacas and lamas at the highest altitudes. But the size of the community and its (limited) access to public transport has brought more commerce to the village; every Tuesday there is a local market where people sell and buy most of what they need.

This bank has been formed recently by 17 female borrowers and therefore has no history yet…. It has only just started to create history in its community! The expectations working with FINCA Peru are very clear: increase business and save. For all members, the main use of the savings they will be generating from now on is for investing in their business or for the education of their children, whether it is buying school uniforms, supplies, books or even to pay the fees for entering primary or secondary school.

Although many women dedicate their time to similar businesses, they require different loan amounts because of the differences in the size of the business they run …. The loans range from 200 soles, 300 soles, up to 500 soles; the total of the loans of the 17 members is 5,400 soles (US$ 1925).

One of the group members, Lucila R. Nolberta, sells fruit at local markets. Another business she runs is raising small cattle. As is the case in most families, besides her business, she dedicates most of her time to the cultivation of potatoes, wheat, and oca (a root vegetable), which she uses for home consumption. With her 200 soles loan she will be able to buy more fruits. When asked about her future, she tells us that her dream is the education of her children so they can be professionals and go on studying. She simply wants to make her life and that of her family better. With her (future) savings she plans to buy more chickens and pigs, to sell when they have grown big.

Juliana D. Marín, who sells clothes and shoes in her small shop, tells us a slightly different story. Like Lucila, Juliana grows potatoes, wheat, and other crops for home consumption. With her loan of 500 soles, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business. With more merchandise, she will be able to earn a little more and therefore save more. Her dream for the future is to live a good life with her family and her children. Her expectations in working with FINCA Peru are to learn to work harder and be more responsible.

loans.use: expanding their various small businesses

loans.name: Kim-Ean

texts.en:
Kim-Ean S. and her husband, Van Keo, have been married for seventeen years. They have four children—three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school and the youngest one still stays at home. Their house is located along the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. S. has been a tailor for seventeen years, a skill she learned from her sister. Her husband has been a policeman for twenty years.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for the third time. She is asking for $300 to help purchase a motorbike for family use.

loans.use: To help purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Sokhum C. (pictured with his wife, sons, and nephew) and his wife, Choeun Pin, have been married for eight years. They have two sons. One of his sons is in school and the youngest one stays at home. Their house is located along Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. C. has been selling ice cream for three years. He makes it himself for resale around the village. His wife farms. Now she wants to create another business raising pigs.

Mr. C. is requesting a loan for the first time, asking for $500 to purchase feed and baby pigs for his wife to raise.

loans.use: For buying feed and baby pigs to raise

loans.name: Siros

texts.en:
Siros M. and her husband, Neang Ham, have been married for seven years. They have two sons. One of their sons is in school and the youngest one stays at home. Their house is located along the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. and her husband have been fishing since they were young. They fish in the Mekong River and sell the fish at Prek Anchanh Market, about five kilometers from their village.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for the first time. She is asking for $150 to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Iv

texts.en:
Mrs. Iv S., age 40, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land planting vegetables and normally she earns around $4 in revenue a day. Her husband Mr. Buntha, 36, is a taxi-driver with a daily income $5 a day. They have 3 children.
One is married and lives away from home and one other is a student. Another  stays at home to help her planting the vegetables.
She needs to request a loan from Kiva to hire a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To hire a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Hasary

texts.en:
Hasary M. and his wife, Afiny Kob, have been married for seven years. They have one daughter. Their house is located on the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mr. M. has been a construction worker for seven years. In addition to doing construction work, he sells personal beauty products, traveling by motorbike around his village and in a nearby province. 

Mr. M. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $500 to purchase a motorbike for selling personal beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for selling personal beauty products

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheak P. (pictured with his mother and brother) is single and lives with his widowed mother. He has three brothers and three sisters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house and other two sisters are working in a garment factory. His youngest brother is in primary school. Their house is along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. P. has been an electrician for two years, a skill he learned at a technical school in Phnom Penh. Currently he works in Phnom Penh.

Mr. P. is requesting a loan for the fourth time. He is asking for $500 for filling in the land around the family house.

loans.use: For filling in the land around the family house

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoeun S. and his wife, Yun Kong, have been married since 1989. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. One of their daughters weaves silk at home and other three children are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. has run a horse cart for two years. He carries firewood for resale around his village. In addition to running the horse cart, he has been a chef for wedding ceremonies for four years. His wife weaves silk at home.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the second time. He is asking for $1000 to purchase a horse along with some silk for his daughter and his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for the horse cart and silk for weaving

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry M. and her husband have been married for twenty five years. They have five children—three sons and two daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives outside the family home. as for the other four children, two are employed full time and other two are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. has been a fish seller for twenty five years. She buys the fish in her village for resale at market. Her husband is a security guard at a company in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for the second time. She is asking for $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for his work, and to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale and a motorbike

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun S. and his wife have been married since 1975. They have six children—four sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. As for the other three, one sells flowers, another is an artist, and the youngest is in school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. and his wife have been farming since 1979. They grow bananas, jasmine flowers, and longans on the farm near their home. In addition to growing crops, they buy bananas and longans from farmers in the village to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the fourth time. He is asking for $1200 to buy bananas, flowers, and longans for resale, and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: For purchasing fertilizer, flowers, and bananas

loans.name: Sovannathou

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannathou and his wife have been married for twenty one years. They have three children—one son and two daughters. Two of their children are employed full time and other one is in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. has been selling watches for fifteen years. He buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in Treng Trayoeng Market (Kam Pong Spoe Province). His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $1000 to purchase watches for resale.

loans.use: To purchase watches for resale

loans.name: Sakhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhun B. and her husband were married in 1973. They have three children—one son and two daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in the family home. One of the other children works in a garment factory, and other is in secondary school. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. B. has been selling Cambodian fruit (mangoes, jujubes, guavas and other kinds of local fruit) for twenty five years. She buys the fruit at a market and resells it in her village. Her husband raises cows.

Mrs. B. is requesting a loan for the third time. She is asking for $500 to purchase cows for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Miss Sophoin C., 34, is single and lives with her sister. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss C. is in the business of weaving silk. She has been a silk weaver for twenty two years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products in her village.

Miss C. is requesting her third loan, asking for $200 to purchase silk for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarat O. has been married for twenty five years. She has six children—two sons and four daughters. Three of her children are employed full time and the other three are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. O. has been a farmer since she was young. She grows rice on the farm near the village. Her husband is seriously ill.

Mrs. O. is requesting a loan for the second time. She is asking for $100 to pay a fee for plowing.

loans.use: To pay a fee for plowing

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan E. and his wife have been married for over twenty years. They have four children—three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives in the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers and the youngest is in school. The family lives in Mekong River’s Island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. E. has been a Khmer traditional musician for over twenty years. Besides playing traditional music he also drives a motor taxi. His wife farms.

Mr. E. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $1000 to help fund the building of a house for his daughter.

loans.use: To help fund the building of a house for his daughter

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.en:
R. Abduhakim is 37 years old. He is married with five children. During the last four years, Abduhakim has raised cattle for sale. He fattens the animals for slaughter or sales in the local market. At the same time, Abduhakim is working as a foreman in the association of farms. However, the breeding and sales of the animals is the main source of income for Abduhakim and his family. The children of Abdulhakim help the father in looking after the cattle.

Working amidst a strong competition in order to make his business more profitable, Abduhakim is planning to increase the stock of animals and to purchase the cattle. He requests $975.00 for the term of 12 months. This is Abduhakim's first loan, and he promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to increase stock.

loans.name: Sohib

texts.en:
Sohib is 19 years old. In spite of his young age, Sohib is supporting his mother and younger brother. Since he was seventeen Sohib has been running his business manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. Sohib's father trained Sohib, who inherited the business from him.
