Now Sohib is dreaming of improving the working conditions of his shop. He dreams of providing the best quality in the neighborhood. After two years of operation, Sohib is applying for a loan for the first time. He requests $600.00 for the term of 12 months. Sohib would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials, like lumber, and improve working conditions.

loans.name: Negmat

texts.en:
Y. Negmat is 48 years old. He is married with five children. Negmat's background is that of a tractor driver. Negmat provides tractor services to his fellow villagers for working their lands. At the same time, together with his elder son, Negmat purchases and sells cows and calves.

He is a hard-working person, and thus Negmat has managed to make these two businesses stable. He is able to support his family. Now Negmat is planning to purchase spare parts to fix his tractor. At the same time, he wants to increase his stock of animals for sale, and purchase more calves. He requests $950.00 for the term of 12 months. He's had one loan already and proved his reliability. Negamt promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase calves, and spare parts for his tractor.

loans.name: Olim

texts.en:
M. Olim is 46 years old. Olim has been running his business for the last 17 years. He is a master of fixing vehicles. At the same time he is providing taxi services. Being a very hard-working person, Olim managed to make his business successful, and generates stable profits for his family.

Now, however, Olim wants to improve the quality of his services. He is planning to purchase spare parts required for his auto repair shop. This is why today he requests $600.00 for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Olim, and he wants to ensure everyone supporting him that he shall be able to repay it on time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts required for fixing vehicles.

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Ms. Khanifa is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 44, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.

Khanifa owns a small herd of milk cows. She sells milk in the Saatli bazaar. Her family expenditures are increasing as her children grow. Khanifa plans to increase the number of cattle to increase her income. But this project requires an investment. This winter, Khanifa has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $600 USD . She hopes this credit will let her change her family life.

loans.use: To buy cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Fozil

texts.en:
S. Fozil is 45 years old. He is married with two sons. For more than fifteen years, Fozil has run a joiner’s shop, manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. The elder son of Fozil is also involved in the business.

The current business is quite profitable and generates a stable income, allowing Fozil to support his family and improve the living conditions. Fozil is respected as a good master in his neighborhood. Now he needs to purchase materials like lumber for his manufacturing shop. He is requesting $600.00 for the term of 12 months. This is his first loan, and Fozil promises to repay it on time, and he thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for his manufacturing business.

loans.name: Shargiyya

texts.en: Ms. Shargiyya is a 20-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She breeds cattle in her yard. She has been engaged in this business for more than 4 years. She raises calves and sells them alive in the local market and to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. Shargiyya  wants to develop this business; to increase the number of cows. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $600 USD.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Samara

texts.en: Samara is a 49-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband's family and her two children. She and her husband breed cattle in their yard. They have been engaged in this business since 2003 and now are quite experienced in this business. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where it is only source of income when there are no other jobs, and it can bring good income. Samara wants to develop this business and to increase the number of calves she raises. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en: Shafiga is a 43-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband's family and her two children. She and her husband breed cattle in their yard. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. They also sell milk and other dairy products. Shafiga wants to increase the number of cows. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $500 USD.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru:
Gulmahmad A. lives in the region Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 58 years old, married, and has 7 children. He is in the business of selling spare parts for cars. He owns a space in the central market. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Also, this business helps local residents purchase necessary spare parts for their cars. Gulmahdat has a very small amount of money in his business cycle and this limits his ability to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is asking for the loan so he could increase his inventory. Using the credit, he will be able to attract new customers and meet the demand. This will significantly help him to improve his business. He will be paying off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизов Гулмахмад Собирович проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 58 лет , женат и имеет 7 детей. Занимается торговлей запасных частей для автомашин . Имеет торговую точку на центральном районном рынке. Этот бизнес единственный источник дохода его семьи. Его деятельность позволяет населению покупать необходимые запчасти для своих автомашин. Но у клиента маленькая оборотная сумма и поэтому ему не хватает денег для того чтобы увеличить ассортимент, поэтому он запланировал получить кредит, зачем обратился к нам. Увеличив ассортимент клиент сможет привлечь новых клиентов , а так же удовлетворить спрос потребителей. Это очень поможет ему сделать свой бизнес лучше.Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
B. Rohat is 28 years old. This young and brave woman is raising her daughter . She supports her family; her husband left for Russia to work, and now he cannot attain remittance. So Rohat is the main bread winner, and she has to work hard. Rohat has been running her business for 8 years.

She purchases young cattle in the local market, fattens them, and sells them in the local markets. As a rule, she sells the fattened animals and buys the young ones once a week. With the help of a loan, she is planning to develop the business and to increase the income for her family.

This is her fist loan and she is so grateful for those who trusted her and decided to support her. Rohat promises to do her best in order to able to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her capital to expand the business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Hilvat

texts.ru:
Hilvat Valievna A. lives in Yavan, Tajikistan. She is 43, married with 4 children. She has a medical education and works as a nurse in the local ambulatory clinic. Her husband is unemployed. Hilvat’s salary is so low that it’s not enough even to buy milk for the children. Hilvat wants to buy a cow to provide milk for her family and to sell the excess, if any, to her neighbors, who have no cows either. She plans to do this at a price lower than the local market price. It would really help her family as well as her neighbors. She needs a loan to make her dream come true. She plans to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Азимова Хилват Валиевна проживает в городе Яван. Замужем , имеет 4 детей. Ей 43 года. Образование Средне-специальное. По профессии медсестра. Муж нигде не работает. Сама она работает в местной поликлинике , медсестрой. Зарплата очень маленькая , ей не хватает даже на молоко детям, поэтому клиентка хочет купить корову , которая будет давать молоко для ее семьи , а если будет лишнее сможет продавать соседям , таким же как она у которых нет коровы по доступной цене , ниже рыночной. Это будет помощью как для ее семьи , так и для ее соседей. Но для этого она должна получить кредит , который поможет выполнить ее планы. А погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Jafar.

texts.ru:
Jafar S. lives in Yavan, Tajikistan. He is 48, married with 10 children. He has no education and no regular job outside his house and raises livestock at home. He usually buys a few young bull-calves, raises them for 40-45 days and then sells them at a fair market price. After selling one or two bull-calves he buys another one or two, starts to raise them, while trying to sell the rest at the local market before they grow too big. This is one of the most popular businesses in the countryside which is especially profitable in spring and summer. Jafar has been doing this for 15 years already. Due to the bad weather this winter his business was slow and he needs a loan to buy one more bull-calf. It would help him to restore the business and to provide the income which his family needs so badly. He is planning to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Саидов Джафар живет в городе Яван . Возраст 48 лет , женат и имеет 10 детей. Образования не имеет. Клиент нигде не работает , но занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. После того как он продаст одно или двух бычков на их место он покупает новых , начинает их откармливать , а оставшихся бычков выводит на рынок для продажи , пока те еще не подросли до нужного уровня. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности , поэтому дает доход, тем более весной и летом. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 15 лет.На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с погодными условиями зимой и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Он хочет купить еще одного бычка. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев

loans.use: To buy bull-calves

loans.name: Pardahol

texts.ru:
Pardahol U. lives in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. She is 38, married with no children. She has a high school education and works in the private sector. She buys raw nuts (pistachio and almonds) from farmers, dries them, sorts them out and roasts them in the oven. After this she sells nuts at the market, where she rents a sale kiosk. In spring when there is no new crop yet, prices for raw nuts are higher, so Pardahol needs more money to buy them. A loan would help her to support her business and to keep the current price of her product, which in turn would help to keep her old customers and to attract new ones. Her customers would be able to buy a healthy product at an affordable price. This is why Pardahol is asking for a loan and plans to repay it in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Умарова Пардахол проживает в городе Турсун-заде.Ей 38 лет , она замужем и не имеет детей. Образование среднее. Занимается частным бизнесом. Торгует на рынке города орехами (фисташки и миндаль). Скупает орехи в сыром виде у дехкан , сушит , перебирает и жарит в духовке. После такой обработки выносит на рынок и продает. Арендует торговую точку в центре базара. С приходом весны еще нет свежей продукции и по этой причине цены на продаваемый товар возросли. Это спровоцировало дефицит денег у клиентки. Кроме того , чтобы запастись товаром до появления нового урожая клиентке нужны деньги. Она закупит сырье , тем самым обеспечив свой бизнес. Еще это поможет сохранить цены на продаваемую продукцию , что даст возможность населению покупать необходимый для здоровья продукт питания и не потерять клиентов, а еще привлечь новых. Поэтому клиентка решила получить кредит. А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Amirali

texts.ru:
Amirali A. lives in the town Yavan. He is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He is not employed, but he is occupied by cattle breeding, which is the single source of income for his family. He usually purchases cattle, feeds it for 40 to 45 days, and then resells it for the meat market. He saw an opportunity to increase his turnover by using a loan so he turned to MLF HUMO. The loan will help him to purchase more cattle and derive an additional income that is so needed for his family. Apart from that, his customers will be able to purchase more cattle and provide the local residents with more meat. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Астонаев Амирали проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 24 года , женат и имеет 1 ребенка.Нигде не работает , но занимается животноводством , что является основным источником дохода его семьи. Скупает молодых бычков , откармливает 40-45 дней и продает на мясо , мясникам. Появилась возможность получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот , поэтому клиент обратился к нам .Это поможет клиенту увеличить поголовье скота. После этого у него появится возможность получить дополнительный доход для своей семьи, который ему так не хватает. Кроме того покупатели , которые покупают у клиента животных , смогут получить дополнительную возможность купить бычка и обеспечить население мясом. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Djumanazar

texts.en:
B. Djumanazar is 55 years old. He and his wife have raised five children. The eldest children are involved in the family business of fattening cattle. This family business is the main source of income for this large family. They have had good success developing the business for the last 8 years. Djumanazar is a very responsible and accurate person. 
He requests $525.00 for the term of 12 months. He is very happy he is getting the loan, because it will provide him with the opportunity to develop his business. Djumanazar is applying for a loan for the first time. He hopes there will be people who trust and support him. For his part, he would like to promise to do his best to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To increase his capital to maintain his business, and increase income for the family.

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.ru:
Mirzokarim N. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 5 children. He works as a tinsmith mainly producing custom orders. This is not a very stable source of income. The main source of Mirzokarim's income, however, is agriculture. He owns a piece of land, where he plants potatoes and wheat. To plant, he needs good quality seeds and fertilizers, which Mirzokarim cannot afford. For this reason, he is asking for a loan.

After collecting crops, he will be able to provide the market with quality products, attract new customers, and obtain sufficient profits. In addition, he will be able to provide his family with flour and potatoes for a long period of time (potatoes and flour products are the main foods consumed by residents of the region). He is planning to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Назаров Мирзокарим проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает жестянщиком на заказ. Это не стабильный заработок клиента. Основным источником дохода его семьи и основным видом деятельности клиента является сельское хозяйство. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. На засев земли необходимы качественные семена и удобрения , на покупку которых у клиента нет средств. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. После получения качественного урожая клиент сможет обеспечить рынок качественной продукцией , привлечь новых клиентов и получить неплохой доход. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить свою семью мукой и картофелем на долгое время , так как основным продуктом питания населения является мука( хлеб и хлебные изделия) и картофель. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en:
K. Bibigul is 50 years old. She has run her business for six years. Bibigul purchases young cattle and sells them in the local market after fattening. At the same time, she is growing crops and selling them in the market. Moreover, Bibigul is growing nuts, like filberts, walnuts, and she sells these also in the local markets. 
As you see, Bibigul is full of energy and is working hard to support her family and provide for her children. Today Bibigul is applying for a loan of $450.00 for the term of 12 months. This is the first time that Bibigul has applied for a loan. She has a particular plan, and she is sure she will be able to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of one cow.

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en: Mohammad Nahim lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He has a shoe shop. He makes shoes himself and sends them to the main bazaar of Kabul for shopkeepers to sell. His business is small so he wants to enlarge it. He requested an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his last purchase. He wants to make a good income and support his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Prisca's Upendo 2 Group

texts.en: Prisca is 23  years old, single, and has a child who is 4 years old. Prisca sells oil, diesel, kerosine and bolt. She started this sales business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7:30 am until 7 pm and is now hoping to receive a loan to buy more  items for sale. Prisca will share this loan with her sub-group member Jamila who has a food sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for a business

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.ru:
Gulomjon H. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He is 26 years old, married, and has 1 child. He works as a tractor driver, an occupation that does not provide him with steady income. The main source of his earnings, however, is agriculture. He owns a piece of land, where he plants potatoes and wheat. To plant, he needs good quality seeds and fertilizers, which Gulomjon cannot afford. For this reason, he is asking for a loan.

After collecting crops, he will be able to provide the market with quality products, attract new customers, and obtain sufficient profits. In addition, he will be able to provide his family with flour and potatoes for a long period of time (potatoes and flour products are the main foods consumed by residents of the region). He is planning to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хидиров Гуломджон проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ему 26 лет он женат и имеет 1 детей. Работает трактористом. Это не стабильный заработок клиента. Основным источником дохода его семьи и основным видом деятельности клиента является сельское хозяйство. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. На засев земли необходимы качественные семена и удобрения , на покупку которых у клиента нет средств. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. После получения качественного урожая клиент сможет обеспечить рынок качественной продукцией , привлечь новых клиентов и получить неплохой доход. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить свою семью мукой и картофелем на долгое время , так как основным продуктом питания населения является мука( хлеб и хлебные изделия) и картофель. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 43 years old, married, and has three children, their ages ranging from 3 to 27. Paulina is a cloth seller; she started her own sales business in 1999. Every day, she works from 9:30 am to 6 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$250.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items to improve the business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for a clothing sales business

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en: Zuwena is 32 years old and married. She owns a small hardware store which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 9 am to 12 pm at her store, and is now hoping for a loan to buy more items for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a hardware business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and divorced. She is a cloth seller, and has been running her business since 2004. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 25 years old and is a single woman. She owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. She works every day from 9 am to 6 pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Aisha , who has a business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol E. and his wife have been married since 1992. They have two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thol E. has been a taxi driver for eight years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife is a farm worker.

Mr. E. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $500 to buy a new motorbike for his business. This new motorbike will replace an old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace an old one

loans.name: Josephine's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old and is married with 2 children of 17 and 10. She has owned a small food vendor store since 2002. She works every day from 7 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanawetu, who also deals in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Miss Sokhoeun S., 28, is single and lives with her mother. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhoeun is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started her business in 1998. She sells her finished products in her village. Her mother has been a silk weaver for twenty years.

Sokhoeun is requesting a loan for the first time. She is asking for $200 to purchase silk for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim L., 40, and her husband, Sophorn Mean, married in 1988. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Lim is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her neighbor and started silk production in 2003. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband is a wooden house repairer.

Mrs. Lim is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Sarafina's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Sarafina is 33 years old and is a married woman with two children, aged 10 and 4. Sarafina has owned a small pharmacy since 1999, and she works every day from 7 am to 11 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Gladness and Elizabeth, who have businesses of trading and a salon.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Soheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soheng C., 41, and her husband, Sophal Nheb, married in 1991. They have five children; two sons and three daughters. One of their children weaves silk at home. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soheng is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother-in-law and started silk production in 1991. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband is a farmer.

Mrs. Soheng is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $400 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Chanthyra

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthyra, 25, is single and lives with his widowed mother. He has three brothers and one sister. All of his brothers are employed full-time and his sister weaves silk at home. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Chanthyra is in the business of weaving silk. He learned weaving from his mother and started silk production in 2003. His mother weaves silk at home, too.

Mr. Chanthyra is requesting a loan for the fifth time in the amount of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on his business success so far, he will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun Yek and his wife have been married since 2003. They have one little daughter. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bunthoeun has been a mason for ten years. His wife has been working in a garment factory for eight years. Mr. Bunthoeun is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000 to add to the capital he needs to build his house.

loans.use: To build his house

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheab Y. and her husband have been married for twenty years. They have five daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in the family home. Their son-in-law is a goldsmith. Of the other four daughters, two work in a garment factory and two are in school. The house is along the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopheap has been selling watermelon and grilling bananas for four years. Her husband has been a mason for four years.

Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $500. She will use the loan to purchase goldsmith materials for her son-in-law’s business.

loans.use: To purchase goldsmith materials for her son-in-law

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old. He is married and has 4 children. One of them is studying at university. He lives in a rented house and has a small shop for clothing sales. He applied to get $1200 to purchase new clothes with new clothes hangers. He also wants to renovate the shop, expand the area, and make advertising in order to increase his income and save for a better future for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new clothes with new clothes hangers

loans.name: Shahzadi's Group

texts.en: Shahzadi P. is from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  She has been married for 20 years  and has four sons. While Shahzadi is not educated, she strongly believes in education and has therefore enrolled all her children in school. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. This will be the second time she has borrowed in a group from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. This time, she needs a loan for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw. The other group members are: Razia B., who embroiders clothes; Suriya B., who is a widow and is borrowing for her family’s bed mattresses business; Arshad B., who also embroiders clothes; and Atia B., whose husband is a blacksmith.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,075.00.

loans.use: Fix our rickshaw

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mr. Koeun P. and his wife, Prang Sorng, have been married since 1982. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are factory workers and the other three are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Koeun has been selling cows for fifteen years. He buys cows from nearby villages to resell in another province. With the income he receives, he grows rice and buys food. His wife sells meatballs and boiled eggs in front of their house.

Mr. Koeun is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000. He would like to buy more cows to resell. He would also like to make repairs to his house.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale and to repair his house

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en: Asma I., the leader of this group, is married and has one daughter who is four years old.  Her husband is a blacksmith who specializes in making iron chains; Asma often helps him in his business. Together, they earn approximately $150 each month. They want to expand their business so that they can save enough money for their daughter’s education and future. The other group members are: Yasmeen B. and Kalsoom B., who are both borrowing for their husbands, who mold various objects out of plastic; Fahmida B., whose husband is an electrician; and Shaheen A., who embroiders clothes.  As a group, these women are requesting a loan of $1,250.00.

loans.use: To expand ability to manufacture iron chains.

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Mrs. Yu N., 58, and her husband, Sat Siv, married in 1979. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house, two children weave silk at home, and the other two children are garment factory workers. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yu is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production in 1980. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband helps her spin the silk.

She is requesting a loan for the sixth time in the amount of $700 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a motorbike to use in the family. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam F. is 43 years old and is a married woman with 10 children between the ages of 10 and 30 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 30 years old. Mariam F. has been a clothes seller since 2007, and she works every day from 10 am to 6 pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Rasoola's Group

texts.en: Rasoola B. is a widow from Lahore, a large city in Pakistan.  She has four sons, none of whom could finish school due to their father’s prolonged illness and death. One of her sons is a carpenter and wants to buy a lathe.  The other women in this group are:  Khalida B., who manufactures carpets; Abida J., who will invest in her family's business; Shumaila B., who embroiders clothes; and Najma J., who also embroiders clothes.  As a group, they are requesting a loan of $1,150.00.

loans.use: To buy a lathe.

loans.name: Asma's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Asma is 29 years old and is a single woman with one 2 year old child. Asma has been a business and trading woman since 2003. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Hadija, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Mukhtar's Group

texts.en: Mukhtar B. has been married for 30 years and has five sons and four daughters.  Her husband operates a used items business, buying used cement bags and reselling them to various factories. The other women in this group are: Haneefa B., who makes and sells snacks; Rubina B., who embroiders clothes; Asiah B., whose husband makes furniture; and Farzana B., who sells cloth.  As a group, they are requesting a loan of $1,325.00, which will be divided between them.

loans.use: To buy used cement bags in bulk.

loans.name: Maota B Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 6 women of Maota B on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Etita A. (54, married, 5 children), Kuni T. (22, married, 1 child), Tafale A. (49, married, 8 children), Menima P. (44, married, 2 children) and Eleitino L. (48, married, 4 children) all sell taro, bananas and/or pancakes (round lumps of fried bread), staples of the Samoan diet. They need loans to purchase weed-killing sprayers, chemicals, and farming equipment for the vegetable growing operations, and sugar, yeast and flour for the pancake making part of their businesses. Leuma L. (48, married, 6 children) sells pancakes and also tea and coffee.

loans.use: Purchase of weed killing sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, etc...

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem S., this group's leader, is from Lahore, Pakistan, having moved there after her marriage.  She is originally from from the mid-sized industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. She has one son and two daughters. Her son is a jeweler, and one daughter is married while the other daughter works as a helper at a nearby medical clinic. Naseem makes electric switches on order, a trade she learned from one of her cousins. She is requesting a loan so that she can manufacture electrical switches in larger quantities. Her fellow group members are: Fozia B., who runs an herbal pharmacy; Nabeela B., whose husband is a turner; Majeeda M., who buys and sells rice; and Arshad B., who operates a boutique.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,350.00.

loans.use: To increase manufacturing capacity of electrical switches.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 30 years old and is a married woman with one child who is 3 years old. Eliza owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Maila's Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Maila is 23 years old and is married with one child, age 1 year old. Maila has been selling clothes since 2007. She works every day from 7.30 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maria, who also has a business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Faga Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 7 women of Faga on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faamaimauaso T. (27, married, 2 children) will purchase knives, timber, varnish and other materials to produce fine mats.

Iseaso M. I. (37, married, 4 children) is starting a bingo business. She needs a loan to purchase bingo sets. Leatuvai T. (31, married, 1 child) will purchase a fence, taro roots, knives, a filing (knife sharpener) and planting sticks to produce cocoa.

Mele T. (37, married, 5 children) will purchase chicken legs, soy sauce, onions, Chinese onions, sauce and tin foil to bake and sell BBQ.

Merita A. (38, married, 9 children) will purchase a fishing boat, 2 nets, flashlight, a spear and a pair of goggles to fish and sell the catch 3 days a week.

Paula T. (36, married, 4 children) will purchase flour, sugar, oil, egg, baking soda, baking powder, yeast and other ingredients to bake pies, donuts, buns, etc..

Tolopa S. (45, married, 6 children) will purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, a knife, filings and an axe to cultivate and sell taro, bananas and tuamu, etc..

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a weed killing sprayer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Aneth

texts.en:
Aneth is 32 years old and is married with three children, ages 1-10. Aneth sells cosmetics, which she started doing in 1998. She works every day from 8.30 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun C. and her husband have been married since 1993. They have four children; three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Thoeun has been growing vegetables and raising pigs for fifteen years. She grows many kinds of vegetables in the farm near her house. Her husband helps with the farming and also runs a motor taxi business.

Mrs. Thoeun is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $1,000 to fill in the land around her house and to purchase material to help raise the pigs.

loans.use: To fill in the land around the house and to raise pigs

loans.name: Mong

texts.en: Mrs. Mong I., 51, lives in Trapeang Chark Village, Kampong Cham province, where she earns $2.50 per day raising pigs and farming. Her husband Thon Tharn, 50, sells wood charcoal and earns $4 per day. They have three children, all of whom work in the garment industry where they each earn $50 per month. Mong I. requests a $500 loan to purchase more pigs to raise as well as buy more land to farm. They hope this loan will increase their business income, which in turn will help support their family.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise as well as buy more land to farm

loans.name: Faga 1 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 7 women of Faga on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The women of Faga will use their loans for the following purposes:

Elise Faatu S. (56, married, 5 children) and Eve Eleni T. (47, married, 4 children) will both purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, 2 knives, filings, a planting stick and axes to cultivate and sell taro, yams, tuamu and bananas.

Filiga T. (56, married, 8 children) will purchase a fishing boat, fishing net and flashlight to catch fish and seashells.

Laulelei A. (67, married, 10 children) will purchase 4 bundles of wire, chemicals and a knife to support her taro and banana business.

Lita F. (42, married, 3 children) will purchase a sewing machine, a weed-killing sprayer, knives and filings for both her sewing and vegetable businesses.

Patouli T. (49, married, 5 children) will purchase fertilizer, a spade, chemicals and bananas for both her vegetable (bananas, etc) and pancake businesses.

Silaulelei F. (53, married, 4 children) will purchase thread, scissors and other materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, etc…

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem G., the leader of this group, has seven children and resides in the small city of Depalpur, Pakistan. Her eldest daughter is married and her other children all attend a local school, except the youngest who is still too young. Her husband works as a driver for one of the local car rentals.  She hopes to borrow for the third time from a microfinance institution for her nephew who is a partner in a beauty salon. Naseem's nephew gives her a reasonable profit every month out of his income.  The other members of this group are: Zeenat B., who requires a loan for her husband to buy him a motorbike for his motorbike rental; Sakina B., who is borrowing for her husband who is a butcher; Khursheed B., who needs this loan for her son who runs a beauty saloon; and Safia M., whose husband runs a restaurant.  Altogether, they are applying to Kiva to borrow $1,500.00.

loans.use: Become a partner

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is 35 years old and is married with one child who is 21 years old. Magreth owns a small grocery, and also sells clothes, which she started in 2004. She works every day from 10 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Chhe

texts.en: Mrs. Chhe S. is a 50-year-old widow and lives with her daughter in Muan Heur Village, Kampong Cham Province. She sells vegetables and other groceries, earning $1.25 per day. Her only child is married. S. asks for a $50 loan to purchase vegetables to sell. She hopes this investment will help improve her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: Group leader P. Z. is from Depalpur, a small town in Pakistan, and is married with seven children. Her eldest son works with her husband while all her other children attend school, except the youngest who is not of school age yet.  Her husband trades used items and has been in this business for more than ten years. P. would like to take out a loan with several other women, who are: Fazeelat B., who requires this loan to expand her family's salt store; Reshman B., whose husband works in construction and wants to buy few tools; Faiza P., whose husband runs a beetle- nut counter; and Khursheed B., who is a widow and is borrowing for her son, who manufactures traditional beds (charpai) out of wood.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,175.00.

loans.use: Expand used-items business.

loans.name: Foua Salelologa Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 5 women of Foua Salelologa on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Agalua L. (52, divorced, 10 children) has 2 years of experience in raising taro. Her children are the farmers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, 2 bush knives, a rake, a wheelbarrow and other equipment.

Lise L. (45, married, 2 children) is interested in starting both a pancake and taro business. She requires a stove, sugar, yeast, pesticides and other materials to make both the pancakes (round lumps of fried bread) and cultivate the taro. Her husband does the farming and she does the cooking. She will sell her products at the Salelologa market.

Sofia T. (45, married, 6 children) has over 2 years of experience in raising taro and bananas. She is requesting a loan to purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, a spade and the costs of labor. Her husband does the farming, and her products will be sold at the Salelologa market.

Sopo F. (43, married, 8 children) has over 2 years of experience in raising taro, yams and bananas. She is requesting a loan to purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, and a spade. Her husband does the farming, and her products will be sold at the Salelologa market. Utusala S. (50, married, 10 children) has over 2 years of experience in raising taro. She is requesting a loan to purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, a knife and 2 bush knives. Her husband does the farming and her products will be sold at the Salelologa market.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, and a spade, etc.

loans.name: Rehban's Group

texts.en: I am a group leader Rahban G.. I am married and a mother of four: three boys and one girl. All my kids are married except the youngest boy. My husband is a butcher and sells meat my youngest son also help him in the business. They also at times trade livestock. Few other women who have joined me in my group are: Zainab B. will use her share of loan to expand their sugarcane business; Nasira S. intends to increase their butchery business. Farzana B. is borrowing for their grocery store.

loans.use: Expand butcher shop

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en: The leader of this group leader is Rabia G., who is married and a mother of four, with three boys and one girl. All of her children are married except the youngest boy. Her husband is a butcher and sells meat, and her youngest son also help him in the business. They also sometimes trade livestock.  The other women in this group are: Zainab B., who will use her share of loan to expand her sugarcane business; Nasira S., who intends to increase her butchery business; and Farzana B., who is borrowing for her family's grocery store.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $1,250.00.

loans.use: To expand a butcher shop.

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mr. You K. is a 63-year-old widower who lives in Trapeang Krapeu Village, Kampong Cham Province. He makes $1.50 per day as a farmer. His daughter, You Kunthea, earns $2 per day cutting wood in a factory. K. asks for a $200 loan to purchase pigs to raise and to grow sugarcane. He hopes this loan will help him expand his business and improve his ability to support his family. The photo is of Mr. K. and his daughter Ms. You Kunthea.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and to grow sugarcane

loans.name: Zainabu's Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 33 years old and is married with one child, age 13 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, aged 28 and 35. Zainabu has been selling clothes since 2001. She works every day from 8 am to 5 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Iva B Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 9 women of Iva B on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD.  They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee.  Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. 

Alitasi T. (36, married, 1 child): purchase water cans, fertilizer and a weed killing sprayer to cultivate and sell Chinese cabbage and pumpkin.  

Faamaini L. (26, married, 3 children): purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, sack of sugar, sack of flour, and taro roots to raise and sell taro and bananas.  

Faamao M. (45, married, 10 children): purchase a sewing machine, 2 knives, fertilizer and a weed killing sprayer to both raise and sell taro and create puletasis (dresses) and uniforms. 

Faasofia S. (39, married, 6 children): purchase chemicals, fertilizer and a weed killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro, bananas, and cabbages.

Imeleta A. (59, widowed, 4 children): purchase a wheel barrow, fertilizer, a rake, roll of barbed wire and a knife to grow and sell cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers.

Mataopuaa T. (43, married, 5 children) purchase a roll of chain link fence, a rake, a pick, cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers to grow and sell cabbages, tomatoes and flowers.

Punefu S. (42, married, 4 children) purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, a knife, taro roots and a filing (knife sharpener) to grow and sell taro, bananas and yams. 

Susi P. (42, married, 6 children) purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals and fertilizer to raise and sell taro and yams.

Tuaula L. (49, married, 4 children) purchase hygiene products such as roll-on deodorant and also lavalava (wraparound skirt worn by men) to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, fertilizer and a weed killing sprayer, etc..

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 20 years old and is a single woman. Asha sells soap and cloth, which she started doing in 2007. She works every day from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Chap

texts.en: Mrs. Chap Y., 55, earns $2 per day selling blankets and nets. Her husband, But Soar, earns $1 per day repairing motorcycles and bicycles. They live with their 6 children in Porn Village, Kampong Cham Province. Their oldest son earns $50 per month as a lift worker, while their next oldest makes $70 per month as a driver for a factory. Chap Y. seeks a $150 loan to expand her inventory of blankets and nets. She will then resell these items for a profit. With this loan, she hopes to increase her daily income and provide her family with stable financial support.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of blankets and nets

loans.name: Mosula Satupaitea Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 8 women of Mosula Satupaitea on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The loans disbursed to the women will be used for the following purposes:

Asoleaga I. (39, married, 6 children): purchase fishing equipment to catch and sell fish and sea cucumbers. Atafasia G. (45, married, 8 children): purchase flour, sugar, butter and yeast to bake and sell pork cake (lumps of dough with pork in the center), donuts and snacks. Liga S. (43, married, 5 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, fertilizer, knife, filing (sharpener) and chemicals to harvest and sell cabbages, taro and tomatoes. Matuu Iuli (37, married, 6 children): purchase a box of noodles, a sack of sugar, a lantern, boots and a fishing spear to sell snacks, donuts and ice cakes (ice cream) and fish. Nuanona Lautaf (29, married, 2 children): purchase a sewing machine, fabric, pesticides and fertilizer to make T-shirts and to grow vegetables. Seilagi L. (53, married, 7 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, 4 bush knives, pesticides and fertilizer to grow and sell taro. Sita S. (51, married, 7 children): purchase a box of noodles, candy, sugar, a dozen eggs and pork cakes to make and sell snacks, ice cakes and eggs. Sivake O. (42, married, 4 children): purchase a fishing net, a weed-killing sprayer and fishing line to both grow taro and to fish.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a weed-killing sprayer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is 37 years old and is married with one child who is 20 years old. Neema owns a small food shop, which she started in 1997. She works every day from 7:30 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is 40 years old and is married with three children, ages 12-20 years old. She and her husband also take care of three other children, ages 12-20 years old. Aysha sells clothes and food, which she started doing in 2006. She works every day from 10:30 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng I. is a 52-year-old grocer from Prektahou Village, Kampong Thom Province. Lengky earns about $5 per day. Her husband, Sry Chharn, earns $3 per day as a civil servant. They have three children, two of whom are married. She requests a $300 loan to expand her grocery inventory. She hopes this loan will increase her daily income.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory

loans.name: Saasaai 1 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 9 women of Saasaii on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments. The women will be using their loans for the following purposes:

Apaula A. (44, divorced, 2 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, filing (knife sharpener), knives and fertilizer to cultivate and sell vegetables including taro, tuamu and bananas.

. Evaga N. (37, married, 2 children): purchase flour, oil, sugar, baking powder, shopping bags and other materials to bake and sell biscuits.

Fonofale E. (42, married, 2 children): purchase a sewing machine, thread and other equipment to make and sell fabrics.

Lafo Saufat (52, married, 4 children) purchase taro roots, tuamu, 2 bush knives, filings, chemicals and a weed-killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro, tuamu and other products.

Leutu T. (59, married, 4 children), Pese V. (52, married, 6 children), Saasaai F. (53, married, 5 children), Toalua M. (43, married, 6 children) and Maofa V. (33, married, 5 children): each purchase a weed-killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, filings and a wheelbarrow to grow and sell taro, bananas, tuamu, etc..

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, a weed-killing sprayer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Mrs. Hy M. raises pigs and operates a small grocery, where she earns $1.60 per day. Her husband, Mr. Say Sinin, earns $3.75 per day as a bricklayer. They live with their only child in Anlong Lork Village, Kampong Thom Province. She requests a loan of $500 to expand her grocery stock and decorate her home to make it more attractive for business. She hopes this loan will improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her grocery stock and decorate her home to make it more attractive for business

loans.name: Anna's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Anna is 30 years old and is a single woman with one child, age 11. Anna owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Salelologa Tumupapa Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
While Salelologa, the capital village of Savaii Island, is largely semi-urbanized, while its outlying areas are still agricultural. The Salelologa Tumupapa is located in a largely agricultural area, and the people in the community still subsist on farming and vegetable gardening. For this group, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and guarantee on-time payments.

Salelologa Tumupapa group will be using their loans for the following purposes:

Foleni Pei I. (31, married, no children): purchase pan fryer, chicken legs, soy sauce, bananas, and taro to make BBQ chicken and sausage.

Olaiala U. (35, married, 5 children): purchase forks, rakes, a weed-killing sprayer, and chemicals to raise and sell cabbages, tomatoes and pumpkins.

Olive T. (40, married, 5 children): purchase a stove, corn seeds, oil, plastic bags and pots to produce popcorn.

Ruby Salota P. (21, single, no children): purchase a broom, glass and materials to make shirts, puletasis (dresses) and glass.

Sefulu S. (49, single, no children): purchase corned beef, soft drinks, cans of herring and cigarettes to sell in the village.

Susan F. (27, married, 1 child): purchase mutton flaps (lamb ribs), chicken legs, soy sauce, tomato sauce and foil to make and sell snacks, donuts and pork cakes.

Tailua Manulua M. (43, married, 6 children): purchase cabbage seeds, barbed wire, a spade, a pick, a bush knife and a weed-killing sprayer to cultivate and sell cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers.

Tina I. (52, married, 3 children) purchase oil, a sack of taro, bananas, plastic bags, large pots and large pan fryers to bake taro and banana chips.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted farming equipment and other materials, etc..

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim B. is a mother of six, two of whom are married while all the others attend a local school. She has lived in a small town called Depalpur in Pakistan for her entire life. One of her sons operates a cycle rental store in addition to studying. At present, he wants to buy an additional motorcycle to expand his business. The other members of the group are: Nasreen B., whose husband is a butcher; Imam H., whose husband runs a vegetables counter; Fatima A., who will use her share of loan to improve her family's breakfast stall; and Nasira B., whose husband trades livestock.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $1,325.00.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mrs. Ke S. and her husband, Phan Von, are pot and statue carvers who live in the Mol Village, Pursat Province. They have two children, both of whom are students. With their stable sculpture business, they earn about $6 per day but this income cannot support their family’s expenses and children’s school fees, so they need to expand the business. They now request a loan of $1,100 to buy wood for stock to make pot and statue sculptures more efficiently. The photo is of S.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy wood for stock to make pot and statue sculptures more efficiently

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en: Shahnaz K. is a mother of eight in Depalpur, Pakistan, with six sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works for a microfinance institution called Asasah, while another son paints buildings.  The others currently attend school. One of her daughters sews clothes on order from neighborhood clients. She learned stitching from one of her neighbors. Currently she wants to expand her business and buy few more sewing machines; she will also hire few workers. The other members of this group are Rahat B. and Fatima A., who are both taking loans for their husbands who sell fruit on carts.  The other group member is Akberi B., who is a widow, and is borrowing for her son’s fruit business.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $900.00.

loans.use: To buy additional sewing machines.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung S. is a 45-year-old grocer living with her four children in Sthany Village, Pursat Province and earns around $4 per day. All of her children are still studying in primary school. Her husband, Mr. Nou Bunthoeun, is a 45-year-old policeman and earns up to $3 per day. In order to help her husband support their large family, she is now asking for a loan of $400 to increase her inventory of groceries and to decorate her grocery store. She appreciates Kiva for their support and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan. The photo is of Mr. Nou Bunthorun because S. was at market.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of groceries and to decorate her grocery store

loans.name: Sili 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
The village of Sili on Savaii Island is one of the well-endowed villages in terms of natural resources.  It has very rich soil, with a large number of springs and creeks which serve as natural irrigation for farms located at the foot of the mountain ranges. Most of the households in Sili village farm taro, bananas and vegetables. They sell their products in the capital town of Salelologa, which is about 40 kilometers from the village. The village learned about SPBD through the radio talk-back shows and from a meeting SPBD staff made with a village chief.   After the successful training of the first loan group in Sili village, more women became interested in the SPBD savings and loan program.  The village chief has convened the village council, endorsed the SPBD program and encouraged women in the village to join. They are now thinking of putting up a string of stalls by the roadside so that women sell their produce to passersby as an alternative to going to the Salelologa market.

Sili 2 group will be using their loans for the following purposes:


Eseta L. (45, married, 2 children): purchase 2 bush knives, 2 knife filings (sharpeners), spades, workers to cultivate and sell taro, tuamu and bananas.  

Lina I. (60, widow, 8 children): purchase a knife, spade, filing, 3 bush knives and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro, tuamu and yams. 

P. Komisi (45, widow, 2 children): purchase a bush knife, filing, spade and other farming equipment to cultivate and sell popcorn, taro and yams. 

Ruta T. (50, married, 6 children): purchase 2 knives, a pick, a filing, a rake and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro and bananas. 

Sau T. (48, married, 4 children): purchase 5 bush knives, a weed killing sprayer and workers to grow and sell taro and yams. 

Silifu T. (38, married, 2 children): purchase 3 bush knives, a spade, a filing and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro, bananas, and tuamu. 

Sulesa I. (36, married, 1 child) purchase 2 knives, a filing, a wheel barrow, a spade and a weed killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro and bananas. 

Toaiga A. (43, married, 7 children) purchase a bush knife, filing, spade and other farming equipment to grow and sell taro and bananas.  

Tofe A. (24, married, 2 children) purchase 2 knives, 2 filings, boots, a weed killing sprayer to cultivate and sell taro and bananas.

loans.use: Purchase of bush knives, spades, knife filings, etc…

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is a trader who owns a drinking spot. She also prepares food for sale. She is married to a fisherman and has five dependents. She wants to expand her business to increase her income.

She is asking for $325 as additional capital to buy more alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks and also items for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks and also items for the preparation of food for sale.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41744

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Karima Kaharova lives in the town of Quargan-Tube. She is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has secondary education. By profession, she is a pastry-cook. She owns a small business - she bakes pastries at home and sells them in large quantities to distributors, who in turn sell her products in markets. In addition, people place custom orders and she bakes for them, as these types of products are in high demand. In small towns and villages, people often organize celebrations and fully serve the guests. For this reason, they often buy baked products. This helps them to save money and time. Currently, Karima has one oven, which is not enough. Lack of the second oven becomes a bottleneck and prevents her from producing more.

She decided to purchase a large oven, and for that reason, is asking for a loan. The credit will help her increase the volume of production and sales. Karima will be able to collect earnings earlier than before. Even a small extra amount of income will help her family improve their standard of living since she is the sole provider for her family. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кахорова Карима жительница города Курган-тюбе. 48 лет , замужем и имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По профессии кондитер. Занимается частным предпринимательством. Выпекает на дому булочки и сдает под реализацию на рынки.Кроме того она выпекает булочки на заказ , так как эта продукция пользуется спросом у населения. В сельской местности население часто проводят мероприятия и накрывают столы , поэтому им необходимо покупать выпечку. Это помогает им сэкономить время и деньги .Сейчас у клиентки есть одна печка и ее ей не хватает , потому что это замедляет ход работы. Теперь она решила приобрести большую печь , путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиентке увеличить объем выпекаемой продукции . тем самым увеличивая реализацию. Это поможет Кариме получить доход немного больше чем раньше , даже небольшой доход поможет ее семье жить лучше. Так как она является единственным кормильцем семьи. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Taga 2 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 5 women of Taga 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD.  They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee.  Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Lauesi F., 34, is married with 4 children.  She wishes to start a business in sewing.  With her loan, she will purchase a sewing machine, thread, and materials to make t-shirts and puletasis (dresses) to be sold 2 times a week at the market.  

Maele P., 28, is married to a planter.  Minesi M., 32, is married with 3 children.  Uaima L., 35, is married with 6 children.  Vagatai L., 48, is divorced with 8 children.  With their loans, they will each purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and other equipment to cultivate and sell taro and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, etc...

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.ru:
Mahmadi A. lives in the town of Quargan-Tube. He is 37 years old, married, and has one child. He has secondary eduction. He works as a taxi driver. He owns a car, on which he plans to install natural gas system with help of a loan. This will help Mahmadi to avoid paying for gas, which became more expensive lately and made taxi business unprofitable. Moreover, he has to raise his rates. In case Mahmadi will be able to install gas system, he will decrease his rates and give residents of the region an opportunity to use taxi at affordable prices. He is planning to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Алиханов Махмади Давлятолиевич проживает в городе Курган- тюбе. Ему 37 лет, он женат и имеет 1 ребенка.Образование среднее. Работает водителем такси. Имеет автомобиль , на который хочет установить газовое оборудование , путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту , так как бензин подоражал и предоставлять услуги такси заправляясь бензином не выгодно. Кроме того цены на предоставляемые услуги поднимаются. Если клиент установит газовое оборудование , в этом случае цены на услугу снизятся, что поможет населению пользоваться такси по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To install natural gas system (instead of oil)

loans.name: Taga 3 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 3 women of Taga 3 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business's development and help guarantee on-time payments.

Gaualofa F., 59, is married with 8 children. She sells tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages and other vegetables to the village people. With her loan, she will purchase 10 cabbages, 10 cucumbers, 10 tomatoes, 10 beans and chemicals.

Lauama A., 53, is married with 3 children. She sells taro and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet, 3 days a week to the village people. She needs chemicals, a weed-killing sprayer, a knife and a wheelbarrow to improve her business. Her family has been in the business for years. Her low prices, good quality and good location set her apart from the competition.

Matagi L., 37, is married with 6 children. She sells taro, taumu and bananas 3 days a week to the village people. She learned gardening from her parents. Her loan will permit her to purchase more materials to tend her garden.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed killing sprayer, wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Mrs. Samrith S., 42, works as a weaver and also owns a plot of land growing rice. On average, she earns around $3 a day. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses, making about $5 a day. They have 2 children. One child works in a garment factory and the other stays at home.
She would like to loan from Kiva to purchase good rice seed and fertilizers to put on her farm and the leftover is to be used to buy a motorbike for use as  transportation.

loans.use: to purchase  good rice seed and fertilizers and a motorbike.

loans.name: Hushvaht

texts.ru:
Hushvaht S. lives in the town of Vaksh. He is 37 years old, married, and has one child. He has secondary education. He lives with his family and is their sole provider. He is in the business of breeding livestock. He purchases sheep and goats, feeds them for a month, and then resells them for meat markets. In addition, he breeds them. This time, Hushvaht is planning to take out a loan to purchase more livestock. This will help him increase the turnover. This also, will bring him additional income and give local residents an opportunity to purchase good quality meat. Moreover, this business will help develop the farming sector of local economy. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Хушвахт Махмудович проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 37 лет, женат имеет 1 ребенка. Образование среднее. Живет с семьей , но кормильцем семьи является сам. Занимается разведением мелко рогатого скота. Покупает овец и коз , откармливает их около месяца , доводит до хорошо откормленных животных , а затем продает на мясо и мясные изделия. Кроме того он разводит их для увеличения поголовья скота. Сейчас клиент запланировал получить кредит для того чтобы купить новые породы животных. Это поможет ему увеличить поголовье в ассортименте. Так же ему лично это принесет дополнительный доход. А для населения это даст возможность приобретать высококачественное мясо. Кроме того запнятие клиента данным видом бизнеса позволит развитию животноводческого сектора. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.ru:
Gulsifat S. lives in the town of Vahdat in Mehron. She is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has secondary education and is not employed. However, she desperately wants to help her husband. Currently, her family has a cow and a calf. The cow hadn't had milk for a long time. For this reason, Gulsifat wants to obtain a credit to purchase a milk cow. This will help her increase family income since she will be able to sell milk to her neighbors. In addition, her neighbors will have an opportunity to buy fresh milk at low prices.

After she pays off the credit, she will still have a cow, that she will use for breeding to further increase the amount of cattle that the family holds. She plans to pay off the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Солехова Гулсифат Муродовна проживает в городе Вахдат в поселке Мехргон. Клиентке 46 лет , она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , но очень хочет помочь мужу . У них в хозяйстве есть корова и теленок. Но корова уже давно не дает молоко. Поэтому клиентка хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить дойную корову, для того чтобы получать молоко. Это поможет ей зарабатывать деньги, так как получаемое молоко она сможет продавать соседям. Кроме того ее соседи смогут покупать свежее молоко по низкой цене. После того как она расплатится с кредитом ей останится корова , которую она сможет разводить и увеличивать поголовье скота у себя дома. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Thi Loan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs C. Thi Loan who is 40 years old and currently lives with husband and her three school aged children. Mrs C. Thi Loan works as the local village elementary school teacher whiL. her husband is in the business of trading chicken eggs. In addition to earning income from teaching, Mrs C. Thi Loan also raises a pig farm in order to supplement family income. Mrs C. Thi Loan would like to participate in this loan so that she could use the funds to expand her husband's current business of trading chicken eggs. Similarly, the other seven individuals of Mrs C. thi Loan's loan group are planning to use their loan portions to upgrade and expanding their businesses, thus improves their quality of life
- Mrs L. Thi Thoa: raising pig stocks and expanding her retail business
- Mrs N. Loan: purchasing livestock feeds for her pigs and expanding her retail business
- Mrs N. thi Do: purchase livestock feeds for her pigs and chicken flock
- Mrs N. Thi Ha: purchase livestock feed for her pigs, chickens and to expand her retail business
- Mrs L. Thi Bac: purchasing livestock feeds for her pigs and chicken flock
- Mrs N. Thi Thom: purchasing merchandise for her retail shop
- Mr Ch Van Oanh, a widower: to expand his fruits and flowers retailing business

Chi C. Thị Loan, năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị có chồng và 3 con đang đi học. Chị là giáo viên của trường tiểu học xã, chồng chị đi buôn trứng gà. N.ài việc dạy học, chị còn chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị tham gia vay của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc để thêm vốn cho chồng đi chợ. Chị muốn được tham gia lâu dài. Trong nhóm còn có: Chị Lê Thị Thoa vay để chăn nuôi lợn và thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn và thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị Ngô Thị Do vay để thêm vốn mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà và thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị Lê Thị Bắc vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thơm vay để thêm vốn đi chợ hàng ngày. Anh C. Văn Oanh vay để thêm vốn bán hàng hoa quả (vợ đã mất).

loans.use: Raising livestock & expanding retail business | Chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba K. lives in the town of Vahdat. She owns a small business - she sells clothing and shoes at a space that she has at a central market. She has been in this business for the past 6 years. She imports her merchandise from Dushanbe, where she purchases it from distributors. After that, she sells the purchased items at a market in her town. She is 48 years old and has 4 children. He husband does not have a very high income, and for that reason, she must develop her business. Currently, there is a new season and she needs to get a new assortment of the merchandise. To do so, she needs to obtain a loan. This will help her to buy the necessary products and attract new customers. All that will bring her the planned profits. Both her family will be better off and the local residents, who will be able to get seasonal merchandise without leaving the town. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кобилова Матлюба проживает в городе Вахдат. Нигде не работает , но занимается частным бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Торгует одеждой и обувью. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 6 лет. Привозит товар из Душанбе , покупая у поставщиков. А затем реализует на базаре у себя в районе. Клиентке 48 лет и у нее 4 детей. Муж зарабатывает очень мало, поэтому клиентка просто необходимо развивать свой бизнес. Сейчас новый сезон и необходимо закупить новый асортимент товара . Но для этого ей нужно получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить оборотную сумму. Это поможет ей завести новый товар и привлечь новых клиентов. Все это принесет ей запланируемый доход. И в ее сеье все будут довольны и население сможет покупать сезонные вещи , не выезжая за приделы города. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a trader who buys food stuffs from the farming area and then sends them to town for sale. Demand has increased but she lacks funds to purchase more goods to sell.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to enable her to buy more food stuffs and also to meet the transportation cost.
