loans.use: Additional capital to enable her to buy more food stuffs and also to meet the transportation cost.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41754

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru:
Zumrad A. lives in the town Tirsun-zoda. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works in construction. Zumrad herself makes her earnings through food sales. She sells nuts (almonds and pistachios) and dried fruits at a market "Dehkon". She purchases the products from wholesalers and resells it in smaller quantities. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She needs financial help to purchase the inventory. Since the new crops are not yet ready and the old crops are soon going to be all used, the prices for old crops are raising every day. Zumrad wants to obtain a loan so she could purchase enough products. This will help her keep the same prices, continue receiving steady income, and give local residents a chance to purchase her products at affordable prices. She plans to pay off the credit within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абилова Зумрад проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 31 год, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муж зарабатывает подсобным рабочим на стройке. Сама клиентка зарабатывает на жизнь торговлей . Продает орехи( фисташки ,миндаль.) и сухофрукты на рынке «Дехкон».Скупает товар у оптовых продавцов и продает в розницу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиентка уже 5 лет. Ей необходима финансовая помощь.Нужно закупить товар, так как нового урожая еще нет , а прошлогодний уже заканчивается и цены на него дорожают . поэтому клиентка хочет получить кредит и закупить товар.Это поможет ей сохранить цены на рынке и люди смогут покупать продукт по доступным ценам , а так же обеспечить себе стабильный заработок. А погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Thi Chien's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thi Chien who is 30 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. While her two children are attending school, Mrs N. Thi Chien goes to the local recycling market to trade recycled irons and her husband is seeking work as a day laborer. Together, Mr and Mrs N. Thi Chien also maintain a family pig farm to earn additional income for the family. Mrs N. Thi Chien is asking for this loan in order to purchase livestock feed for her pigs. Mrs N. Thi Chien's loan group consists of 6 individuals and all plan to use this loan to expand their current businesses
-Mrs N. Thi Duyen: purchasing livestock feed for her pigs and chickens
-Mrs D. Thi Lan: purchasing ducklings to expand her duck flock
-Mrs D. Thi Lien: purchasing livestock feed for her pigs
-Mrs N. Thi Minh: expanding her metal recycling business
-Mrs N. Thi Nham: purchasing merchandise for her retail shop

Chị Nguyễn Thị Chiên, năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị có chồng và hai con đang đi học. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ sắt, anh đi làm thuê, ngoài ra anh chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn để thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị vay vốn lần này để mua cám cho đàn lợn của gia đình. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Nguyễn Thị Duyên vay để mua cám cho lợn, gà. Chị Đỗ Thị Lan vay để mua vịt giống về nuôi. Chị Đỗ Thị Liên vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh vay để thêm vốn đi chợ sắt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhâm vay để thêm vốn bán hàng tạp hoá tại chợ làng.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock feed & expanding retail business | Mua cám cho lợn, gà và đi chợ buôn bán

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang S., age 50, works raising pigs at her house. Normally she earns around $3 a day.
Her husband Mr. Iv Phat, age 51, owns a plot of land a growing a variety of vegetables. On average, he makes $8 in revenue per day. They have 8 children.Four children are married and live away from home.
This couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase cashew nuts to resell for profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts to resell for profit.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Islom A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 37 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. He has secondary education. Since he lives alone, he needs to maintain his own household. For this reason, he works a lot. He is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. He earns little income because he has a small amount of money circulating in the business. To increase his income, he is asking for a loan so he could increase the amount invested in the inventory. This will permit him to receive income that is so needed for his household. He plans to pay off the credit within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Ислом Хасанович житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 37 лет , разведен и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Так как он живет один , все хозяйство лежит на его плечах . Клиенту приходится много работать ,чтобы прокормить семью.Клиет занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Получает небольшой доход , потому что у него маленькая оборотная сумма. Для того чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит , тем самым увеличив оборотную сумму.Это принесет ему доход . который так необходим его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the turnover

loans.name: Thi Phong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phong, 36 years old, married with two school age children, is a leader of her village’s women association. She is active and resourceful. Besides her community activities, she raises livestock and “đi chợ” for extra income. She is applying for a loan to invest in her livestock. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Văn Tám applies for a loan to buy feed for livestock.
  • C. Thị Luận applies for a loan to buy breeding pigs and “đi chợ” scrap metal.
  • C. Văn Giang applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Huệ applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • C. Thị Vinh applies for a loan to buy breeding pigs and “đi chợ” scrap metal.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phong, năm nay 36 tuổi, là chi trưởng Hội phụ nữ thôn. Chị có chồng và hai con đang đi học. Chị là một người phụ nữ tháo vát và năng nổ. Ngoài việc tham gia công tác đoàn thể, chị còn chăn nuôi và đi chợ thêm để cùng chồng nuôi các con ăn học. Chị vay để thêm vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Anh Nguyễn Văn Tám vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Chị C. Thị Luận vay để mua lợn giống và đi chợ sắt. Anh C. Văn Giang vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị C. Thị Vinh vay để mua lợn giống và đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thi Hoa who is 39 years old and lives in a household which consists of five people: herself, her husband and three children currently attending school. As a peasant by trade, Mrs Nguyen Thi Hoa is also raising pigs and chicken livestock in addition to maintaining the family rice paddies. Her husband is also helping out with taking care of the livestock whenever he is not working away as a day laborer. Mrs N. Thi Hoa is attempting to use this loan to purchase more livestock feed for her pigs and chickens. the other four individual members of Mrs N. Thi Hoa's group are similarly seeking this loan to expand their livestock businesses
-Mrs C. Thi Hang: purchasing hogs to breed and to expand her retail business
-Mrs N. Thi Khuyen: purchasing livestock feed and fertilizer for her farm
-Mrs N. Thi Cham: purchasing fish to star her fish farming business
-Mrs C. Thi Thanh: purchasing livestock feed for her chickens

Chị Ngô Thị Hoa, năm nay 39 tuổi. Chị có chồng và ba con đang đi học. N.ài việc làm nông nghiệp là nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình, chị còn tham gia chăn nuôi gà lớn để tăng thêm thu nhập. Chồng chị N.ài những lúc đi làm thuê còn giúp chị những việc chăn nuôi trong gia đình. Chị tham gia chương trình để mua thêm cám chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị C. Thị Hằng vay để mua lợn giống và thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị Ngô Thị Khuyên vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà và mua lân đạm làm nông nghiệp. Chị Ngô Thị Châm vay để mua cá giống về thả ao nuôi. Chị C. Thị Thanh vay để mua thức ăn cho gà.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock  to breed | mua vật giống về nuôi

loans.name: Thi Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hằng, 48 years old, married with two school age children, one still in school, is a cadre in her village. Besides her community activities, she raises pigs. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to buy feed for pigs. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trần Thị Tình applies for a loan to invest in her business.
  • Lê Thị Thảo applies for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She is also a veterinarian.
  • Nguyễn Thị Toàn applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs and buys scrap metal.
  • Lê Thị Nhung applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Lê Thị Huê applies for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hằng, 48 tuổi là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn, chị có chồng và hai con trai hiện nay 1 cậu đi làm và một còn đi học. Ngoài công việc trong chi hội phụ nữ thôn, chị còn tham gia chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà. Lần này chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị còn muốn tham gia lâu dài với chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Trần Thị Tình vay 2006000 để thêm vốn bán hàng lân đạm tại nhà cho bà con trong thôn làm nông nghiệp. Chị Lê Thị Thảo vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn, chị là một bác sĩ thú y tại thôn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Toàn vay 2006000 đồng để chị mua cám chăn nuôi lợn và một phần chị thêm vốn để đi chợ sắt hàng ngày. Chị Lê Thị Nhung vay 1534000 đồng để chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Chị Lê Thị Huê vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua máy may mặc (chị làm thợ may tại nhà).

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Xuân, 25 years old collects and sells scrap metal, her husband is a laborer. They raise few pigs at home. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Dương Thị Bình applies for a loan to buy scrap metal.
  • Nguyễn Thị Mỵ applies for a loan to invest in her noodL. business.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hường applies for a loan to invest in her business.
  • Ngô Thị Lợi applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock.
  • Nguyễn Thị Tình applies for a loan to buy pigkets.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thanh applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock .

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Xuân, 25 tuổi. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ sắt vụn, anh đi làm thuê, N.ài ra anh chị còn chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà. Chị vay 2006000 đồng để một phần thêm vốn đi chợ, một phần mua thêm cám cho đàn lợn nhà mình. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Dương Thị Bình vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ sắt hàng ngày. Chị Nguyễn Thị Mỵ vay 2006000 đồng để mua thêm nguyên liệu làm bánh đa, mỳ để đi giao cho các cửa hàng trong xã, huyện. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hường vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ hàng ngày. Chị Ngô Thị Lợi vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ sắt và mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tình vay 2006000 đồng để đi chợ sắt và mua lợn giống. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: For scrap metal, feed for livestock

loans.name: Kutbinisso

texts.ru:
Kutbinisso T., 57, lives in Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is a widowed mother of 5 children. Kutbinisso earns money by raising animals. She has a small cowshed where she keeps calves. She buys calves, fattens them and re-sells them at the markets for a profit. This helps Kutbinisso support her family; while she is a single mother, she also needs to work to keep her children fed and clothed. Kutbinisso would like to buy another calf, but she needs a loan to do so. Now is a good time to buy a calf, because after winter, the animals are thin and are being sold for lower prices. Kutbinisso plans to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Толибова Кутбиниссо проживает в районе Абдурахмони Дзжоми. Клиентке 57лет , вдова , имеет 5 детей. Зарабатывает клиентка путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью , несмотря на то , что она одинокая женщина , ей приходится работать , чтобы дети были сытыми и одетыми.Но клиентка хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого ей нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Umedjon N. lives in Gissar district. He is 26 and married with one child. He does not have a formal education, but he works as an on-demand apartment repairman. This job allows him to earn money, but the work is seasonal and there is not always demand for repairs. The money he earns is not enough to feed his family, so he also raises livestock. He keeps a few calves which he fattens and then sells back at the market for their meat. Umedjon has been in this business for three years. At the moment, he needs money to buy another pair of calves and increase his sales. He hopes to receive a loan and plans to pay it back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Нуров Умеджон проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет , женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Образования не имеет, но зарабатывает ремонтом квартир на заказ. Но доход от этой деятельности не достаточный для того , чтобы можно было обеспечивать свою семью. Поэтому клиент еще подрабатывает разведением крупно -рогатого скота. Имеет несколько бычков , откормив которых Умед перепродает на базаре, на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года.Сейчас клиенту нужны деньги , для того чтобы купить еще пару бычков, и увеличить товарооборот. Обратившись к нам клиент надеется получить кредит, а погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Sangimurod

texts.ru:
Sangimurod H. lives in Gissar district. He is 47 and married with four children. He does not have a formal education, but he works as an on-demand apartment repairman. This job allows him to earn money, but the work is seasonal and there is not always demand for repairs. The money he receives is not enough to feed his family, so he also raises livestock. Sangimurod buys calves, fattens them over 40-45 days, and then sells them on at a profit. He has been doing this for ten years. This business is popular and widely accepted in rural places, and for this reason it brings him income. At the moment, the amount of money Sangimurod can put into his business has decreased and he needs a loan to purchase more livestock. This will allow him to re-establish his business and bring his family needed income. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Сангимурод живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 47 лет , женат и имеет 4 детей. Образования не имеет, но подрабатывает, занимаясь ремонтом квартир на заказ. Эта работа позволяет зарабатывать деньги, но заработок не дает ему нужный доход , так как деятельность является сезонной. Поэтому клиент дополнительно занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их необходимый срок , около 40-45 дней , а затем продает и получает прибыль , которую использует для расширения бизнеса. Занимается этим 10 лет. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности. Сейчас клиенту нужно увеличить товарооборот, что поможет получить дополнительный доход. Поэтому клиенгт обратился к нам за кредитом. А погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru:
Mahmadsharif H. lives in Gissar district. He is 34 and married with three children. He does not have a formal education, but he works as an on-demand apartment repairman. This job allows him to make money, but the work is seaonal and there is not always demand for repairs. The money he receives isn't enough to feed his family, so in addition, he raises livestock. He buys calves, fattens them over 40-45 days, and then sells them back at a profit. He has been doing this for eight years. This business is popular and widely accepted in rural places, and for this reason it brings him income. However, due to the cold winter in Tajikistan, the amount of money Mahmadsharif can put into his business has decreased. He was forced to sell several calves in order to buy food for the others. He needs a loan in order to buy more livestock. This will allow him to re-establish his business and bring his family needed income. Mahmadsharif plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Махмадшариф живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет 3 детей. Образования не имеет, но работает ремонтом квартир на заказ. Эта работа позволяет зарабатывать деньги, но эта работа является сезонной и не всегда есть заказ. Кроме того оплаты что он получает не хватает для того чтобы прокормить семью. Поэтому клиент дополнительно занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Занимается этим 8 лет. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности, поэтому дает доход. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с холодной зимой . Ему пришлось продать несколько голов бычков , чтобы запастись кормом для остальных, и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Mahmurod

texts.ru:
Mahmurod H. lives in Gissar distrct. He is 40 and married with three children. He does not have a formal education. He owns a store that sells food products. He has been in business for about six years. However, the store alone doesn't provide enough income for his family, so Mahmurod also raises livestock. He buys calves and fattens them for 40-45 days, then sells them on at a profit. This business is popular and well accepted in rural areas and for this reason, brings Mahmurod income. At the moment, the amount of money he can put into his business has decreased, and he needs to increase the number of calves in his care. He needs a loan to do this. This will help Mahmurod re-establish his business and get the income his family needs. He plans to repay his loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Махмурод живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 40 лет , женат и имеет 3 детей. Образования не имеет. Имеет магазин продуктов питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 6 лет. Магазин дает доход не достаточный для его семьи, поэтому клиент еще занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности , поэтому дает доход. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Barotboi

texts.ru:
Barotboi A. is 54 years old. He is married and the happy father of five children. He has a secondary school edudcation. After finishing school he got involved in fattening and selling livestock. He has more than 30 years of experience in this area. This has been his family's main source of income as far back as Barotboi's great-grandparents' time. He became a MicroInvest client in early 2007, taking out a loan of $400. In the future, he plans to increase his volume of livestock and improve their conditions.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдувохидов Баротбой – 54 года. Женат, счастливый отец 5-ых детей. Окончил школу и сразу после окончания начал заниматься откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 30 лет. Это деятельность являлась основным источником дохода со времен его прадедов. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ “Микроинвест” в начале 2007-го года с активами на 400 долларов. В будущем планирует увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Mahmadalli.

texts.ru:
Mahmadalli H. lives in the Gissar region. He is 31 years old, is married, has 2 children and does not have an education. Mahmadalli raises livestock. He purchases calves, feeds them for 40-45 days and then sells them for a profit. This business is the sole source of income for his family and he has been in this business for 4 years. The livestock business is the most popular business in the rural area and thus provides a profit.

Today, Mahmadalli’s working capital has decreased due to the cold winter and he had to sell several calves in order to buy feed for the rest and now he needs to expand his inventory. This is why he needs a loan. This will allow him to restore his business and income which his family needs. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Махмадалли живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 31 год , женат и имеет 2 детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Занимается этим 4 года. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности, поэтому дает доход. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с холодной зимой . Ему пришлось продать несколько голов бычков , чтобы запастись кормом для остальных, и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Abdusammad.

texts.ru:
Abdusammad N. is a resident of the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 53 years old, is a widower and has 4 children. He has a high school education. Because he lives alone, he carries all of the household responsibilities on his shoulders. He needs to work a lot in order to support his family. Abdusammad sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for 6 years. He earns a small income because he has a small amount of working capital. He is applying for a loan to increase his working capital and his income. This will allow him to increase his income, which is so necessary for his family. Abdusammad will pay back his loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Норбоев Абдусамад житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 53 года , вдовец и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Так как он живет один , все хозяйство лежит на его плечах . Клиенту приходится много работать ,чтобы прокормить семью.Клиет занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет.Получает небольшой доход , потому что у него маленькая оборотная сумма. Для того чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит , тем самым увеличив оборотную сумму.Это принесет ему доход . который так необходим его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Zokirova

texts.ru:
R. Zokirova is 47 years old. She is married and has 4 children. R. has a high school education. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2006. Back then she sold men’s and women’s underwear in different places around town. Now she has a fixed spot at the market, higher inventory and purchases products for cash which lets her purchase them at a cheaper price. In the future she plans to transition to wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зокирова Рафоат – 47 лет .Замужем, мать четверых детей .Образование среднее. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест-е с 2006-го года. Тогда она продавала мужские и женские белья в разных местах города. Теперь у нее определенное место деятельности в рынке, увеличенный товарооборот и покупает товар за наличные, что позволяет ей приобрести подешевле.В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу товара.

loans.use: Increase inventory and transition to wholesale sales

loans.name: Sharifjon.

texts.ru:
Sharifjon Z. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children. He works as a tractor driver. This does not provide a stable income. The main source of income for his family and his main activity is agriculture. He has a plot of land where he plants wheat and potatoes. Sharifjon has been in this business for 7 years.

Quality seeds and fertilizer are necessary for planting and he does not have the resources to purchase them. This is why he is applying for a loan. After reaping a quality harvest, Sharifjon will be able to supply the market with quality products, attract new clients and earn a good income. In addition he will be able to supply his family with flour and potatoes for a long time, as the main food sources for the population are flour (bread and baked goods) and potatoes. Sharifjon will pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зайлабиддинов Шарифджон Урупбоевич проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Ему 45 лет он женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает трактористом. Это не стабильный заработок клиента. Основным источником дохода его семьи и основным видом деятельности клиента является сельское хозяйство. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. Занимается этим виджом бизнеса уже 7 лет.На засев земли необходимы качественные семена и удобрения , на покупку которых у клиента нет средств. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. После получения качественного урожая клиент сможет обеспечить рынок качественной продукцией , привлечь новых клиентов и получить неплохой доход. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить свою семью мукой и картофелем на долгое время , так как основным продуктом питания населения является мука( хлеб и хлебные изделия) и картофель. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Agnus Namakula’S Group

texts.en:
Agnus is the leader of this five-person group. Agnus has been a widow for the past eight years. She has five children and looks after two other children who lost their mother.

Agnus has a shop in Mengo, a suburb outside of Kampala, where she sells matoke, fruits, and charcoal. The loan will enable Agnus to pay school fees for all of her children and expand the stock in her shop. Agnus has successfully repaid loans from MCDT since 2005. These loans have enabled Agnus to meet her basic needs, expand her business, and continue to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Dustmatova

texts.ru:
B. Dustmatova is 48 years old. She is married and has 2 children. B. has a high school education. Her husband helps her in her business. She has 11 years of experience in her area of business. B. turned to MicroInvest because of the high interest rates that illegal lenders charge. When she started as a client her assets were worth $300, today they are worth $1,275. She has her own sales location and a higher product assortment. In the future she plans to acquire an additional sales location for wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустматова Бахри – 48 лет. Замужем, мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Муж помогает в торговле. Имеет опыт в этой сфере 11 лет. Причиной кредитования в МЗФ «Микроинвест» стало большие проценты нелегальных кредиторов. Начала кредитоваться с активами на 300 долларов, а сейчас они достигают 1275$. У нее уже отдельная точка торговли и увеличенный ассортимент товара. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну точку для оптовой реализации.

loans.use: Acquire an additional sales location

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.ru:
Nabijon Z. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 42 years old and has 5 children. He has a college education and works at a branch of “Agroinvestbank” In addition he works in agriculture. He has a plot of land where he grows wheat and potatoes. He has been in this business for 6 years.

Quality seeds and fertilizer are necessary for planting and he does not have the resources to purchase them. This is why he is applying for a loan. After reaping a quality harvest, Nabijon will be able to supply the market with quality products, attract new clients and earn a good income. In addition he will be able to supply his family with flour and potatoes for a long time, as the main food sources for the population are flour (bread and baked goods) and potatoes. Nabijon will pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зайлабиддинов Набиджон Урупбоевич проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Ему 42 лет он женат и имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее. Работает бухгалтером в филиале « Агроинвестбанка».Кроме того он занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. Занимается этим виджом бизнеса уже 6 лет.На засев земли необходимы качественные семена и удобрения , на покупку которых у клиента нет средств. Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. После получения качественного урожая клиент сможет обеспечить рынок качественной продукцией , привлечь новых клиентов и получить неплохой доход. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить свою семью мукой и картофелем на долгое время , так как основным продуктом питания населения сельской местности является мука( хлеб и хлебные изделия) и картофель. Погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kurbonova

texts.ru:
H. Kurbonova is 53 years old and is the mother of 5 children. She is married and has a specialized high school education. She has been selling lingerie and clothing since 2005. She became a client of MircoInvest in 2006, when she had assets of $200. Prior to this she traded in different places without her own spot and with a small product assortment. Today her position is different, she has a permanent sales spot, a higher product assortment and she plans to transition to wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Хосият- 53 года, мать 5-ых детей. Замужем и образование средне специальное. Занимается торговлей нижней бельем и одеждами с 2005-го года. Стала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест в 2006-ом году с активами на 200 долларов. Перед этим она торговала в разных местах без собственного место деятельности и с не большим ассортиментом товара. Теперь дела обстоят иначе – у нее постоянная торговая точка, увеличился ассортимент, а в будущем хочет перейти на оптовую продажу

loans.use: Transition to wholesales sales

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia (seated serving client) is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Kisumu, Kenya. She began her salon business in 1984. Besides her salon, Patricia sells ready-made clothes, shoes, purses, ties and other clothing items. The location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and build a successful income-generating business. Patricia is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. She requires US $500 to further expand her businesses.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Dobrinka

texts.en: Dobrinka was born in 1975 and is the single mother of two children. She supports herself and her family by farming, and earns an income of about 900 KM a month. She has applied for her first loan, which she will use to buy a cow and seeds for her greenhouse.

loans.use: To buy a cow and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Smilja

texts.en: Smilja was born in 1960 and lives in a small village called Opsine, which is near the larger town of Doboj. She farms a plot of land for a living and earns about 500 KM a month. She has applied for her first loan, and intends to use it to buy supplies to increase the output of her farm. Smilja will sell her produce at a local market and use the money she earns to support her family and buy additional supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To improve the output of her farm.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana L. lives in Kherson and runs a small business selling men’s clothing at the central city market. She likes to plan her business strategy thoroughly and overcomes all challenges with optimism. Tatyana is a person who always finishes what she starts. Four successful years in this business are the best proof of that, because in this time Tatyana has received and promptly repaid 15 loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Presently, Tatyana's company brings in about $4,000 a month, $1,000 of which is net profit.

Tatyana would like to get a loan of $1,000 to increase her capital. She wants to continue developing her business and gain financial independence and economic freedom. We believe Tatyana’s balanced approach to life, disciplined way of doing things, attention to detail and careful planning will help her continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of items she has for sale.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson (standing serving a client) is a 24-year-old married man with one child. He lives with his family at Nyamasaria in Kisumu, Kenya. He is the proprietor of a barber shop located along the Kisumu - Nairobi road. He initiated his current business in 2002. His business has done quite well due to its location and his access to loan funds. Samson is proud of his accomplishments and that he is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. He requires US $500 to further expand his business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena D. is divorced and has a grown daughter. She lives in Simferopol, where she sells women’s clothing in the central city market. Her merchandise always moves quickly because her prices are low. She is also a hard worker and works late hours, including after all other vendors are done for the day. Yelena has been in this business for four years. Currently, she grosses about $2,500 a month, while her monthly net profit is usually about $800.

Yelena has always been very committed to her family. She not only provides for her daughter and herself but also for her mentally-challenged aunt who has been living with them for awhile. Yelena would like to get a loan of $500 for 4 months to buy inventory for a new sales location that she is planning to open in the near future. She is hoping to generate additional profit so that she can do some repairs and remodel the interior of her apartment.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is divorced and has one child. She lives in the town of Ordzhonikidze, where she sells wedding accessories in the central city market. Her small business is well known for having a good assortment of merchandise at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 12 years. Every month she grosses about $3,000, $500 of which is her profit.

Yevgeniya is a skilled and hard-working manager. She is also an organized and an motivated saleswoman, with an excellent reputation among other businesspeople. She has come to us for a loan of $500 to buy more inventory. With the increased income made possible by the loan, Yevgeniya plans to continue expanding her business so she can generate a stable, good income from her current location.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory to sell to customers.

loans.name: Belarmina Alfredo Ma

texts.pt:
Belarmina Alfredo Matusse W. was born in the Caniçado Villa in the district of Guija, Province of Gaza. She is 41 years old. He has 5 brothers and she is the oldest. Belarmina did not attend school because her parents chose to educate her brothers. In 1987, she married and had 5 children, her oldest is 25 years old. She left Guijá and moved to Maputo with her husband in the Alto Maé neighborhood. She worked in the primary school as a janitor for 3 years. In 1993, they moved to the Boane district. They never worked with credit institutions before. She was introduced to HLUVUKU by friends.

Belarmina is requesting a loan of 25.000mt to expand her business of buying and fattening chicken. With the income from the business she helps her husband with the expenses. In the future she wants to have enough credit to expand her business from 500 to 750 chicks per lot.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 07 - Boane Cliente: Belarmina Alfredo Matusse W. Actividade: Agropecuaria Valor de credito: 25.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de racao vitaminas e pintos. Inicio: 17/03/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009

Belarmina Alfredo Matusse W. nasceu na vila de caniçado Distrito de Guija Provincia de Gaza a 41 anos. Tem 5 irmãos e ela e a mais velha. Não estudou devido a negligencia dos pais que nao deram prioridade a ela, obtando por mandar a escola os filhos rapazes. Em 1987 casou se e tem 5 filhos o mais velho com 25 anos de idade. Saiu de Guijá a Maputo com o seu marido e residiam no bairro do alto maé na cidade do Maputo. Trabalhou na Escola Primaria 24 de julho na mesma cidade como servente durante 3 anos. Em 1993 sairam de alto maé e transferiram para o distrito de boane, devido o custo de vida na cidade do Maputo.

Nunca havia trabalhado com instituiçoes de credito e pela 1ª vez conhece a HLUVUKU graças a conversas com as vizinhas e aproximou se para solicitar um credito no valor de 25.000MT para ampliar o seu negocio de engorde de pintos. Com os lucros ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa e guarda algum para os momentos dificeis da vida. A perpectiva futura é ter outro credito para ampliar sua capacidade de exploracao de 500 para 750 pintos por lote.

loans.use: To produce chickens

loans.name: Zumreta

texts.en: Zumreta lives with her husband and two children in the town of Rosulje, a suburb of Tešanj. Her husband has a full -time job from which he earns a monthly salary of 500 KM. Zumreta runs a small catering business and has applied for her first loan, for $950, to buy a grilling machine. The machine will help her expand her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To buy a grilling machine for a small catering business.

loans.name: Haša

texts.en: Haša is a housewife with three children who lives in the town of Tešanj. Her husband has a full-time job, but his salary is not enough to support five people.  Haša is seeking a loan of $975 to buy additional clothing to sell in the local market.  By expanding her business in this way, she hopes to earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: Buying additional clothes to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Silvia Gonçalves

texts.pt:
Silvia Gonçalves D. V. was born in Boane in 1982. She studied until the 9th grade. She had to quit school because she had children. She has 2 daughters the oldest one is 5 years old. She married when she was 20. In 2004 she started her business. Silvia learned about HLUVUKU ADSEMA through friends. She had never worked with credit institutions before but this is already her 3rd loan. Her first loan was of 7.200,00MT, the second 10.000,00MT. These were used to increase her inventory and both repaid in full.

Silvia is requesting a loan of 16.000MT to buy more products. With his loan she wants to increase her monthly income and have different products to attract more clients. In the future she wants to have enough credit to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 03 – Boane Cliente: Sílvia Gonçalves D. V. Actividade: comercio Valor de Empréstimo: 16.000MT Aplicação: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Inicio:11/03/2008 Fim: 31/08/2009

Sílvia Gonçalves D. V., nasceu em Boane aos 23/11/1982. Estudou ate a 9ª classe. Parou de estudar ceD. porque teve filhos precoce e não tinha com quem deixa-los para continuar com os estudos. Tem 2 filhas a mais velha com 6 anos de idade, Casou com 20 anos. 2004 foi o ano que começou a exercer a sua actividade. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA Graças as amigas tambem comerciantes da zona. Nunca trabalhou com instituições de credito é pela 1ª vez que lida com credito atraves da HLUVUKU, senD. 3ª vez que solicita emprestimo nesta instituicao. Teve o seu primeiro credito no valor de 7.200,00MT e o segunD. no valor de 10.000,00MT, todos foram para aumentar o stock no seu negocio, tenD. pago todos sem problemas e agora pretende outro no valor de 16.000MT para aplicar no mesmo negocio na compra de produtos diversos.

Com este credito espera aumentar a renda mensal e vai aplicar uma parte no melhoramenta da sua residencia, uma vez que com diversificacao de produtos ira atrair mais clientela. A sua perspectiva Futura e ter outro credito para aplicar no melhoramento e apetrechamento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a 33-year-old entrepreneur. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and five children. She specializes in making the local favorites, chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough). She has been in this business for the last fourteen years. The location of her business and her many years of doing good business within the community has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to KMET loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and materials and build a successful income-generating business. She has applied for US $500 to further expand her business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Mateus Manuel

texts.pt:
Mateus Manuel G. Nasceu was born on 02/03/1965 in the district of Murrombene, province of Inhambe. He studied until the 7th grade when he had to leave school and join the army. He has 4 brothers, he is married and father of 4 sons. His oldest son is 20 years old. In 1980 he left Murrombene to the district of Chinduachine to join the compulsory army services where he stayed for 6 months. In 1980 he left Chinduachine to Boane. He then joined the police department. Starting in 1984 Mateus worked for 9 years at the warehouse at the military camp.

He now works as a driver for the bus system in Boane. He started his business in 2000 with his wife. Mateus joined another credit institution called TCHUMA first, but switched to HLUVUKU ADSEMA due to recommendation from friends and clients. With the loan of 20.000mt he wants to increase his inventory. With the income from the business Mateus supports his family and pays for the schooling of his children. In the future he plans on improving his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane Cliente: Mateus Manuel G. Actividade: Comercio Valor de Credito: 20.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Inicio: 25/02/2008 Fim: 31/05/2009

Mateus Manuel G. Nasceu aos 02/03/1965 no Distrito de Murrombene, Província de Inhambane. Estudou ate a 7ª classe, parou cedo porque teve que cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório. Tem 4 irmãos, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos sendo o mais velho de 20 anos de idade. Em 1980 saiu de Murrombene a Chinduachine Distrito de Chibuto para cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, onde permaneceu durante 6 messes no campo de batalha. Nos meados de 1980 saiu de Chinduachine ao quartel de Boane para concluir com o serviço militar. Findo o trabalho manteve se a trabalhar como policia militar. Em 1984 mudou de sector e trabalhou como armazenista do quartel onde durou 9 anos. De 1991 a 2003 trabalhou na Equimep – Empresa de reparacao de estradas como motorista. De 2004 ate então trabalha como motorista dos transportes semi colectivos de Boane. Começou a praticar o negocio no ano 2000 e na sua ausência a mulher é que assume a responsabilidade de tudo. Já trabalhou com uma instituição de credito de nome TCHUMA mas já não esta a aderir porque os serviços não o satisfizeram.

Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças as conversas que tem tido com os amigos e clientes. Com o emprestimo de 20.000,00MT pretende reforçar o stock dos produtos de modo a satisfazer cada as necessidades dos seus clientes. Com os lucros suporta as despesas de educação dos filhos e poupa algum para os momentos difíceis da vida. A Perspectiva futura e ter um credito para aplicar no melhoramento das condiçoes habitacionais da familia.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a trader who sells slippers. She is a single parent with seven dependents. Business is going very well. But she wishes to increase her income to enable her meet the family needs.

She is asking for $525.00 so that she can buy more slippers and other items that are of high demand in her area.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and other high-demand items to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41790

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. is a trader who sells rice. She is married and has five children. She is working very hard to support with the family’s financial needs. She wishes to increase sale to meet her increasing demand.

She is asking for $325.00 as an additional capital to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41791

loans.name: Fenias Matias

texts.pt:
Fenias Matias C. was born on and raised in the district of Boane. She is 28 years old. She studied only until the 7th grade because her parents could not afford to send her to school. She started apprenticing with a carpenter and worked for two years without a salary. When she mastered the craft she started getting paid but it was not enough to cover her expenses. She married at 24 and had a son.

Fenia has borrowed through HLUVUKU before. Her first loan was of 6.500mt which she repaid in full. She received more orders from clients and to fulfill those she is requesting a loan 13.000mt to buy more lwood. With the income from the business Fenia supports her family and tries to save. In the future she hopes to have credit to buy more tools and be able to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: KM -16 - Boane Cliente: Fenias Matias C. Actividade: Transformacao Valor de Empréstimo: 13.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de Madeira para fabrico de Mobiliario Inicio: 25/02/2008 Fim: 31/05/2009

Fenias Matias C. Nasceu a 28 anos no distrito rural de Boane. Estudou ate a 7ª classe, devido as limitações financeiras dos pais teve de parar muito cedo de estudar. Depois de ter imterrompido os estudos decidiu juntar a um mestre carpinteiro da zona para aprender a arte, tendo estagiado durante dois anos quase sem salario. Depois de aperfeiçoar foi quando comecou a ter salario, mas como nao satisfazia as minimas necessidades dele optou por iniciar seu proprio negocio de fabrico de mobiliario. Casou se com 24 anos e tem actualmente 1 filho. Já teve um credito com HLUVUKU no valor 6.500,00MT para os mesmos fins, tendo efectuado muito bem os pagamentos.

Como as encomendas dos clientes foram crescendo, teve de recorrer ao segundo credito no valor de 13.000,00MT cuja aplicaçao sera na compra de madeira serrada. Com os lucros sustenta a família e poupa algum para os momentos difíceis da vida. A perspectiva futura e ter um credito para compra de ferramentas importantes, tais como a serra maior de madeira, assim como madeira em quantidade de modo a responder a demanda pela procura dos seus serviços.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells maize, cassava, and groundnut. She buys them in large quantities and then sells them to her costumers. She is married and has three children. Business is going well and she wishes to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more stock to meet the demand of her increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale to meet the increasing demand

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41793

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela O. is a fishmonger. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her costumers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process and sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41794

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. is in the fish business--a fishmonger to be precise. Currently, her husband is a farmer and they have three children. Previously she sold sauce pans but the business went bad and she has now diverted to selling fish, which is going well at the moment.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to enable her to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to enable her buy more fish for processing.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41795

loans.name: Armando Maculane

texts.pt:
Armando Maculane C. was born in June, 1962. He studied until the 4th grade and had to stop attending school because his family could not afford it. He has 2 brothers and he is the oldest. He married when he was 42 years old and he now has 2 children, the oldest is 12 years old. In 1979 he moved from Inhambe to Maputo in search of a job. He worked with coal and charcoal in the Boane district. In 1980he started to work as a baker in Boane. He worked there for 12 years.

Since 1992 he has been working at the Caminhos de Ferro de Mozambique – Mozambique Rail Road – as a track operator. He was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by his co-workers. With the loan of 11.000mt Armando plans on buying construction material for his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 3 - Boane Cliente:Armando Maculane C. Actividade: Habitação Valor de credito: 11.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 10/03/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Armando Maculane C. nasceu em inhambane em junho de 1962, estudou ate a 4ª classe e por falta de condições teve que parar de frequentar a escola. Tem 2 irmãos e ele mais velho.Casou se oficialmente aos 42 anos de idade e tem actualmente 2 filhos e o mais velho tem 12 anos de idade. Em 1979 saiu de Inhambane a Maputo a procura de emprego. Trabalhou como carvoeiro no distrito de Boane. Em 1980 começou a trabalhar como padeiro na padaria velhinho em boane, tendo trabalhado 12 anos. De 1992 ate entao encontra se a trabalhar nos (CFM) Caminhos De Ferro De Moçambique como operário da fabrica de travessas de linha ferrea.

Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças a converças com colegas do servico. Com emprestimo de 11.000,00MT pretende dar continuidade com a construcao da residencia principal da familia que ainda nao oferece minimas condicoes. A sua prespectiva futura é ter outro credito para aplicar no apetrechamento da casa.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta F. is a trader who sells fruit. She is a single parent of one child. Business is going very well and she wishes to increase her sales, which will increase her income, but she lacks enough funds.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41797

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama O. is a fishmonger. She is married and has five children. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells it to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41798

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives on Street A in the Llojeta Bajo zone of the city of La Paz.

She lives with her son, who works as a bus driver. She runs a general store from her home, where she has worked for several years tending to customers in the area.

The loan that Martha now seeks would be invested in purchasing merchandise for her business and, in that way, she would be able to offer a greater variety of products and increase her earnings.

Martha has been an IMPRO client since 2002. The financial evaluation conducted qualifies her to obtain credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha vive en la calle A de la zona de Llojeta Bajo de la cuidad de la Paz. Vive junto a su hijo el cual trabaja como conductor de minibús. Ella posee una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propio domicilio donde trabaja por varios años atendiendo a los clientes de su zona. El crédito que ahora Martha solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Martha es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. prepares palm oil to sell. She is married and has three children. She wants to increase production but lacks funding.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more oil palm fruit, which is the major raw material for the oil production.

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruit to produce more palm oil

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41800

loans.name: Virginia Lourenço

texts.pt:
Virgínia Lourenço S. was born on 23/04/1970 in Manhica, a Maputo province. She studied until the 6th grade because her family could not afford to send her to school. She had 11 brothers and sisters but 7 did not survive. She now has 5 brothers. She married when she was 19 years old, and has 6 children. The oldest is 20 years old. In 1987 she started selling groceries to help her husband with the family expenses. She joined the CCP credit association before but did not like it because some group members were not being responsible. This is the 2nd loan she is requesting through HLUVUKU. The first loan was of 7.000MT.

Virginia is requesting a loan of 16.000MT to improve her house. In the future she plans on acquiring more credit to improve her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 4 - Boane Cliente: Virgínia Lourenço S. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo: 16.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de Material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 31/05/2009 Virgínia Lourenço S. Nasceu aos 23/04/1970 na Manhica Província de Maputo. Estudou ate a 6ª classe e porque a familia não reunia condições suficiente teve de parar de estudar. Tinha 11 irmãos , morreram 7. Actualmente tem 5 irmãos, dos quais 4 maternos e 1 paternos. Casou se com 19 anos de idade e tem 6 filhos o mas velho com 20 anos de idade. Em 1987 começou a praticar o seu negocio de venda de produtos alimentares para ajudar o marido nas despesas familiares. Já foi membro de grupo de uma Associação de créditos de nome CCP e teve que desvincular se for falta de sereidade de alguns de membros do grupo.

Ė pela 2ª vez que trabalha com a HLUVUKU, teve o 1ª credito no valor de 7.000,00MT que aplicou para o comercio tendo pago sem problemas, e agora pretende o valor de 16.000,00MT para a dar continuidade com o melhoramento da residencia familiar. A perspectiva futura e ter outro credito para aplicar na compra de bens de apetrechamento da casa.

loans.use: To construction material to build families house

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio lives on Viscachani Street in the Alto Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife and two children, and works in construction and also selling CDs throughout the streets of the city.

The loan would be invested in the purchase of more CDs for his business so he can increase his earnings for his family.

This is his first credit with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregorio vive en la calle Viscachani de zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos,; trabaja como constructor y también se dedica a la venta de CDs por las calles de la ciudad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de más CDS para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase more CDs for his business.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job A. is a trader who buys cocoa from farmers and sells to a company called OLAM GH Ltd Co. He is married and has nine dependents. Business is booming and he wishes to increase sales but lacks funding.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41803

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa lives on Santa Rosa Street in the Alto la Portada zone of the city of La Paz. She dedicates herself to the sale of fruits in one of the busy streets of the city.

The loan would be invested in the purchase of merchandise (fruits such as grapes, cherimoyas, peaches, etc.) for her business, and in that way help to increase the family’s income.

This is the sixth loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted indicates she qualifies to receive credit. She is an IMPRO client since 2001.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Josefa vive en la calle Santa Rosa de la zona de Alto la Portada de la ciudad de la Paz. Se dedica a la venta de frutas en una de las calles populosas de la ciudad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería (frutas como uva, chirimoya, duraznos, etc.) para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el sexto crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2001.

loans.use: Needs more capital to purchase merchandise for fruit stand.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina A. is a hairdresser and her husband is a carpenter. They have three children. Celestina's customers have increased but she lacks funding to expand her business.

She is asking for $275.00 to use as additional capital to buy more creams and other items that she needs to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy more creams and other items she needs to run her business smoothly

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41805

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo lives on Luis Espinal Street in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children, and works making wood shelves/cabinets in his home-based shop.

The loan would be invested into purchasing wood for his business so that he can increase his earnings.

It is the first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonardo vive en la avenida Luis Espinal de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, trabaja como fabricante de estantes de madera en su taller ubicado en su propio domicilio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de madera para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase wood for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo lives on J. Badan Street in the Villa Dolores zone of the city of El Alto.

He dedicates himself to making soccer balls, which he markets as a street vendor throughout the city.

The loan would be invested into purchasing supplies (leather and special thread) for his business, so that he can increase his earnings.

This is his seventh loan with IMPRO, and the second through KIVA. The evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirilo vive en la calle J. Badani de zona de Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto. Se dedica a la elaboración de balones de fútbol los cuales los comercializa como vendedor ambulante en las calles de la ciudad. El crédito le invertirá en la compra de insumos (cuero e hilo especial) para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el séptimo crédito con Impro. Y el segundo que va vía KIVA. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase leather and thread for soccer ball production business.

loans.name: Generosa Mario

texts.pt:
Generosa Mario M. was born in Chicumbane in the district of XaiXai in Gaza. She is 42 years old. She studied until the 10 th grade and had to stop attending school because she became pregnant. She lives with her son and 7 brothers. In 1998 she started working at the Boane conservatory as a technical assistant, she has been there ever since. She joined the Tchuma credit program before but did not continue because the interest rates were too high.

Generosa was introduced to HLUVUKU by her co-workers. With the loan of 10,000mt she wants to buy construction material to build her home. In the future she wants to have enough credit to furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 6 - Boane Cliente: Generosa Mario M. Actividade: Habitação Valor de credito: 10.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 10/03/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Generosa Mario M. Nasceu em Chicumbane distrito de Xai Xai provincia de gaza a 42 anos. Estudou ate a 10ª classe e teve que parar porque ficou gravida sem ter planificado. Tem actualmente um fiho pequeno e 7 irmaos sendo ela a 3ª. Saiu de Xai xai a Boane com os pais, ela ainda era criança e vieram para aquele distrito acompanhando o pai que tinha sido transferido. Em 1998 começou a trabalhar na conservatoria de boane como assistente tecnica dos registos e notariados onde esta ate então.

Ja foi cliente da cooperativa de creditos de nome Tchuma e abandonou porque considera os juros altos. Descobre a HLUVUKU graças a converças com colegas do trabalho. Com emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar materiais de construcao para dar continuidade com as obras da residencia familiar. A sua prespectiva futura é ter outro credito para aplicar na compra de alguns bens de uso familiar.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena A. buys cocoa from the farmers and sells it to a company called OLAM GH Ltd Co. His wife is a fishmonger and they have eight dependents. Business is going well and he plans to increase sales but he has inadequate funds.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41809

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. prepares palm oil to sell. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She wants to increase production but lacks funding.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more oil palm fruit, which is the major raw material for the oil production.

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruit for oil production

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41810

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. prepares palm oil for sale. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She wants to increase production but lacks funding.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more oil palm fruit, which is the major raw material for the oil production.

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruit to produce palm oil

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41811

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa A. is a fishmonger. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells the fish to her customers. She is married to a commercial driver and has five children. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41812

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah P. is a fishmonger. She buys fish fresh from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells the fish to her customers. She is married to a commercial driver and has five children. She wants to increase sales to meet the demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41813

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana S. has a provision store but she is also a seamstress. She is married to a cocoa seller and has three children with him. Her shop is generating a lot of income, which she is using to support the family’s finances. She wishes to increase sales.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more Milo, Milk, soap and other items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more Milo, Milk, soap, and other items for her shop

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41814

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa B. prepares food for sale. She is married and has three children. She is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s finances. She plans to increase production and sales to increase her income.

She is asking for $250.00 as additional capital to buy raw materials for food production.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for food production

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Like other women in Kormasilai village, Sarah grows rice, the main staple food crop, in addition to vegetables.

Sarah is very happy with the agricultural loan program that was introduced late last year by Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT). With her loan, Sarah hired labourers and purchased fertilizer and vegetable seeds. Sarah harvested 60% more rice than before and her vegetable harvest also increased by 40%. Thus encouraged, Sarah is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 to expand her farm so that it can produce enough crops and vegetables to support her family and provide them with a sufficient income.

loans.use: To expand her farm

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed C. is 70 years old, but is still strong enough to do farm work. Muhamed has 10 children, of which, 4 are now married.

With a loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), he was able to harvest 40 bags of rice. He sold 15 bags and used the cash to buy other crops, like pepper to resell to earn more income. He is happy that his children have enough food this year. He would like to grow more crops for both consumption and for sale. He plans to build a better house for the family. Muhamed is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000.

Muhamed has lived his life as a farmer. With his recent help from SMT, and hopefully, from Kiva, he will continue his new life as a successful farmer who can easily feed his family and care for them they way he always wanted.

loans.use: To grow more crops for consumption and sale

loans.name: Sokor Marie

texts.en:
Sokor is 55 years old and married to 2 wives with 11 children. Sokor and the wives grow vegetables and rice for family consumption, but could experience hunger during certain periods of the year.

Sokor had a previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) that allowed him to start the expansion of his farming operations. He needs an additional loan from Kiva to continue that growth.

With his loan, Sakor hired labourers and purchased vegetable seeds and fertilizer. The family had a 50% increase in their production. Sokor repaid the loan with the profit from selling the vegetables, and purchased zinc sheets for building a family house with the profit from selling the rice. The wives are very happy and would like to expand their farm activities further. Sokor is therefore requesting for loan of Le.1,000,000.

loans.use: To expand his vegetable farm

loans.name: Muhamed S.

texts.en:
Muhamed S. C. is 37 years old and married with 3 children. He grows rice and vegetables. With his first SMT loan, he was able to harvest 1200 heads of cabbage and earned a good profit. His rice production also increased by 5 bags and he is planning to sell some bags soon. C. would like to be a commercial rice farmer and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 for the purpose.

Mr. C. has a goal of becoming a commercial rice farmer. He needs additional inputs, land, and labourers to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: For supplies, land, and labor needed to become a commercial rice farmer

loans.name: Mohamed S.

texts.en:
Mohamed is 45 years old and married to 2 wives with 7 children. With a big family, Mohamed needs to work hard to feed them.

With a previous SMT loan, Mohamed invested in growing vegetables near the swamp. He had a good harvest and invested the income in growing rice and pigeon peas. Mohamed just established a small kiosk within the homestead to generate income during the off farming season. He is very happy that he could generate money from farm activities and would like to expand the rice production for commercial purposes and consumption. Le.1, 000,000 loan will help him achieve his dream.

Mohamed has diversified his sources of income and has been able to generate profits from his farm activities with the previous loan from SMT. He would like to take another loan from Kiva to continue to improve his profits on the farm.

loans.use: To expand his rice production

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.en:
“Vencedoras” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with educational services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level). People there have to contend with the cold, difficulty growing crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

Community Bank “Vencedoras” is located in the community of Locroja in the district with the same name, and province of Churcampa. The main activities of the population are growing corn (lower altitudes), potatoes and wheat (higher altitudes) and raising cows and bulls, guinea-pigs, pigs, and chickens.

Currently this community bank has completed its first loan-cycle and just half a year of existence with 11 female borrowers and a total loan of 2,500 soles (about US$ 900). The individual loans range from 100, 200, up to 300 soles. Besides repaying their loans, the group was able to save over 2,100 soles (about US$ 750) during their first loan-cycle and will continue to save in the future. For all members, the main use of the savings is for investing in their business or for the education of their children: to buy school uniforms, supplies, books, and even to pay for entering primary or secondary school.

During their first loan-cycle, the members have learned many things: to be responsible, to save for future investment, and have received training in a variety of issues. Another thing they like is practicing values like punctuality, responsibility and solidarity.

One of the group members, Nieves Aurora B. A., sells vegetables, fruit, and clothes. To earn a little more money, she also raises guinea-pigs and pigs. With her 300 soles loan, she will buy new supplies for her small business. When asked about her future, she tells us that her main dream is for her family to have a better quality of life, that she will be saving for the education of her children so they can be professionals, keep studying, and maybe in the future, even work for an institution like FINCA. What she has learned until now in FINCA is to give a name to her savings, making it easier to save more because she knows exactly why she is saving.

Ana Marcela B., who has a small grocery store in the community and also sells clothes tells a slightly different story. With her loan of 300 soles, she will be also able to buy more supplies for her store. Her dream for the future is for her children to study and become professionals. Besides that, she wishes to move to the city of Huancayo and build a house there, where she can have a bigger store and earn more. With her savings she wants to buy more supplies. In FINCA she has learned to respect and to be respected by the others, and has learned to save.

loans.use: purchasing new supplies for their various small businesses

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.es:
Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita have been members of the Sonrisa (Smile) Community Bank for three, three, and four months respectively.

Erlinda, a 30 year old woman, shares her home with her four children. She works producing artisian bricks in her small town of Huayllapampa. Additionally Erlinda buys and sells pigs.

Estilista is a 42 year old woman with three children. Estilista rents a small sewing shop in which she produces clothing.

Sarita is a 31 year old married woman with two children. She sells clothing by contract to her family and friends. She also sells wines brought from Ica in stores and the markets.

Erlinda, Estilista and Satira need a loan of S./ 1,600 ($560), S./400 ($150), and S./600 ($215) respectively. These funds will be invested in the purchase of sand, tools, paint, and wine.

The dreams of Erlinda, Estilista and Sarita are to have a larger shop, to provide for their children to attend college and to purchase a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sonrisa hace 3años, 3 años, 4 meses respectivamente.

Erlinda es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Erlinda se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en su pueblo de Huayllapampa. Además Erlinda compra y vende Tara, cochinilla.

Por otro lado Estilista es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Estilista tiene su taller de confección de prendas de vestir, en un local alquilado.

Mientras que Sarita es casada, tiene 31 y 2 hijos, Sarita vende ropa a pedido a sus amigos y familiares. Además Sarita vende vinos que son traídos de Ica, sus ventas lo realiza en tiendas y mercados.

Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita necesitan préstamos de 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena, herramientas, pinturas y vinos.

Los sueños de Erlinda, Estilista y Sarita son tener un taller más grande, que sus hijos estudien en la universidad y comprar un terreno.

loans.use: Erlinda, Estilista and Satira need a loan of S./ 1,600 ($560), S./400 ($150), and S./600 ($215) respectively.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of sand, tools, paint, and wine.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda A. is a 42 year-old resident of the Fise community of Greater Accra with 4 children.  She has over 4 years of experience in the sale of traditional cloth, including those she imports from nearby Togo.  She would like to expand the inventory of  her shop in central Accra with a loan of $600 (8 months).

loans.use: Amanda would like to expand the inventory of her business.

loans.name: San Cristobal Group

texts.en:
The women of the ‘San Cristobal’ village bank are entering their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and are eagerly awaiting the approval of their newly requested loans. The fifteen women know each other well, living as neighbors in a rural village just outside of Chimaltenango. Now, in addition to being neighbors, they are learning to become confidants and support each other in business, sharing ideas for success, and helping one another overcome obstacles. After the success of their first loan, other women took note and have joined the group. The veteran members will teach them about solidarity and responsibility within the group. They are confident of their ability to repay, and excited to take on this new challenge.

All fifteen women are weavers, crafting beautiful "huipiles," the traditional Mayan blouse, whose intricate designs reveal a woman’s hometown, marital status, or beliefs. A single huipil C. take up to three months to produce, working all day. After an initial investment of about $30-$50, it C. be sold for up to $200. The women also save money by weaving for themselves, rather than buying from others.

They are asking for a loan of 24,000 quetzales, about $3150 USD, with which they will purchase thread in bulk to weave the huipiles, as well as skirts and belts and other crafts. Some of the women sell their weaving in markets in the nearby town of Chimaltenango, and most are well known in their own village and receive orders from friends and neighbors. Buying in bulk drastically lowers the cost of thread, and it also cuts back on the trips that must be made to the market to buy materials, saving on time and travel expenses.
