The women are excited about their loan and the possibility of better providing for their families. They dream of being able to support their children in school past 6th grade, opening up opportunities for them that will help stop the cycle of poverty within their families.

(The two women who are not pictured had come to the meeting but left to take care of their children before the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.es:
Teresa, Lucia, and Norma have been members of the Sonrisa (Smile) Community Bank for 1 year, 1 year and 8 months respectively.

Teresa is a 50 year old married woman with four children. Teresa is a traditional artist and shapes alabaster stones. She sells the stones in a shop in Ayacucho and both at the national and international level.

Lucia is a 44 year old married woman with four children. Lucia travels to the regional fairs three times a week to purchase grains and cereals. These she sells in the different markets of Ayacucho.

Norma is a 24 year old woman and shares her home with her one daughter. Norma recently opened a stall in the Santa Clara market in which she sells hardware & tools.

Teresa, Lucia and Norma need a loan of S./1,200, S./1,400 and S./600 respectively. These funds will be used to purchase alabaster stone, tools, corn, barley, wheat, locks and nails.

Teresa, Lucia and Norma’s dreams are to grow their businesses, increase their capital, own their own shops and homes and provide their children with good educations.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa, Lucia y Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Sonrisa hace 1 año, 1 año, 8 meses respectivamente.

Teresa es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Teresa es artesana en tallado de piedra de Huamanga (alabastro), sus trabajos lo vende a nivel nacional e internacional, además tiene un puesto en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Lucia es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Lucia viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana, donde compra cereales y lo vende en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Norma es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Norma tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara donde vende artículos de ferretería, actividad que recién ha iniciado.

Teresa, Lucia y Norma necesitan un préstamo de 1200 soles, 1400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra de Huamanga, herramientas, maíz, cebada, trigo, candados, clavos.

Los sueños de Teresa, Lucia y Norma son mejorar su negocio, tener más capital, puesto propio, casa propia y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Teresa, Lucia and Norma need a loan of S./1,200, S./1,400 and S./600 respectively.  These funds will be used to purchase alabaster stone, tools, corn, barley, wheat, locks and nails.

loans.name: Aminah Diana

texts.en: Diana is a 43 year-old married resident of Sapeman in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.  She has over 8 years of experience in the retail sales of used clothing and other cloth items such as curtains.  She is seeking a loan of $500 (8 months) so as to expand her business to serve the market in adjacent communities.

loans.use: Aminah is looking to expand her business to serve the market in adjacent communities.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina A. G. is a female resident of the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León in Nicaragua. Carolina is a stay at home mother with three school age children. Her husband earns the only family wages as an agricultural laborer. He has worked in this industry for many years and it has provided the family with the ability to maintain their humble home.

Carolina lives far from the city and lack electricity. For this reason she purchased a solar panel to illuminate her home. In order to acquire the solar panel she took a loan from a vendor, and now is in urgent need of canceling this debt. Given her situation Carolina has requested the assistance of CEPRODEL.

Carolina is requesting a loan to repay the debt of the solar panel. This will enable her to better the families life style and help them to further provide for the successful futures of their children.

Carolina A. G. es una dama habitante del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Se dedica a la labor de ama de casa y atención a sus tres hijos todos en edad escolar. Su ingreso económico depende de su esposo cuyo trabajo es la agricultura a la que se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta manera el le brinda el recurso económico para que ella lo administre en su humilde hogar.

La necesidad de la señora Carolina radical en que debido a que no poseen energía eléctrica por vivir en un sector alejado, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para iluminarse. Al haber adquirido este panel necesita con urgencia cancelar esta deuda y es por este motivo que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita salir de esa deuda y de esta manera mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos que en un futuro serán unos profesionales de éxito.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel.

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida has been a part of the Bank Comunal “Sonrisa”, which means smile, for the past 5 years.

Frida is a 57 year-old, separated mother of 8 children, two still live with her. She lives in the community of Viñaca in the district of San José de Ticllas. Frida buys Tara (dye derived from a plant)) and also harvests her crops which she sells to intermediaries. In addition, Frida grows vegetables and raises cattle.

Frida needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = 1 dollar), which she will invest in buying Tara, cochineal (dye derived from an insect) and fertilizers.

Frida’s dream is to have a house in the city of Ayacucho, a business that grows and prospers, and that her 2 youngest children become professionals.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste.

Frida pertenece al Banco Comunal Sonrisa hace 5 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser puntual y responsable.

Frida es separada, tiene 57 años y 8 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Frida vive en la comunidad de Viñaca, Distrito de San José de Ticllas. Frida compra tara y también cosecha de sus tierras, estos productos son vendidos a intermediarios. Además Frida se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y a la crianza de ganado vacuno.

Frida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla, fertilizantes para la agricultura.

Los sueños de Frida son tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, que su negocio sea más grande y que sus dos últimos hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To invest in buying Tara (dye derived from a plant), cochineal (dye derived from an insect) and fertilizers.

loans.name: Erenia

texts.es:
Ever since Erelia L. was very young she has worked in the agricultural industry in Achuapa in the city of León. Thanks to her great efforts as a mother she has been able to improve her son’s life and push him to study in the humble municipal school.

It is important to emphasize that her son has been an excellent student. His success is very much a product of the investment Erelia has made in his studies. Erelia has been successful in pushing her son forward through great effort and the returns from her hard work in agriculture.

One of Erelia’s needs is to have electricity. The area she lives in does not provide electricity. In order to obtain electricity Erelia purchased a solar panel with a loan. This debt is outstanding with another institution and needs to be canceled as soon as possible.

Erelia has requested a loan from CEPRODEL in order to cover the debt and begin to truly make use of the new asset of electricity. This will help her son to continue developing intellectually.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Erelia L. desde muy joven se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura en el municipio de Achuapa de la ciudad de León. Gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos de madre ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo que estudia en un humilde colegio del municipio.

Es importante destacar que su hijo ha sido un excelente estudiante en su colegio debido a que la señora L. ha invertido mucho en su estudio y esto lo ha logrado con muchísimo esfuerzo por medio de su trabajo de agricultura. Una de las necesidades que la señora L. posee es la energía eléctrica por el hecho de que en el lugar donde vive no se cuenta con energía y por tal razón ha implementado un panel solar el cual tiene que cubrir esta deuda lo más pronto posible. Por tal motivo acude a CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito que le permita cubrir la deuda y comenzar a aprovechar el nuevo recurso de la energía eléctrica para que su hijo continúe desarrollándose intelectualmente.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel.

loans.name: Las Margaritas I Group

texts.en:
The 32 women of the "Las Margaritas" village bank come from a small town, Yepocapa, nestled quietly between the Fuego and Acatenango volcanoes, two hours from paved roads. With this tranquil isolation also comes limited opportunity, but microfinance has opened the doors to small loans that will lessen the burden of providing basic needs for their families.

The women of Las Margaritas have a variety of businesses, and 15 of the 32 have requested a loan of 25,100 quetzales ($3,300 USD), ranging from $100 to $400 per person. These fifteen women are weavers, an art most women learn as children. They will invest their loan in colorful threads with which they will craft beautiful "huipiles," the traditional Mayan blouses that can take up to 3 months to make. A typical huipil requires a $30 investment and can be sold for about $100-$200, depending on the design and time required to make it. They also weave skirts, belts, and blankets that they sell to neighbors who place orders, or in the markets of the closest cities.

They will pay their loan back over the next year, and are eager to begin saving for their children’s education, which they say is the most important thing to them, and the reason they work as hard as they do.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Mrs. Josefina H. and her husband breed cattle in the municipality of Achuapa of the city of León. Throughout the years Mrs H. has sought to improve the conditions of her home by investing a few resources in the restructuring of her home, so she and her husband can offer their two children a better lifestyle.

All their life, the H. have been affected by the lack of electric power since they live in a far away rural area. For this reason they have acquired a solar panel that will provide them with some electricity. Mrs. H. seeks the support of CEPRODEL so they can provide her with a loan and in this way improve the conditions of their home and take full advantage of the electric power the panel generates.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Josefina H. y su esposo es a la crianza de Ganado en el municipio de Achuapa de la ciudad de León. A través de los años la señora Josefina se ha venido preocupando por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar de habitación y para ello ha buscado la manera de invertir sus pocos recursos en la remodelación de su hogar para lograr brindarles una mejor condición de vida a sus dos hijos.

Una problemática que toda la vida ha tenido la señora Josefina es que no ha tenido energía eléctrica por vivir en una zona rural muy alejada. Por esta razón ha logrado adquirir un panel solar para aprovechar la energía eléctrica para su hogar. Al adquirir el panel le es de urgencia obtener el recurso económico para cancelar esta deuda. Es por tal motivo que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un préstamo que le permita cancelar la deuda y comenzar a sacarle el provecho a la energía electita sin ningún problema.

loans.use: To Pay for a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Inocenta's Group

texts.es:
Inocenta, Nancy, and Placida have been members of the Comunal Orcasitas microfinance institution for a year. They live in the Orcasitas community, located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

Inocenta is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She has a small general store in her home. She and her husband also make handcrafted tiles.

Nancy is a 30-year-old mother of two. Nancy and her husband make handcrafted tiles as well.

Placida is a 56-year-old mother of 8 children, 6 of whom still live with her. Placida buys and sells tara and cochineal insects. She makes handcrafted tiles as well.

Inocenta, Nancy, and Placida need loans of 1000, 600, and 900 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in paying laborers, and purchasing sugar, rice, noodles, cereal, tara pods, and cochineal insects.

Inocenta, Nancy, and Placida dream of increasing their profits and seeing their children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Inocenta, Nancy y Placida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Orcasitas, hace 1 año, ellas son D. la comunidad D. Orcasitas, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Inocenta es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Inocenta tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Además, Inocenta junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales.

Por otro lado Nancy es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Nancy junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales.

Mientras que Placida es casada, tiene 56 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Placida compra y venD. tara y cochinilla. Además fabrica ladrillos artesanales.

Inocenta, Nancy y Placida necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, cereales, tara, cochinilla y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Inocenta, Nancy y Placida son incrementar el capital D. sus negocios, que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante en todo.

loans.use: Payment of laborers and purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, cereal, tara pods (a source of tannins) and cochineal insect (used for dyes)

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
For a very long time, Lorena Velasquez and her husband have been running an agricultural business in the municipality of Achuapa of the city of León. In spite of their low income, Mrs. Velasquez works very hard to provide their son with the education he deserves, so he can become a successful professional.

A very worrying situation that the Velasquez family encounters is that they do not have electric power since they live in a far away rural area. Due to the latter, Mrs. Velasquez has acquired a debt to purchase a solar panel for her home. Her priority is to cancel this debt, and for that reason she seeks the support of CEPRODEL so they can provide her with a loan and in this way improve the conditions of their home and take full advantage of the electric power the panel generates.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Lorena Velasquez desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de agricultura junto con su esposo en el municipio de Achuapa de la ciudad de León. A pesar de sus bajos ingresos económicos la señora Lorena día a día se esfuerza grandemente para brindarle a su hijo los estudio que el se merece y de esta manera lograr llegar a ser un gran profesional

Una situación muy preocupante que atraviesa la señora Lorena y su familia es que no poseen energía eléctrica para iluminarse ni hacer los quehaceres por el hecho de que viven en una localidad rural donde es muy difícil de llegar. Por esta razón ha adquirido una deuda al haber implantado un panel solar en su hogar y su necesidad mayor es la cancelación de esta deuda. Por este motivo busca apoyo en CEPRODEL para que le aprueben un crédito y de esta forma mejorar la condición de vida de su humilde hogar aprovechando al máximo la energía eléctrica.

loans.use: To Pay for  a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.es:
Juana, Maria, and Elizabeth have been members of the Orcasitas communal bank for one year. They live in the Orcasitas community, located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

Juana is 22 years of age and lives with her partner. Juana buys tara pods and cochineal insects, then sells them to middlemen. She also sells food at her local stadium on Sundays.

Maria is a 49-year-old married mother of 6. Maria and her husband make handcrafted tiles.

Elizabeth is a 24-year-old who lives with her partner and her only son. She buys tara pods and cochineal insects, then sells them to middlemen. She also sells drinks at her local stadium.

Juana, Maria, and Elizabeth needs loans of 900, 300, and 1750 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of tara pods, cochineal insects, sand, molds, beer, and soft drinks.

Juana, Maria, and Elizabeth dream of advancing in their businesses, owning a house, and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, Maria y Elizabeth pertenecen al Banco Comunal Orcasitas hace 1 año. ellas son de la comunidad de Orcasitas, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Juana es conviviente y tiene 22 años, Juana compra tara, cochinilla y lo vende a intermediarios. Además Juana vende comida los días domingos en el estadio de su comunidad.

Por otro lado Maria es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales.

Mientras que Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth compra tara, cochinilla y lo vende a intermediarios. Además Elizabeth vende bebidas en el estadio de su comunidad.

Juana, Maria y Elizabeth necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 300 soles, 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla, arena, moldes, cerveza y gaseosa.

Los sueños de Juana, Maria y Elizabeth son progresar mas con sus negocios, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of tara pods (a source of tannins), cochineal insects (used for dyes), sand, molds, beer, and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.es:
Paula, Betzabeth, and Rosa are members of the Orcasitas communal bank. They are from Orcasitas, located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

Paula is a 65-year-old widow with 6 children, 2 of whom still live with her. Betzabeth, on the other hand, is a 19-year-old woman who lives with her partner and her only son. Rosa is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her partner and 2 children.

Paula, Betzabeth, and Rosa make handcrafted tiles in their community for a living. They sell their products to middlemen in the same community. They also buy prickly pears, cochineal insects, and tara pods. They ship the prickly pears to the city of Lima, while they sell the insects and tara pods within their community.

Paula, Betzabeth, and Rosa need loans of 1000, 900, and 750 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in paying laborers and purchasing tara pods, cochineal insects, sand, molds, and tools.

Paula, Betzabeth, and Rosa dream of increasing their profits, buying a car to transport their products, building their own house, and providing an education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Paula, Betzabeth y Rosa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Orcasitas, ellas son D. la comunidad D. Orcasitas, ubicado a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Paula es viuda tiene 65 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 2 viven con ella, por otro lado Betzabeth es conviviente, tiene 19 años y 1 hijo, mientras que Rosa es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos.

Paula, Betzabeth y Rosa se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales en su comunidad, sus ventas lo realizan en su misma comunidad a intermediarios. Además compran tuna, cochinilla y tara, la tuna lo envían a la ciudad D. Lima, mientras que la tara y cochinilla lo venden en su misma comunidad.

Paula, Betzabeth y Rosa necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 900 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara, cochinilla, arena, moldes, herramientas y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Paula, Betzabeth y Rosa son tener capital propio, un carro para transportar sus productos, construir su casa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Payment of laborers, and purchase of tara pods (a source of tannins), cochineal insects (used for dyes), sand, molds, and tools

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucrecia H. is a hard working person, and with her husband she runs a farming business since some time ago in the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León. The couple has two small children, and in order improve their living condition she obtained a solar panel, since they live in a far away rural area that does not have electric power.

Upon acquiring this debt Mrs H. , is seeking the support of Ceprodel so she can obtain a loan to repay the panel. This will allow her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Lucrecia H. es una persona muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de agricultura junto con su esposo desde hace varios años en la comunidad de Achuapa de la ciudad de León. Consiente de su responsabilidad con sus dos pequeños hijos, la señora Lucrecia ha tratado de mejorar la condición de su vivienda y debido a que no posee energía eléctrica en su hogar por vivir en una zona rural, la solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para aprovechar la energía.

Al haber obtenido el panel solar, la señora Lucrecia tiene la responsabilidad de cancelar esta deuda y por tal razón busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera suplir las necesidades que su familia atraviesa hoy en día.

loans.use: To Pay for a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Las Margaritas Ii Group

texts.en:
The 32 women of Las Margaritas are neighbors in their small village of Yepocapa. It is through the daily life of raising their families near one another that they decided to form a solidarity group and take out loans from Friendship Bridge. This will be their first loan, and all are eager to take on the new challenge and learn how to improve their businesses with the support of start-up capital.

Of the 32 women, 12 of them are asking for a loan of 17,600 quetzales (about $2,325 USD). These twelve women are farmers; growing potatoes, corn, and milpa (the leaf that is used to wrap tamales) on small plots of land behind their homes. They also raise cattle, chickens, and pigs, producing the majority of the town’s eggs, milk, cheese, and meat. They will use their loans to purchase seed and fertilizer for their crops and feed for their animals. One woman will invest her loan in a new calf. She raises only chickens now, and is excited about the possibility of diversifying her product base, and being able to sell milk, as well as to proviD. this delicacy for her family.

While each woman is somewhat nervous about this new venture, they are confident in their strength and have overcome countless obstacles in their lives that have prepared them for taking on this new aspect of business. They are ready to support each other with their loans, just as they have supported each other each day with raising their families.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and feed for animals

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and great sacrifice, Mrs Margarita A. and her husband run a farming business in the municipality of Achuapa. The business is their core source of income that provides for the caring of their three small children, one of which needs more attention due to his young age.

At present, Mrs Margarita A.’s family does not have electric power at their home since they live in a far away locality. However, Mrs A. has acquired a solar panel that will allow her to have enough electricity to use two lamps and a television set. Upon acquiring this debt very responsibly Mrs A., is seeking the support of Ceprodel so she can obtain a loan to repay the panel. Having this source of electricity will allow the Altamiranos to improve their living conditions at home and so their children have a better environment for their school work.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo y gran sacrificio en el municipio de Achuapa la señora Margarita A. se dedica al negocio agropecuario junto con su esposo esforzándose diariamente para llevar a su mesa el sustento de sus tres pequeños hijos de los cuales uno de ellos (el menor de edad) necesita mayor cuido y atención por su corta edad.

Actualmente la señora Margarita al suplir la necesidad de no tener energía eléctrica en su casa de habitación por vivir en una localidad alejada, ha adquirido un panel solar que le permita tener acceso a dos lámparas y un televisor. Al adquirir esta deuda muy responsablemente acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita el pago de la deuda y así aprovechar el panel para realizar sus labores diarias y permitir que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones para sus estudios.

loans.use: To Pay for a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Rafael Enrique

texts.es:
Rafael M. is a young man who has a business in stockbreeding in the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León in Nicaragua. Since a young age, Rafael was known to be a hard worker in the fields, raising the cattle in order then to commercialize it. Currently, Rafael is single and his only responsibility is to support and provide for his elderly parents.

Despite of the difficult circumstances that Rafael encounters, he managed to find the way to improve the conditions of his home. Rafael acquired a solar panel because his community does not have electric power since it is so far away from the city. To finish paying the solar panel, Rafael has requested the support of Ceprodel, which he hopes will provide him with a loan that will allow him to finish paying the solar panel and therefore, continue to use it for daily home activities.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

El joven Rafael M. se dedica al negocio de la ganadería en el municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde su niñez se ha destacado por ser un gran trabajador en el campo criando el ganado para luego comercializarlo. Actualmente este joven esta soltero y solamente tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a sus padres que por ser avanzados en edad necesitan del apoyo de su hijo.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que ha atravesado este joven, ha buscado la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar debido a que en su comunidad no existe energía eléctrica por estar alejada de la ciudad. Para cancelar la deuda ha solicitado apoyo en Ceprodel para cancelar dicha deuda y así darle el uso al panel solar en las actividades diarias de su hogar.

loans.use: To Pay for a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Yarlin Yohanna

texts.es:
Yarlin Yohanna lives in the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León. She has an agricultural business planting seeds. Yarlin Yohanna is married and has three children. She and her husband share the responsibility of providing their children with the education they deserve.

One of the main problems she faces, is the fact that in the locality where she lives, there is no source of electric power, due to distance and low economic resources of the region. In order to overcome this situation, Yarlin Yohanna purchased a solar panel, and therefore, she seeks the support of CEPRODEL, which she hopes will provide her with a loan that will allow her to finish paying the solar panel , which she and her family use to get their at their humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer,

Yarlng Johanna es habitante del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León teniendo su negocio de agricultura dedicándose a la siembra de semilla en su localidad. Es madre casada y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad que junto con su esposo se esfuerzan constantemente para brindarles la educación que ellos se merecen.

Una situación problemática que ella atraviesa es que en la localidad donde ella vive no se cuenta con energía eléctrica por factores de distancia y bajos recursos económicos para establecer la energía. Al querer superar esta situación ha adquirido un panel solar y para ello muy responsablemente busca apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito que le permita cancelar la deuda del panel y así aprovechar la energía eléctrica para su iluminación en su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To pay solar panel loan

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena lives in the neighborhood “Memorial Sandino”. She is 42 years old and she lives with her husband who works as security officer and her two young children, since her two elder children are already independent. She has been working as cook for the past 3 years. The family income is small that's why they have doing improvements to their house with the help of small loans. She is requesting a loan to build the sewer drains and to begin the extension of her bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena, habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 42 años de edad, le acompaña su esposo quien trabaja como guarda de seguridad y sus dos hijos menores, en vista que sus dos hijos mayores ya son independientes. Trabaja como cocinera desde hace 3 años. Sus ingresos familiares son pocos es por eso que han ido mejorado su casa con créditos pequeños. Solicita un crédito para construir un sumidero y empezar la ampliación de su cuarto.

loans.use: Buy material to build the sewer drains.

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Mrs. Aura M. is 51-year-old single woman but committed to her 7 children that she has raised all alone. She lives in the neighborhood “El Recreo”. Her elder children work and although they earn very little, they still help her with the expenses of the house and only her youngest daughter is in her charge. Mrs. Aura has been doing laundry and Ironing clothes at the home of different families for the past 15 years, this is the way she makes her living. She is requesting a loan to extend a bedroom, and to have more privacy since all her children live with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Aura M. de 51 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Recreo, soltera, pero comprometida con sus 7 hijos que sola ha criado. Sus hijos mayores trabajan y aunque ganan muy poco le ayudan en los gastos de la casa y sólo la menor está aun a su cargo. Doña Aura Lava y Plancha ropa ajena a domicilio y en su casa desde hace 15 años, es de esta forma que se gana la vida. Solicita un crédito para ampliar un cuarto de habitación, y tener mejor privacidad ya que todos sus hijos viven con ella.

loans.use: Buy the materials to extend a bedroom.

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha is a 38-year-old young single woman. She lives in the neighborhood “380” with her 16-year-old daughter. She works as a cashier at a department store called SIMAN. This single mother was able to buy her house with her own effort. She has done improvements to the house with the help of loans, in order to set up a business of selling chicken in the future. She is requesting a loan to build a roofed porch for her house. Little by little she is trying to make her house a safer place and this way her daughter will be able to support her in the business that she has in mind to have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Es una joven mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera y habita en el Barrio 380 con su hija de 16 años de dad. Trabaja como cajera en una Tienda por departamento llamada SIMAN, con esfuerzo propio esta madre soltera compró su casa y ha venido mejorándola con apoyo de créditos, con el propósito de montar un negocio de venta de pollo en un futuro. Solicita un crédito para construir el porche de su casa y techarlo, poco a poco pretende darle a su casa mas seguridad y así su hija le apoyará en el negocio que tanto tiene en su mente para tener más ingresos.

loans.use: Buid the porch for her house.

loans.name: Anita Elizabeth

texts.es:
Anita belongs to the Community Bang 'Las Margaritas', located at 898 Pachitea St. in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and the mother of 3 children: her husband is a moto-taxi driver. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, of 300 Soles, Anita decided to invest in a clothes-selling business.

Currently, she has established this business, and gets up at 7am in order to prepare breakfast for her children and husband: she then carries out her household chores and in the afternoons she goes out to sell her merchandise.

With this loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: a dozen pairs of trousers, a dozen blouses, a dozen polo-shirts, a dozen T-shirts, underwear for men, women and children etc.

Anita is very happy, her business is expanding and already she more customers every day and this is increasing her income, much to the satisfaction of her and her family who are very proud of her and thank Manuela Ramos for the help given in starting-up the business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Anita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Pachitea No 898, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Anita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de ventas ropas.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropas, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a los que haceres domésticos y en las tardes sale a ofrecer su mercadería.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: 1 docena de pantalones, 1 docena de blusas, 1 docena de polos, 1 docena de camisas, ropas interiores de damas, caballeros y niños, etc.

Anita esta muy contenta, su negocio esta mejorando, ya que sus clientes son cada día mas y esto aumenta sus ingresos, para satisfacción de ella y de su familia que esta muy orgullosa de ella y le agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: Use loan to purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Adriana Raquel

texts.es:
Adriana is a member of the women's communal bank of Santa Barbara, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 45 years old and the mother of 2 children. With the first loan she received, Adriana decided to invest in a business selling food. Now she has a small shop and sells meals in the evenings. She opens her shop from 7am until 9pm. Her children and her children help her prepare and sell her meals in the evening.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase general grocery items for her shop, such as rice, sugar, milk, ham, oil, sodas, vegetables, as well as office and school supplies. Adriana is very happy and content. Her business is growing and her sales are increasing thanks to the support of her children and her husband, and all the efforts to bring them a better quality of life and a good education.

La señora Adriana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Jr Lima No 138, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Adriana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en el negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega y un negocio de venta de comidas en las noches, abre su bodega a las 7am., hasta las 9pm, paralelo a ello con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo se dedica a la preparación y venta de sus comidas en la noche.. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, compro abarrotes para su bodega como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, aceite, gaseosas, embutidos, pasamanería, verduras, útiles de oficina y escritorio, etc. Adriana esta muy feliz y contenta, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan gracias al apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo pues todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una mejor vida y una mejor educación.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE STOCK FOR HER SMALL SHOP SUCH AS RICE, SUGAR, MILK, HAM, SODAS, AS WELL AS OFFICE AND SCHOOL SUPPLIES.

loans.name: Bella Isabel

texts.es:
Bella is a member of the communal bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 37 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband works in a shop. With the first loan she received, Bella invested in a business selling sodas. She gets up at 7 each morning to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and then works in her business selling sodas during the rest of the day. With the new loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase 5 cases of sodas, large and small, as well as other beverages for her business.

La señora Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz A Lt 4 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Bella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de gaseosas, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus gaseosas durante todo el día. Con este préstamo de S/. 1600 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 5 cajas de gaseosas grandes y chicas, agua cielo, etc. Bella esta muy satisfecha, porque con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ha superado los problemas que se le presentaban y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE BEVERAGES FOR HER BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO INCREASE HER SALES.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta is a member of the communal bank Juan Zaplana Belliz, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 50 years old and the mother of 4 children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business selling products from the region. Antonieta gets up at 6am each day to prepare breakfast for her children. After, she goes to the port to purchase her products and sell what she can until 2pm, then she sells anything extra from her home. With the new loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase large quantities of corn, frozen fish, fruits, etc.

Antonieta is very happy and content, because thanks to this business she has been able to provide a better education for her children. She greatly appreciates the financial support she has received for her business.

La señora Antonieta pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 4 hijos. Antonieta con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos de la región. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de la región, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se va al puerto para comprar y rematar sus productos hasta las 2 pm y lo que le sobra lo vende en su casa. Con este préstamo de S/. 2300 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará : 2 toneladas de maíz, 2 cajones de pescado congelado, frutas, limón, etc. Antonieta esta muy contenta y feliz, porque gracias al negocio que mantiene puede apoyar en sus estudios superiores a sus hijos y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE LARGE QUANTITIES OF LOCAL PRODUCE AND PRODUCTS FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:

With the first loan she received, Charito began a seamstress business. Today she makes various types of clothing for women, men and children. She gets up at 6am to prepare breakfast for her husband and son, and then later she works making clothing until 11pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase cotton fabric, lycra, needles, elastic, zippers, buttons, threads and other sewing supplies for her business. Charito is very happy and content. Her business is growing more and more each day and she is growing her client base. Her family is very proud of her.

La señora Charito pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Psj Justiniano Zegarra No 131, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 1hijos, su esposo es chofer de auto. Charito con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de confección de prendas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de confección de diversos tipos de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la confección de sus ropas hasta las 11pm. La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Atahualpa No 221, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 1 hijos. La señora Delsi pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano José de San Martín Mz A Lt 9 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante y motocarrista. Delsi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, SUGAR, MILK, NOODLES, SODA, ETC  TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Madre de Dios No 547, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es jubilado. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de ventas de gaseosas y golosinas.

loans.name: Dina Laura

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz C2 Lt 16 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es motocarrista. Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de belleza y de venta de comida, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza y paralelo a eso prepara su comida que lo vende a partir del medio día hasta las 2pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará : perfumes, talcos, cremas, labiales, colonias, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, etc.

loans.name: Union Y Fuerza Group

texts.en:
The ten women who comprise the "Unión y Fuerza" (Union and Strength) group are coming together for their first loan from Friendship Bridge. They know each other well, raising their families in the same neighborhood of Chimaltenango. The ten women represent various aspects of modern and traditional Guatemala, both in their dress and their businesses.

About half of the women hold tight to their traditional upbringing, wearing the "huipiles" (traditional Mayan blouse) that they also weave to sell.

They will use their loans to invest in buying thread in bulk, something they have not been able to purchase before. Until now, every time they receive an order for a huipil, they must travel to the market and purchase only enough thread for the one blouse. This raises the cost of the thread, because they don’t receive a bulk discount, and it also is very time consuming. Now they will be able to purchase a large amount of thread that will serve them for many months.

These women also have small farms where they grow corn and beans, as well as raising pigs, cows, and chickens. With part of their loan, they will purchase seed, fertilizer, and feed for the animals.

The remaining women, dressed in jeans and button-down shirts, while remaining faithful to their Mayan upbringing, have also connected to the modern life in the nearby capital city of Guatemala. These women have small "tiendas" (shops) where they sell soft drinks, snacks, and daily necessities, such as shampoo and toilet paper. They also sell products from catalogs, mainly shoes, clothes, make-up and perfume. Their stores are a great outlet for selling from catalogs, because they already have a customer base that are coming to rely on them for other items they can order.

Their loans will be used to restock their stores. They are very excited about being able to expand their variety and have full shelves. Now, they often run out of product and have empty shelves that don’t look very inviting to passersby. They will also order popular items from the catalogs to have on hand in their stores, which will enable them to buy at a bulk rate and help to expand their on-hand inventory.

Whether dressed in jeans or woven skirts, the ten women have a common dream: to better provide for their families. They will work together over the next six months, supporting each other with loan advice and sharing ideas and best practices. While a bit nervous about taking on a new challenge, they are confident in their abilities to generate income with their new loan. They are asking for a group loan of 19,000 quetzales, about $2500 USD.

The photo is of the ten women and their 'facilitadora' (loan officer) outside the office of Friendship Bridge in Chimaltenango.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving, seeds, fertilizer, and feed for animals, and inventory for stores

loans.name: Miriam

She starts her day at 6am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which she tends to her shop selling spare parts until 8pm.

With this next loan of $1,075.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy spare parts for cars, motorbikes and delivery vans, as well as motor oil and so on.

La señora Miriam pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en la Av. Pachacutec Mz A Lt 19, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. La señora Juanny pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Juan Zaplana Belliza Mz c Lt 4, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Juanny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de mercadería.

La señora Ninfa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Pachitea No 785, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es agricultor. Ninfa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en el negocio de venta de comidas.

loans.name: Karla Anabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Karla R. is 37 years old. She lives in the Barrio Hialeah area of the city, along with her husband and her 5 year old son. Her business involves the selling of Natural products/medicine. She is a young and enterprising and has worked at this business for 3 years in order to help her husband. The name of the powder that she makes is called Neutrodor, and is made for the feet. She mixes the powder and ingredients together and sells it at markets, general stores and other businesses. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more ingredients so that she can make more product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Karla R. de 37 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Hialeah, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de medicina Natural, tienen una niña de 5 años de edad. Karla es una mujer joven y emprendedora que para ayudar a su esposo tiene 3 años de Elaborar un talco especialmente para los pies llamado Neutrodor, el cual ella misma empaca y los vende al por mayor en pulperías, ventas, y otros negocios. Ella consiguió los ingredientes y aprendió la elaboración y ese es su negocio, Este negocio le ha permitido apoyar en forma significativa a su casa y darle a su hija las necesidades necesarias por su edad. Solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima y elaborar mayor cantidad de producto.

loans.use: To purchase more high quality ingredients so that she can make more of the talc product to sell.  (Comprar materia prima para elaboración de talco)

loans.name: César Orozco

texts.es:

Since is very concerned about his children's future and the future opportunities made available to them, he has worked hard to grow and strengthen this business which he started 9 years ago. He has his own furniture shop and before starting this business, worked in other furniture shops for 25 years. He is now asking for this loan in order to buy more wood so that he can comply with the orders presented to him. His 11 year old son works with him daily (after school) and is learning the business too.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Cesar tiene 36 años de edad y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y su esposa para apoyarlo trabaja como afanadora, tiene dos hijos de edad escolar primaria, preocupado por mejorar las oportunidades a sus hijos que una buena educación puede darles, se ha esforzado en ampliar y fortalecer su negocio en el cual lleva 9 años, tiene un taller propio de elaboración de madera, antes de montar su taller trabajó 25 años para otros talleres. Pide su crédito para comprar madera y cumplir con varios encargos de muebles, su hijo de 11 años de edad ya trabaja después de su colegio con él y está aprendiendo el negocio.

With the first loan Nelly received from Manuela Ramos she invested in her own soft drink business. Today she continues to sell soft drinks and opens her store in the mornings to serve her clients.

With this loan of $725, which she plans to repay within five months, she will buy a variety of soft drinks and other items to sell including rice, sugar, milk, soap, cooking oil and pastas.

Nelly is very happy and proud that her business has been growing little by little and that her sales have increased thanks to the effort she has made. She proves to us that there’s no age limit when it comes to working and succeeding in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Jr Lima No 138, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 72 años y es madre de 12 hijos. Nelly con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad ella sigue con su mismo negocio de venta de gaseosas, abre su local por las mañanas para atender a sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará gaseosas surtidas en vidrio y descartables, abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, conservas, aceite, gaseosas, embutidos, fideos, etc. Nelly esta muy feliz y orgullosa de si misma, su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas aumentan gracias al esfuerzo que realiza para salir adelante y demostrar que no hay limites de edad para trabajar y triunfar en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods to sell

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank, located at Jr Copaiba Mz A Lt 3 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 49 years old, has six children and is married to a salesman.

With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Rosa invested in a business and now has her own general store. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and then works in the store until 9:00 p.m.

With this loan of $900, which she plans to repay within six months, she will buy items to sell including rice, eggs, milk, cooking oil and sugar.

Rosa is very happy because with a lot of effort and hard work she has helped her family overcome the challenges they faced.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz A Lt 3 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 deciD. invertirlo en una bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, luego se dedica a la atención D. su bodega hasta las 9pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, huevo, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc. Rosa esta muy satisfecha, porque con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ha superado los problemas que se le presentaban.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in general store

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41861

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank, located at Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 52 years old and the mother of five children.

With the first loan Noemí received from Manuela Ramos she invested in a river transportation business and now has a boat. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and then heads to the port where she works until 10:00 p.m.

With this loan of $1,075, which she plans to repay in six months, she will buy materials for her boat including wood, nails, rope, tarps, tar and fuel.

Noemí is very happy because of what she has overcome to be able to support her family and give them a better life and good education. Her children are proud of her and very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting their mother’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 5 hijos. Noemí con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en un negocio de transporte fluvial. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un bote, se levanta a las 5am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dirige al puerto para dirigir las labores en su pequeña embarcación hasta las 10pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: materiales para la refacción de su bote como madera, clavos, sogas, mantas, brea, combustible, etc. Noemí esta muy feliz , porque ha tenido que pasar mucho para lograr dar tranquilidad a su familia y así poder brindarles una buena vida y una buena educación, ellos están orgullosos de ella y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: Boat owner will buy materials for her boat

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank located in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is a 47-year-old mother of seven and her husband works as a driver.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Trinidad decided to invest in a grocery business and now has a general store. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and then works in the store until 8:00 p.m. With this loan of $375, which she plans to repay within six months, Trinidad will buy goods to sell including rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, soap and eggs.

Trinidad is very happy and proud that, due to hard work and sacrifice, she has been able to build a business that allows her to earn a better income. Her family is proud of her and very thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Km. 6,00 entrando por el radar, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Trinidad con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertirlo en un negocio de venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego atiende su bodega hasta las 8pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, aceite, 1 caja de jabón, 2 javas de huevo, etc. Trinidad esta muy feliz y contenta, porque en base a esfuerzo y sacrificio logro establecer su propio negocio, sus ingresos han mejorado, su familia esta orgullosa de ella y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell in a general store

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank, located at Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5 in Callería, a town located in the Ucayali province of Peru.

She is 26 years old but wasn’t earning enough money to pay for school and support her family so, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she started her own cosmetics business. Now she gets up every morning at 7:00 a.m. and works to sell her products until 6:00 p.m.

With this loan of $900, which she plans to repay within six months, she will buy items to sell including perfumes, face creams, deodorants, lipsticks, lotions and talcum powders.

Sofía is very happy because, thanks to her business, she is able to pay for her education while also helping with household expenses. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Abner Monrroy Mz A Lt 5, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 26 años, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no alcanzan para mantener los gastos de sus estudios y de su familia, es así que Sofía con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en un negocio venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad ella sigue con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, se levanta a las 7am, para preparar su desayuno, luego se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza hasta las 6pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, labiales, lociones, talcos, etc. Sofía esta muy contenta, porque gracias al negocio que mantiene puede costear los gastos que le demanda sus estudios, también puede apoyar en su casa por eso ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for cosmetics business

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41864

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara belongs to the "Las Margaritas" Communal Bank, located at Jr Rió Pisqui No. 364 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 51 years old, married to a mechanic and is the mother of eight children.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Sara invested in her own business and began selling fruit. Every day she gets up at 4:00 a.m. to go to the port to buy fruit that she then sells there until 10:00 a.m. She later takes whatever is left over to sell to her neighbors from her own fruit stand at home.

With this loan of $500, which she plans to repay in five months, she will purchase other items to sell including 10 bunches of bananas, 10 sacks of corn, chickens, pigs and fruit.

Sara is very content because she is achieving her objective of offering her children a good education and better quality of life. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Rió Pisqui No 364, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en el negocio de venta de frutas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de remates de productos para llevar, se levanta a las 4am, para ir al puerto y comprar sus productos el cual los remata allí mismo, hasta las 10 am, y lo que le sobra lleva su casa para venderlo en una pequeña mesa a sus vecinos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1400 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: 10 racimos de plátano, 10 sacos de maíz, gallinas, chanchos, frutas, etc. Sara esta muy Satisfecha, porque puede lograr grande objetivos que se planeo para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y una mejor condición de vida y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods to sell

loans.name: Brice

texts.fr:
Born in HOZIN, a village situated in the province of OUEME in the 1970's, Mr K. Brice is married and father of 3 children. He is a woodworker by profession, and has been practicing his craft for more than a decade. In his workshop, he makes primarily tables, chairs and benches to name a few. The quality of his furnishings is very appreciated by his clients. For the last while he has experienced serious difficulties in the purchase of wood and other products used to make his furniture. He is asking for a loan to be able to quickly supply himself with wood, which becomes to expensive during the rainy season.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à HOZIN un village situé dans la département de l’OUEME vers les années 1970, Monsieur K. Brice est marié et père de 3enfants. Il est menuisier de profession et exerce ce métier depuis plus d’une décennie. Dans son atelier, il fabrique notamment des tables, chaises, bancs pour ne citer que ceux là. La qualité de sa prestation est très bien apprécie par ses clients. Depuis un certain temps il éprouve de sérieuses difficultés dans les achats de bois et autres produits servant à la conception de ces objets. Il sollicite alors ce prêt pour pouvoir vite s’approvisionner car le bois devient trop cher en saison pluvieuse.

loans.use: Purchase 50 planks of wood and 30 boxes of varnish

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr:
Born around 1975 in ADJOHOUN, in the valley of OUEME, Mrs G. Claire is married and mother of 3 children. Possessing a good character, G. Claire is a leader amoung the women in the little market of SEKANDJI where she opporates her business selling condiments. She sells things such as fresh tomatoes and onions, gumbo and other food products. Currently the stock she has doesn't allow her to satisfy the demands of her clients. In an effort to respond to that demand, she is asking for her fourth loan in order to buy supplies.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1975 à ADJOHOUN dans la vallée de l’OUEME, dame G. Claire est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. De bonne moralité, G. Claire est une femme leader dans le petit marché de SEKANDJI où elle mène son activité de vente des condiments tels que de la tomate fraîche, de l’oignon, du gombo, etc et divers produits vivriers. Actuellement le stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Alors dans le but de répondre à cette, elle sollicite son quatrième prêt afin de s’approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn, 2 bags of beans, 1 bag of millet, 1 basket of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is married to 49-year old Luis Valdez, and they have two sons that attend school. Felcia used to earn a living selling lottery tickets in the streets while her husband sold newspapers. After several years of saving, they succeeded in setting up a small kiosk where in addition to their lottery tickets and newspapers, they sold the candies and fast foods.

Their desire for progress has always brought them success in their undertakings. From the kiosk they were able to expand their business and open a store thanks to previous loans granted by the Fundación Paraguaya, a business which now operates with a very good quantity and variety of inventory.

Now they are asking for a loan to supply their business with goods such as rice, pasta, oil, milk, eggs, baked goods, sodas, and sugar. In this way they wish to keep on with their progress and continue to expand their business.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felicia esta casada con el señor Luis Valdez de 49 años, tienen 2 hijos que actualmente van al colegio. Felicia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de loterías en las calles mientras que su marido vendía diarios. Luego de varios años de ahorro, ellos lograron montar un pequeño kiosco donde además de sus loterías y diarios vendían golosinas y comidas rápidas.

El deseo de ambos de progresar, los ha llevado siempre a superarse en sus proyectos, luego de su kiosco pudieron ampliar el negocio y abrir una despensa gracias a créditos anteriores que se le fueron otorgados en la Fundación Paraguaya, y que actualmente funciona con muy buena cantidad y variedad de mercaderías.

Hoy día ellos solicitan un crédito para surtir su negocio con mercaderías como: arroz, fideo, aceite, leche, huevo, panificados, gaseosa, azúcar. De este modo desean seguir progresando y ampliar cada vez mas el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, rice, pasta, oil, milk, eggs, baked goods, sodas, sugar

loans.name: Sébastienne

texts.fr:
Born in COTONOU around 1975, Mrs O. Sébastienne is married and mother of 5 children. Operating for the last few years in the market DEGAKON in AKPAKPA, she quickly established herself in a competative environment. Right now, she is in a period where business is not good for her because of a lack of capital to restock her supplies with different products. She is also a distributor of water in bags, affectionately called PURE WATER because of the hygenic conditions underwhich it is bagged. She is asking for this loan in order to relaunch her business and meet the demands of her clientele and position herself well in a business environment that is more and more competitive.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à COTONOU dans les années 1975, dame O. Sébastienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Implantée depuis quelques années dans le marché DEGAKON à AKPAKPA, elle s’est vite imposée dans son environnement concurrentiel. Actuellement, elle est dans une période où les activites ne tournent pas bien pour elle faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner en divers produits. Elle est aussi distributrice de l’eau mise en sachet affectueusement appelée PURE WATER du fait des conditions hygiéniques qui entourent la mise en sachet. Elle sollicite pour ces raisons ce crédit afin de relancer son activité, de faire face aux demandes de sa clientèle et de bien se positionner dans l’environnement de plus en plus concurrentiel dans lequel elle exerce.

loans.use: purchase of 30 cases of spaghetti, 5 cases of tomatoes and milk and a ton of cooking oil

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilán is 28 years old. He has a two-month old daughter. Over two years ago, both he and his brother Ireneo moved from the city of Caaguazú and settled in Luque where they now earn their living by selling Argentinean wines.

Every week he travels to the city of Clorinda in Argentina to buy his goods; this city is on the border with Paraguay so it is just a few hours away.

Froilán started as a client of the Fundación Paraguaya through a men’s committee of entrepreneurs (jointly obligated for the group's loans), demonstrating reliability in making his loan payments, thus allowing him to be eligible for an individual line of credit with the institution.

He is now requesting a new loan that he would like to invest in the purchase of a larger range of varieties and brand names of wine.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Froilan tiene 28 años de edad. Tiene una hija de 2 meses. Tanto él como su hermano Ireneo llegaron hace mas de 2 años de la ciudad de Caaguazú y se establecieron en Luque donde actualmente se dedican a la compra y venta de vinos Argentinos.

Semanalmente viaja a la ciudad de Clorinda (Argentina) para comprar sus mercaderías, esta ciudad limita con Paraguay por lo que queda a escasas horas de viaje.

El señor Froilán se inició como cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya através de un comité de hombres emprendedores (grupo solidario) demostrando moral en el pago de sus cuotas, permitiéndole así poder acceder a una línea de crédito individual con la institución.

El hoy solicita un nuevo crédito que desea invertirlo en la compra de mayor variedad de tipos y marcas de vinos.

loans.use: Purchase of Argentinean wines

loans.name: Abibatou

texts.fr:
Located in COTONOU for more than 10 years, Mrs M. Abibatou is originally from the North of BENIN where she was born August 18, 1975. She is married and mother of 2 children. Right now she is living in SEKANDJI, a popular neighborhood in COTONOU with her husband and 2 children. Not far from her house she has rented a shop where she has set up her different products and clothing for children and men. M. Abibatou has already received four consecutive loans which she has always paid back. The demand for certain products, such as bags of rice, corn and wheat and other articles of clothing requires her to ask for a fifth loan to be able to diversify her business and satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 10 ans, dame M. Abibatou est originaire du nord du BENIN où elle est née le 18 août 1975. Mariée, elle est mère de 2 enfants. Actuellement, elle vit à SEKANDJI, un quartier populaire de COTONOU avec son époux et ses deux enfants. Non loin de sa résidence elle a loué une boutique où elle a installé ses produits divers et également des articles vestimentaires pour enfants et pour hommes. M. Abibatou a reçu déjà quatre prêts successifs et elle s’est toujours bien comporté. La demande de certains produits tels que les sacs de riz, de maïs, de blé et autres articles vestimentaires l’oblige à solliciter son cinquième prêts dans le but de diversifier son activité et de satisfaire aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: purchase of 5 bags of rice, a ton of oil and articles of clothing

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Born around 1958 in the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs S. Jeannette is married and mother of 4 children. A seamstress by profession, she also sells fabric loinclothes as well as goods such as buttons, threads and linings. She also does a lot of baby clothes because of the demands of her clients. She is asking for a loan to respond to the increasing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1958 dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame S. Jeannette est mariée et mère de 4enfants. Couturière de profession, elle mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des tissus pagnes, des produits de mercerie tels que les boutons, les fils, les doublures, etc. Elle s’investie beaucoup dans la layette à cause de la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 40 spools of thread, 15 pieces of fabric and 5 roles of lining

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio V. is 35 years old, single, and is from the interior of the country. Evers since he was young worked helping his father on the farm planting fruits and vegetables. About eight years ago he decided to come to the city of Luque where several of his brothers were working, all of whom are very humble and hard working.

His brothers helped Gregorio to get started in Luque through the purchase of a pickup truck so that he could make a living through mobile sales of various types of goods. As such, Gregorio sells staples such as sugar, rice, flour, canned goods, housewares, and so forth. He travels to Chaco Paraguayo (northwestern Paraguay) twice a week in order to sell his goods to pre-established clientele.

He would like this loan so that he can buy merchandise in larger quantities, because last month he obtained new customers who have made large orders of merchandise. In the longer term, he has set his sights on buying a larger truck in order to expand his business and income.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Gregorio V. tiene 35 años y es soltero, es de una zona del interior del país. Desde muy pequeño trabajo ayudando a su padre en la chacra plantando hortalizas y frutas. Hace 8 años aproximadamente decidió venir a la ciudad de Luque donde se encontraban varios de sus hermanos trabajando, gente muy humilde y trabajadora.

Sus hermanos ayudaron a Gregorio a establecerse en la ciudad de Luque y en la compra de una camioneta para dedicarse a la venta ambulante de distintos tipos de mercaderías. Es así como Gregorio vende artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, arroz, harina, fideos, productos enlatados, artículos para el hogar entre otras cosas y viaja dos veces a la semana al Chaco Paraguayo para vender sus productos a clientela ya formada.

El desea el crédito para poder comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades pues este último mes ha logrado obtener nuevos clientes que hicieron pedidos grandes de mercaderías. Mas adelante tiene proyectado comprar una camioneta más grande, para ir ampliando de este modo su negocio y sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, flour, canned goods, housewares, and so forth

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha is 45 years old and married with 4 children. He sells second-hand clothes in the town of Kabala.  Before joining the Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) program, life was hard for the family. His stock was too small to generate sufficient income.  With his previous loan, his stock increased and, with the daily income, his children can now have two meals a day, and he can also meet their school expenses. Alpha would like to continue expanding his business and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000.

loans.use: To further expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Ireneo is 37 years old, married to Alejandrina Alfonso and with two small children. Their children are still attending school but they all live in harmony in their humble home.

Ireneo began to work with "Fundacion Paraguaya" as a member of a male enterpreneur's group. Thanks to the fact that he made his payments on time every month, the foundation was able to give him more personal loans.

Ireneo sells wholesale foods in order to provide kiosks and other small stores. He sells items such as: wines, candy, noodles, rice, coffee, sugar, flour, fruits, vegetables.

He's been doing this for over 4 years and tells us that it is going great. He has a nice amount of clients in different parts of the city. Ireneo requests this credit in order to purchase more goods, since prices continue to increase.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ireneo tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Alejandrina Alfonso, tienen 2 hijos menores aún, que van a la escuela, viven todos juntos en armonía en una pequeña casa.

Ireneo comenzó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya como cliente formando parte de un grupo solidario de préstamo para hombres emprendedores. Gracias a su puntualidad en sus pagos y por demostrar gran interés de superación, la Fundación ahora accedió al sistema financiero de préstamos personales.

Ireneo se dedica a la venta al por mayor de mercaderías para proveer a despensas y kioscos, mercaderías como: vinos, golosinas, fideos, arroz, café, azúcar, harina, porotos, hortalizas, entre otras cosas.

Hace ya más de cuatro años que se dedica a esto, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, posee una buena cantidad de clientes y en diferentes ciudades del país. Ireneo solicita el crédito con el que podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías a mejor precio, ya que hoy día la competencia en precios con los supermercados es bastante alta.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk items: wine, candy, noodles, rice, coffee, sugar, flour, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.en: Saliou is 40 years old and married with 4 children.  He sells second-hand clothes in the outskirts of Kabala town in Sierra Leone. The business is at a very small scale and he would like to increase his stock to generate more income for the family. Saliou wants to increase his stock of clothing for sale to try and attract new customers. He is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000.

loans.use: To increase his stock of clothing for sale to try and attract new customers

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Mrs. Maura is 53 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliacion with some of her 5 children (all of them independent adults). She supports herself, thankfully, due to profits from her general store that she's run for the past 9 years. Besides general food staples, she sells personal products, clothing, costmetics and jewelry. This provides her with enough to get by ( besides what she receives from her children). She is now requesting a loan to purchase costmetics and jewelry to supplement her store's inventory and meet the requests of her clients, which in the past she has been unable to meet.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maura tiene 53 años vive en Villa Reconciliación y actualmente vive sola con algunos de sus 5 hijos ya todos adultos e independientes. Se mantiene gracias a una Pulpería que monto hace 9 años en la que además de granos básicos y productos higiénicos vende también ropa, cosméticos y joyas, con esto se sustenta así como del apoyo que recibe de sus hijos. Solicita un crédito para comprar cosméticos y joyas, la cual tiene con escasez de inventario y sus clientes demandan productos que no ha podido adquirir, este crédito la ayudara a subir sus ventas y satisfacer las demandas y necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase products to supplement the inventory of her general store. (Comprar insumos para abastecer su pulpería)

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
The following committee was formed by some ladies who invited other ladies from another zone to join them. They shared with them their experiences and benefits.

The committee's name is La Esperanza and its currently composed of 17 women, they are in the 4th cycle of the program. They have shown lots of progress and responsibility with their payments.

These women have a varied list of activities that they do: Selling of fast foods, Selling of cakes/pastries, sell of clothes and jewelry (rings, bracelets, necklaces, etc.), canned goods, drinks, candy.

These women stand out because they are very humble, have various children, responsibilities at home yet still find time to work hard every day to supply for their family.

Each of them receives a loan of about G. 850.000 and it will be used to invest in goods such as sugar, cheese, rice, canned goods, sodas, dairy products, clothes, shoes, underwear, jewelry. They will also purchase materials that will help them prepare the foods they sell: milk, meat, flour, vegetables, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.
