El presente comité se formó mediante que las integrantes de otro comité quienes invitaron a sus amigas de otra zona a formar un comité, contándoles sus experiencias y ventajas del mismo.

El comité se llama La Esperanza y actualmente está conformado por 17 integrantes, las mismas ya se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa, y hasta hoy día han demostrado muchos progresos y responsabilidad en sus pagos.

Las integrantes poseen una diversidad de actividades las cuales son: venta de comidas rápidas de su propia elaboración, venta de tortas dulces (pasteles), venta de ropas y accesorios de bijouterie (aros, pulseras, collares, etc.), venta de lencerías, venta de bebidas, golosinas y despensas.

Ellas se caracterizan por su gran espíritu emprendedor ya que son mujeres muy humildes con familias formadas, tiene varios hijos y responsabilidades en sus hogares como madres pero aún así la necesidad de velar por el futuro de sus hijos les impulsa a seguir luchando y trabajando diariamente por ello.

Cada una recibe un crédito aproximado de G. 850.000 y que lo invertirán en la compra de sus mercaderías como azúcar, quesos, arroz, productos enlatados, gaseosas, lácteos; ropas como remeras, pantalones, camisas, zapatos, ropa interior, accesorios de bijouterie como pulseras, aros, cadenas; también ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como leche, carne, harina, verduras, entre otras cosas.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, sodas, beer, pants, lingerie, sugar, meat, fruits, vegetables, oil, breads, dough for empanadas, tomatoes, napkins, canned goods, candy, lollipops, cookies/crackers

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Jimenez is 38 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliacion, with her husband who sells goods by travelling from market to market. They have two young sons. Maria sells tortillas and fried pork out of her home, and this is how she supplements their income and helps with their sons' expenses. She is now asking for a loan, which will be used to purchase pork and cornmeal, which she will use to make tortillas (filled with fried pork and onion salad). This is a favorite meal among her clients because it is full of delicious flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria J., de 38 años de edad vive en Villa Reconciliación, con su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo perecederos en los mercados de tramo en tramo, tiene 2 hijos que son jóvenes y aun no trabajan. En su casa vende tortillas y frito de carne de cerdo, con esto apoya a los gastos de sus hijos. Solicita un crédito para comprar carne de cerdo y vender con tortilla y ensalada de cebolla, esta es una comida muy gustada por sus clientes ya que tiene un sabroso sabor, comprara también maíz para hacer sus tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase pork and cornmeal for making tortillas to sell through her business. (Comprar carne de cerdo y maiz para torillas para vender en su negocio)

loans.name: Jeannette Del Socorr

texts.es:
Jeannette is 35 years old and lives in the neighborhood named Naciones Unidas with her husband. They also live with their three daughters, the oldest of which works in a tax-free area and supports herself and helps her parents with their household expenses. 2 years ago Jeannette opened a grocery store for which she is requesting a loan to purchase the products she needs to stock her store especially with basic grains because they make up the majority of her sales.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

JEANNETTE, de 35 años de edad, vive en un barrio llamado Naciones Unidas, acompañada de su esposo, con ella también viven sus tres hijas, la mayor trabaja en una zona franca y asume sus gastos apoyando también a sus padres en los gastos de la casa. Hace 2 años monto una pulpería para la cual solicita un crédito en vista que necesita comprar productos con que abastecerla y surtirla de granos básicos en especial ya que es el producto que mas se le vende.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains such as rice and beans

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria B. was born in Santísima Trinidad on July 22, 1952. She is married to Ramon Benitez Encina and have been married for 32 years. They have two children, Gustavo and Monica, 24 and 27 years old respectively.

Maria and her husband have been selling clothes, intimate apparel and sporting goods on the streets and by special orders for more than 20 years. They got started in the city's municipal market and later got more independent. Since 1988 they became active members of "Fundacion micro creditos" which helped them increase their inventory and improve their way of life thanks to their profits.

Nowaday, they wish for another loan because they have increased their selling zones. This requires them a higher inventory, especially t-shirts and sports clothes, underwear, socks, shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria B. nació en Santísima Trinidad el 22 de julio de 1952, ella está casada con el señor Ramón Benítez Encina y llevan casados 32 años. Tienen dos hijos, Gustavo y Mónica de 24 y 27 años respectivamente.

María y su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropas, lencerías y artículos deportivos en general en forma ambulante y a base de pedido desde hace más de 20 años. Se iniciaron en el mercado municipal de la ciudad y luego se independizaron. Desde el año 1998 empezaron a ser clientes activos de la Fundación y con micro créditos que la ayudaron a aumentar su inventario de mercaderías y mejorar su nivel de vida a través de sus ganancias.

Hoy día desean adquirir un nuevo crédito ya que han incorporado nuevas zonas para sus ventas, lo que les demanda mayor cantidad de mercaderías, especialmente remeras y shorts deportivos, ropa interior para damas, medias, camisas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, intimate apparel and sports apparel.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana margarita Riíos Pérez is a member of the communal bank "Alfonso Ugarte". She lives in the region of San Martín, in the San Martín proviince, Tarapoto district. She prepares and sells pastries; her specialty are empanadas, which she distributes by the dozen and hundreds to the main markets of the city. She is an employee of the Department of Health. She has always been a hard worker, despite all the adversities, she has always known how to succeed. With the loan of 2,000.00 Soles ($725 USD) which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare her pastries such as: sacks of sugar, prepared flour in packages of 10 kilos, crates of eggs, packages of butter, bags of salt, gourds for the distribution, napkins, jam for stuffing and other necessary products for the preparation of sweet and salty goods. She will also purchase a rack to store all these products to keep them better conserved. She lives with her mother, is 63 years old and is a woman with much vision for the future. She plans to create a modern space with everything necessary to sell her goods

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana margarita Ríos Pérez es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia de San Martín , distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la preparación y venta de refrigeR., su especialidad son las empanadas, que diariamente los distribuye en docenas y cientos a las principales bodegas de la ciudad Es empleada cesante del ministerio de salud, y siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora, pese a las adversidades siempre ha sabido salir adelante. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los refrigeR. como: azúcar en sacos, harina preparada en paquetes de 10 kilos cada uno, huevos en jabas, mantequilla en paquetes, sal en bolsas, tapares para la distribución, servilletas, manjar para los rellenos y otros productos necesaR. para la preparación variada de refrigeR. salados y dulces. Así mismo comprara un estante para almacenar todos estos productos y estén mejor conservados. Ella vive con su mamá, tiene 63 años y es una mujer con mucha visión de futuro, piensa implementar un ambiente moderno con todo lo necesario para la venta de sus refrigeR..

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare her pastries

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Doylith

texts.es:
Mrs. Doylith F. P. is a member of the communal bank "Alfonso Ugarte". She lives in the region of San Martín, Tarapoto district. Her district is located out of her own house, located on Jirón Las Margaritas #349, in the neighborhood of Humano La Florida. At her business, she sells general foods such as candy and other edibles of daily consumption. She started selling bananas at a market stand at the city of Tarapoto. This meant she had to leave her younger children without the attention they needed; this is why she decided to modify her home into a space where she could set up her general food store. In addition, she had the good vision to notice that there were no businesses like her own in the area. She will purchase packages of pasta of different varieties, boxes of preserved fish, rice and sugar sacks, liters of oil, soda, candy, and personal and home cleaning products with the loan of 2,000.00 Soles ($725 USD) She is married and has 2 small children. It is her husband who is always supportive of her business and together they dream of having a bigger business and ensuring the well being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Doylith F. P. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín ,distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Las Margaritas Nº 349,del Asentamiento Humano La Florida, en el vende abarrotes en general como: golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Se inicio vendiendo plátanos, en un puesto del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Tarapoto, lo que significaba dejar a sus menores hijos sin la atención debida por lo que decide acondicionar en su casa un ambiente donde implemento su bodega, además con buena visión vio que en la zona no había un negocio como el suyo El préstamo de S/. 2000.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas ,golosinas , productos de aseo para el hogar y personal. Ella es casada y tiene 2 pequeños hijos y es su esposo quien la apoya siempre en el negocio, juntos sueñan con tener un negocio mas grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her business

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41883

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Jesús G. C. is a member of the communal bank "Alfons Ugarte". She lives in the San Martín region, in the San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her Technical Occupation Education Center is located in her own home which is especially designed for that purpose. It is located on Jr. Alfonso Ugarte # 241 in the city of Tarapoto, where she offers the degree of cosmetology. She started 10 years ago, motivated by a friend who saw she had the qualities necessary to direct a company of that type. She learned to manage a business through direct contacts who also ran similar businesses. Today, she is ensured the number of students who specialize in this degree each semester. She plans to expand adding a new classroom and replacing the cement floor with tile with a loan of 3,000.00 ($1075 USD) Soles which she will pay in 6 installments. This way, she will give her students a more comfortable and agreeable environment. She is married and lives with her son and daughter in law, who both support us. She is a hard working woman, a fighter who is persistent and who's vision is to expand a second floor of her house and build rooms to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús G. C. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín , provincia de San Martín ,distrito de Tarapoto, su Centro Educativo Ocupacional Técnico, está ubicado en su propia casa en ambientes especialmente acondicionados, esta se ubica en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 241 de la Ciudad de Tarapoto, en la que ofrece la carrera de Cosmetología. Se inicio hace 10 años motivada por un amigo que vio en ellas las cualidades para dirigir una institución de este tipo, aprendió a administrar esta empresa en su relación directa con otras personas que también desarrollaban la misma actividad, hoy en día tiene asegurada la cantidad de alumnas que cada ciclo se especializan en la carrera de cosmetología. El préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual pagara en 6 cuotas, tiene proyectado ampliar otro ambiente, cambiar el piso de cemento por mayólicas y pintar todo el local y así dar a las alumnas un ambiente mas agradable y cómodo. Ella es casada y vive con su hijo y su nuera de quienes recibe su apoyo, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora, perseverante y visionaria anhela ampliar la segunda planta de su casa y construir habitaciones para alquilar.

loans.use: With the loan, she plans to change the floor of her business and other things

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41884

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa has been married for 5 years to Nelso Caceres and have one child whose name is Rodrigo David (he's 1-year old).

Teresa has been decorating birthday parties for 8 years. At this time she was an employee at a big decorating store in the area. Nelson was a photographer in charge of big events such as weddings, baptisms, etc. For 5 years they both have dedicated their time to rent a room and Nelson's own business is right across the street.

Due to Teresa's high demand at her job (and the fact that she makes her own decorations), Nelson has stopped his own photography job in order to help his wife with parties and decorations.

In the near future they wish to expand their business and sell all sorts of goods such as candy and a bigger variety of decorations. She wishes to get this credit in order to purchase sculpting materials, glue, paints, color paper, etc.

b>Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa está casada hace 5 años con Nelson Cáceres y tienen un hijo de nombre Rodrigo David que tiene 1 año 4 meses.

Teresa desde hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la decoración de cumpleaños infantiles. En ese entonces era empleada una de las grandes casas de decoración de la zona, y Nelson se dedicaba a la fotografía de acontecimientos como cumpleaños, casamientos, bautismos, etc. Hace 5 años decidieron independizarse y alquilar un salón donde Teresa y Nelson están al frente de su propio negocio.

Debido a la gran demanda del trabajo de Teresa y que además ella fabrica sus propios arreglos decorativos, Nelson ha dejado de trabar como fotógrafo para ayudar a su esposa con la atención del negocio y las decoraciones en las fiestas.

En un futuro muy próximo quiere ampliar mas su local y vender todo tipo de insumos para fiestas como golosinas y mas variedad de arreglos, por el momento ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar materiales para elaborar sus arreglos como: isopor, pinturas, papeles de colores, pegamento, globos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as: sculpting materials, glue, paints, color paper, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Mercedes R. S. is a member of the communal bank "Alfonso Ugarte". She lives in the region of San Martín, in the San Martín province, Banda de Shilcayo district. Her decorative plant nursery is located at the Jr. Ricardo Palma of the same district, thereby contributing to the betterment of the environment and beauty of the city and homes of the region with her business. She started on her own with a business selling fruits out of her home with the purpose of getting her family ahead. Then, together with her husband who helps her with the care and maintenence of the plants, they decided to change their means of income. They are doing very well due to the large quantity of orders that they receive. With a loan of 1,000.00 Soles ($375 USD) which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase kilos of seeds, seedlings of new plants, plastic bags for the nursery, and organic material to offer quality plants in addition to a lawn mower. Mrs. Mercedes is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two youngest children, who are the motor that keeps her going in life. Her dream is to keep the same business, and improve the nursery so she can offer plants of various species to her reputable clients.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mercedes R. S., es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, vive en la región de San Martín provincia de San Martín, distrito de Banda de Shilcayo, su vivero de plantas ornamentales esta ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma del mismo distrito, contribuyendo con este productivo negocio al mejoramiento del medio ambiente y al ornato de la ciudad y los hogares de la región. Ella se inició sola en el negocio de la venta de frutas en su mismo domicilio con la finalidad de sacar adelante a su familia, luego junto a su esposo quien la apoya en el cuidado y mantenimiento de las plantas, decidieron cambiar de actividad económica, les va muy bien por la gran cantidad de pedidos que tienen. Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 el cual devolverá en 6 meses, comprará semillas en kilos, plantones de nuevas plantas, bolsas de plástico para los almácigos, y materia orgánica para ofrecer plantas de calidad como también una maquina cortadora. La señora Mercedes tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores, quienes son el motor de su vida para seguir adelante. Su sueño es mantenerse en el mismo negocio para implementar mejor su vivero y ofrecer plantas de las variadas especies a su respetable cliente.

loans.use: Purchase new plants

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalinda V. I. is a member of the communal bank "Alfonso Ugarte". She lives at the San Martín apartments, in the San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her business is based out of her home, which is located on Alegría Arias de Morey, # 351. For ten years now, she has been selling different brands of perfume and cosmetics such as Esika, Avon, Unique in addition to clothing, wallets and shoes. She sells her products by catalog and special order; her main clients are workers of public and private institutions. With a loan of 1,000.00 Soles ($355 USD), which she will pay in 6 months, she will buy various items such as perfumes, lotions, shampoos, soaps, makeup, deodorant and other products like women's, men's and children's clothing, and accessories like wallets, and shoes of various models and colors that she brings from Lima. She is single and lives with 2 nieces. She is 54 years old and is very articulate; she makes friendships quickly which allows her to win over large quantities of clients. Her dream is to own a mini- mart.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Rosalinda V. I. ,es socia del banco comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto , su negocio se ubica en su propia casa Alegría Arias de Morey N° 351, se dedica hace 10 años a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, y prendas de vestir, carteras y zapatos, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo,siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas. Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos mas, así como ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, accesorios como: cartera, zapatos en variedad de modelos y colores, que los trae desde la ciudad de Lima. Es soltera y vive con 2 sobrinas, tiene 54 años, es muy comunicativa hace rápidamente amistades lo que le permite ganarse gran cantidad de clientes, sueño con tener un minimarket.

loans.use: Purchase items to sell

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.es:
Tranquilina Colman was born in the city of Luque and is 65 years old, she is mother to two grown women. Their names are Carmen and Mercedes, 40 and 39 years old respectively.

Tranquilina owns a pub in a big laboratory located in the city of Asunción. In the pub she serves breakfast, lunch, and snack to the employees who work there. She's been working there for 10 years and she is very well liked by people who work there.

Three years ago Tranquilina became a widower, pain and sorrow made it difficult for her to get back on track. Her daughters were a big support and she has finally gotten a hold of things in her life.

She cooks for the company but also is taking special orders which her daughter delivers. Tranquilina wishes for some credit in order to offer a wider variety of goods: milk, yogurt, sweets, sodas, fresh fruit, pastries. This way she will be able to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tranquilina Colman nació en la ciudad de Luque y tiene 65 años, ella es madre de dos hijas ambas ya mayores, sus nombres son Carmen y Mercedes de 40 y 39 años respectivamente.

Tranquilina posee una cantina en un laboratorio grande que queda en la ciudad de Asunción. En la cantina da desayuno, almuerzo y merienda a los empleados de la empresa. Hace diez años que trabaja en el lugar y se ha hecho muy querida por todas las personas que trabajan en ese lugar.

Hace tres años, Tranquilina enviudó, lo que hizo que una inmensa tristeza la invada y le tomo un tiempo recuperarse, sus hijas fueron su gran apoyo y hoy día ha vuelto a retomar su vida.

Hoy día además de cocinar para esa empresa también toma pedidos particulares de otros empleados de la zona, su hija Carmen trabaja con ella y realiza los repartos de los pedidos que recibe. Hoy día Tranquilina mucho mejor y desea adquirir el crédito para poder surtir mejor su cantina con cosas como: leche, yogurt, golosinas, gaseosas de varios sabores, frutas frescas, pastelitos, etc. De este modo ella podrá satisfacer la demanda de los empleados de la empresa que le solicitan que venda estos productos también.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, yogurt,sweets, sodas, fresh fruit, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario is 52 years old and lives in the Reconciliacion Villa. He's married and has 3 children. His wife, who has always been a great help to him, works in a cafeteria, and he works doing public transportation since from 8 years ago. Currently he is owner of a refrigeration plant, and through his many responsibilities, they have gotten ahead. With hard work and good financial habits, they have made improvements to their humble home. Now he is requesting a loan in order to further improve his house. This is how this gentleman has improved his quality of life and has made his small home better for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mario de 52 años de edad vive en Villa Reconciliación casado y con 3 hijos, su esposa que siempre ha significado un valioso apoyo para él, trabaja en un cafetín y él de transportista desde hace 8 años, es dueño de un taller de refrigeración y es en sus múltiples actividades que han logrado salir adelante, con esfuerzo y buen comportamiento de crédito han mejorado su humilde vivienda. Solicita un crédito para realizar una mejora en su casa. Así este señor ha ido mejorando calidad de vida y haciendo de su pequeña vivienda un hogar agradable para su familia.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve his home. (Comprar materiales de construcción para su vivienda)

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is 43 years old and married with 4 children. With his previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Suleman and his wife started selling roasted goat meat in the market of Kabala in Sierra Leone. The roasted meat is in high demand. Due to lack of sufficient capital, Suleman buys meat in small quantities and goat meat is scarce in the market. He is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 to purchase 6 goats at a time to meet his customers demand and to generate more income.

Suleman has a great opportunity to incease his business and meet the needs of his customers. He needs additional capital to purchase enough goats to supply his hungry patrons.

loans.use: To purchase 6 goats

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Isidoro is 56 and has lived in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood with his wife and two children for many years. His wife started a business out of their home selling Fritanga, which is a kind of fried food, such as meat, plantains, etc. Ten years ago, using his own money, he bought a car to use as a taxi, and together, these two businesses have allowed the couple to provide for the family. They have been able to improve their family's lives and provide a pleasant home. The loan Isidoro is requesting will be used to close off the sides of their house and guarantee his family's safety. There is crime in their neighborhood, and as the head of the family, he is worried about making sure that thieves can't get into the house to rob or injure his family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Isidoro, hombre mayor de 56 años de edad, gran parte de su vida ha vivido en el barrio Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, su esposa en la vivienda montó una venta de Fritanga, que es comida frita (carne, plátano, etc.). Con Capital Propio compró hace 10 años un vehículo el cual trabaja como Taxi, con el trabajo de ambos han sacado adelante a su familia y mejorado su vivienda haciendo de ella un hogar agradable. El crédito que solicita es para cerrar la vivienda a los lados y garantizar la seguridad de su familia, en los alrededores hay delincuencia y como preocupado jefe de familia pretende garantizar que no entren ladrones en su casa a robar o dañar a su familia.

loans.use: Construct side walls for his home

loans.name: Marcos Roberto

texts.es:
Marcos is 42 and lives in Ciudadela, Nicaragua with his wife and one-year-old son. His wife provides additional income by selling cosmetics and perfume. When Marcos stopped working he used his severance pay to buy a used car that he now uses to run a taxi service. He has been working as a taxi driver for the last nine years. His home's galvanized steel roof is damaged and he is requesting a loan to be able to replace it. The rainy season is coming soon and he is very worried that the roof will leak and cause damages in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Don Marcos, de 42 años de edad habita en la Ciudadela Nicaragua, junto a su esposa y su hijo de 1 año, su esposa lo apoya en los gastos vendiendo cosméticos y perfumes. Este señor cuando dejó de trabajar compró con su liquidación un carro usado el cual trabaja en distintos horarios como servicio de Taxi desde hace 9 años. Su vivienda tiene dañado el zinc y solicita un crédito para poder cambiar el Zinc de su casa, pronto vendrá la época de lluvia y la preocupa el agua pase dentro de su casa y dañe sus pertenencias.

loans.use: Replace the roof of his home

loans.name: Amelia Clara

texts.es:
Mrs. Amelia Clara Anhuamán B. is 43 years old. She studied up until her third year of high school. She has five children, of which four are still dependents. She lives on the Deam Saavedra street in the El cortijo sector in the Trujillo province, La Libertad apartment, Perú. Mrs. Amelia has a small farm in which she grows vegetables such as radish, cucumber, onion, cilantro, and broccoli and then distributes around the different markets of the city of Trujillo. She has tended to her small farm since she lived with her parents, and that is why she knows how to be successful in the business. She is a founding member of the Comunal Bank "Nuevo Perú", through which she obtained her first loan of 300.00 Soles ($106 USD). She used this money on everything necessary to achieve a good harvest. She will purchase six sacks of urea, fertilizer, manure, and insecticides with a loan of 1,700.00 Soles ($625 USD) which she will repay in six months. Her main dream is to open a restaurant at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amelia Clara Anhuamàn B. tiene 43 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero cuatro aun dependen de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Amelia tiene una gran chacra en la que siembra verduras tales como: rábano, pepinillo, cebolla, cilantro y brócoli, el cual lo distribuye por los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Trujillo. Desde que vivía con sus padres se ha dedicado a la chacra y es por eso que sabe llevar con éxito el negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió en todo lo necesario para lograr una buena cosecha. Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 el cual pagará en seis meses comprara seis sacos de urea, fertilizante, abono e insecticidas. Su mayor sueño es abrir un restaurante en su casa.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase manure and other products for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mamadie

texts.en:
Mamadie is 21 years old and a high school dropout. He was an apprentice in one of the mechanical workshops in Kabala town. After learning the trade, he started repairing bicycles in his parent’s homestead. With his income, he could purchase few spare parts when requested by his customers.

Mamadie then took out a loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT). He opened a small stall to sell spare parts in the open market and, at the same time, repairs bicycles. With the profit, he expanded the business and rented a shop. Mamadie would like to increase his stock of the parts and expand his workshop to create jobs for others. He is requesting a loan of Le.2, 000,000.

Mamadie would like to incrase his stock of spare bicycle parts to expand his business so that customers could come to him for a variety of services.

loans.use: To increase his stock of spare bicycle parts

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.es:
Ursulina A. was born in the city of Aregua in 1951, she has beautiful memories of her childhood and the city because it was the most beautiful city at that time. She tells us about the time when she had to come to the city to live with her husband and three kids: Norma who's 35 years old, Juan is 33 and Alfredo is 29.

Nowadays, after raising her three kids with lots of effort and beautiful memories. Ursulina owns a small mart which is her main source of income. Although her children don't want her to work, she refuses because she doesn't want to feel inept.

In her shop, she sells all sorts of products such as: dairy products, meats, breads, vegetables (onions, tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, oils, fruits).

Ursulina is a longtime member of Fundacion, she used to belong to a women's entrepreneur group. Thanks to her punctuality and responsibility on the bills she was able to receive more credits.

Nowadays she wishes to get more goods and this way get a better deal and increase her supply. Her clients' demands get higher and higher every day.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer./b>

Ursulina A. nació en la ciudad de Aregua en el año 1951, ella tiene bellos recuerdos de su infancia y de su ciudad pues era la ciudad más bella y floreciente de esa época. Cuenta que cuando se caso tubo que venir a la ciudad de Luque a vivir con su esposo, con quien tuvo tres hijos: Norma de 35, Juan de 33 y Alfredo de 29.

Hoy día, y luego de haber criado a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ella los ve realizados y con sus respectivas familias; Ursulina posee una pequeña despensa que es su fuente de ingreso, y aunque sus hijos no quieren que ella trabaje pues prefieren ellos darle sustento, Ursulina se niega a dejar de trabajar pues dice que se sentiría inútil.

En su despensa, ella comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como: carnes, lácteos, panificados, verduras como: cebollas, tomates, morrones así como también frutas de estación; entre otras cosas.

Ursulina es antigua cliente de la Fundación, ya que anteriormente formo parte de un grupo solidario de mujeres emprendedoras y gracias a su puntualidad y responsabilidad en los pagos logro obtener créditos personales.

Hoy día ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías para así obtener buenos descuentos y surtir su despensa ya que la demanda de los clientes es cada vez mas exigente.

loans.use: Purchase of foods such as: meats, dairy products, breads, vegetables (onions, tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, oils, fruits)

loans.name: Noemi Carolina

texts.es:
Señora Noemia Carolina Castle of H. is 44 years old and has completed secondary school. She has two children in all, but only one depends on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

The business to which she is dedicated is the sale of milk products such as: milk, cheese, butter and eggs in the districts of Huanchaco and Villa del Mar in the province of Trujillo. Her business was started by her mother who for many years sold the same products. That is why the lady Noemia has dedicated clients that already know the quality of the products that she sells. In addition she is dedicated to the breeding of chickens that she sells after they are grown and fattened.

She is a member of the New Peru Communal Bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought products to fill some orders that she had.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 30 small chickens, 10 kilograms of cheese, 7 tanks of milk, 10 packages of butter and balanced food for the birds.

Her greatest dream is to be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noemia Carolina C. D. H. tiene 44 años D. edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos en total pero solo uno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. lácteos tales como: leche, quesos, mantequilla y huevos por los distritos D. Huanchaco y Villa del Mar en la provincia D. Trujillo. Su negocio se inicia por su mamá ya que hace años vendía los mismos productos, es por eso que la señora Noemia tiene clientes seguros que ya saben la calidad D. producto que venD.. Aparte D. eso se dedica a la crianza D. pollos que después D. haber crecido y engordado son vendidos.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro productos para atender algunos pedidos que le hicieron.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 el cual será cancelado en seis meses comprará 30 pollos pequeños, 10 kilogramos D. queso, 7 cantinas D. leche, 10 mantequillas y alimento balanceado para las aves.

Su mayor sueno es poder ver crecer su negocio

loans.use: To buy cheese, milk, and butter in quantity for resale, chickens to raise and sell and balanced food for the birds.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim sells purified water in the town of Makeni.  With his previous loan, he increased his stock.  Lack of a clean drinking water supply is a big problem in the town and Ibrahim is trying to provide the service to those who can’t afford to buy.  Due to lack of sufficient capital, Ibrahim could not meet the demand of his customers especially during the dry season.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 to increase the stock and sell wholesale.

loans.use: To increase his production of purified drinking water so that he can sell it wholesale.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Señora Eugenia Fortune M. is 58 years old and has had no formal schooling, so she does not know how to read or write. She has six children but none who depend on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

She is dedicated to the purchase of beef, rams and pigs in the La Hermelinda market where they are sold directly and she knows people that sell to her with a guarantee. She sells all the meat in the zonal market of El Cortijo where she is already very well known by her neighbors and friends for the quality of meat that she sells. In addition she works with her daughter who has another business at night selling food. Her business was started first with a store in her house but people stole from her and she had to close. Subsequently she had the idea to sell food in the wholesale market on foot, but she had to leave that business because it was very laborious to be carrying the food. At present she does very well with the sale of meat.

Señora Eugenia is an associate founder of the “New Peru” Communal Bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles which she used to buy all the necessary ingredients to cook.

With the loan of 1500 soles, that will be repaid in six months, she will buy a half of a ram, a leg of beef and tripe.

Señora Eugenia has worked since the age of seven years and feels very pleased with the achievements that she has obtained.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eugenia V. M. tiene 58 años de edad, no tiene ningún año de estudios por lo tanto no sabe leer ni escribir. Tiene seis hijos pero ninguno dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra de carne de res, carnero y chancho en el mercado La Hermelinda pues allí traen directo del camal, además conoce personas que le venden con garantía. Toda la carne los ofrece en el mercado zonal de El Cortijo donde ya es muy conocida por sus vecinos y amigos, por la calidad de carne que vende. Aparte con su hija tiene otro puesto que funciona por las noches con la venta de comida. Su negocio se inicio primero con una tienda en su casa pero le robaron y tuvo que cerrar, posteriormente tuvo la idea de vender comida en el mercado mayorista en condición de ambulante, tuvo que dejar ese negocio porque era muy trabajoso estar trasladando la comida. Actualmente le va muy bien con la venta de carnes.

La señora Eugenia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar.

Con el préstamo de S/.1500.00 que los cancelara en seis meses comprará la mitad de un carnero, una pierna de res y mondonguito.

La señora Eugenia trabaja desde la edad de siete años y se siente muy contenta con los logros que ha conseguido.

loans.use: To buy half of a ram, a leg of beef, and tripe for her meat sale business.

loans.name: Rosa Gloria

texts.es:
Señora Rosa Gloria Rodríguez C. is 43 years of age and has completed higher education in the technical career of nursing. She has two children in all who both depend on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

She has a small position in the zonal market of El Cortijo in which she sells slaughtered and feathered birds such as: chickens, ducks, hens, roosters, turkeys and other miscellaneous types. Her business was started when she bought her small position and began selling a small quantity of birds. Subsequently she has increased the quantity of animals. Aside from this, she has another business renting cars. She has five taxis which she rents daily. In that way she has another income for her home.

She is an associate founder of the “New Peru” Communal Bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles which she used to buy several birds.

With the loan of 1500 soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy 7 hens, 25 chickens, 5 kg of gizzards and 7 large ducks.

Her greater dream is to buy five cars in addition to the ones that she already has to build a taxi service business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Gloria Rodríguez C. tiene 43 años de edad, tiene estudios superiores en la carrera técnica de enfermería. Tiene dos hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado zonal de El Cortijo en el que vende aves muertas y peladas tales como: pollos, patos, gallinas, gallos, pavos y menudencia. Su negocio se inicia cuando compro su pequeño puesto, empezó vendiendo muy poco posteriormente ha ido incrementando la cantidad de animales. Aparte de eso tiene otro negocio que es el alquiler de carros, tiene cinco taxis los cuales alquila diariamente, de esa manera tiene otro ingreso en su hogar.

Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compro diversas aves.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que los cancelara en seis meses comprará 7 gallinas, 25 pollos, 5 kg de molleja y 7 patos grandes.

Su mayor sueño es comprar cinco carros mas de los que ya tiene para constituir una empresa de servicio de taxi.

loans.use: To buy hens, chickens, ducks and other animals for sale.

loans.name: Chaquijya Central Group

texts.en:
Thirteen women make up the "Chaquijya Central" communal bank, a confident group who know each other well, and are ready to take out their second loan from Friendship Bridge. Gathered in the office in Sololá, they share about their businesses and dreams for the future.

Ten of the women are skilled in beading; crafting beautiful bracelets, necklaces, and earrings from tiny translucent beads, and selling them in the streets of nearby tourist towns, as well as through orders that friends and neighbors place. They will invest their loans in beads and string, which they purchase from a market in Sololá. Olga Tunay says that for the first time, with the help of their previous loan, they were able to buy beads in bulk, which drastically reduced the cost, as well as the number of trips they must make to the market.

Two women are skilled weavers, producing "huipiles" (the traditional Mayan blouse) and skirts like the ones in the picture. They will invest their loan in thread to weave these intricate clothes. A single huipil can take up to three months to make, and after an initial investment of $30-$50, it can be sold for up to $200. These huipiles represent a woman's home town, her marital status, and other interests and beliefs.

Three women have second businesses, in addition to their crafts. Marcela Y. also raises chickens to add to her beading income. Elena C. grows vegetables, such as corn, potatoes, and milpa (the leaves that are used to wrap tamales). And Olga Tunay has a panadería (a bakery), where she bakes fresh bread daily that is sold to local stores. She is well known in her community and regular customers stop by all day to purchase bread.

The women are very pleased with the direction in which their businesses are headed, and are now dreaming of the future. Their main goal is "seguir adelante," to keep moving forward, in order to proviD. better for their families and offer their children the educations they weren’t able to have. To achieve this, they hope someday to open stores where they can sell their jewelry and clothing. Olga would like to open another bakery, Marcela would like to raise animals besides chickens, and others would like to begin additional businesses, like raising animals or selling tortillas. They are learning to save money for the future that will help them with these goals.

The women of Chaquijya Central express their happiness in being a part of Friendship Bridge. They have seen other banks, and are grateful for the low interest rate and education they receive here. In addition to being a source capital, they have also found friendship and community. They are asking for a group loan of 30,500 quetzales (about $4,025 USD) that they will pay back over 9 months.

loans.use: To purchase beads and thread, as well as invest in a bakery, chickens, and vegetable cultivation

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla Z. is 34 and lives in the 31 de Diciembre neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is considerably older than she is. He is 75 and retired, but is very healthy and full of life. They have two children. The money from her husband's pension pays for some of the minor household costs, however their main source of income is their butcher's shop, where they've both worked for the last three years. Despite their difference in age, they have been married for several years, and Carla's husband has even supported her older children from a previous marriage. He has taught her how to run the business, which he will leave to her and the children. Carla is seeking a loan to purchase meat to satisfy increased demand at her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Carla Z., tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el Barrio 31 de Diciembre y es casada con un hombre bastante mayor que ella, el cual tiene 75 años saludables y aun llenos de vida y está jubilado, tienen 2 hijos, con esa jubilación se pagan algunos pequeños gastos de la casa ya que la principal actividad que ellos desarrollan es una Carnicería y en la cual trabajan ambos desde hace 3 años. A pesar de la diferencia de edad, tienen varios años casados y este señor la ha apoyado inclusive con sus hijos mayores que son de otro matrimonio, le ha enseñado el manejo del negocio que es la herencia que le dejará a ella y sus hijos. Ella solicita un crédito para comprar en mataderos carnes y vender ya que su demanda ha aumentado.

loans.use: Purchase of red meat for her business

loans.name: Gladys Soledad

texts.es:
Señora Gladys Soledad H. L. is 40 years of age and has completed her studies to the second year of secondary school. She has three children but only one depends on her for support. She lives in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

Through a friend she came to join the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles, which she invested in buying a bag of potatoes, flour and oil. By that time she had started her business with the sale of stuffed potatoes, cachangas (large mashed potato croquettes filled with a spicy ground beef and pepper filling) and breakfasts.

At present she sells in the El Cortijo zonal market. She offers breakfasts and lunches. Señora Gladys enjoys her work because she has liked to cook since she was very small.

With the loan of 500 soles, that will be repaid in four months, she will buy a bag of rice, sugar, a box of oil and other ingredients that she needs for the different dishes that she prepares.

Her greater dream is to finish building her house and add to it a large restaurant or a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys Soledad H. L. tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Por medio de una amiga se pudo integrar al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero que lo invirtió comprando un saco de papa, harina y aceite. Por ese tiempo había iniciado su negocio con la venta de papa rellena, cachanga y desayunos.

Actualmente vende en el mercado zonal El Cortijo; ofrece desayunos y almuerzos. La señora Gladys gusta mucho de su trabajo ya que desde muy pequeña le gustó cocinar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar, una caja de aceite y otros ingredientes que hacen falta para los diferentes potajes que prepara.

Su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa para allí ambientar un gran restaurante o una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and other ingredients that she needs for the different dishes that she prepares.

loans.name: Antonio De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonio is 34 and lives in Laureles Norte along with his wife and two children. He has a metal shop and his wife works selling food. He and his wife have invested in both businesses, and this has allowed them to provide food and education for their children. They are a young couple but are hard-working and responsible. Antonio is seeking a loan to purchase materials for his shop. He currently has a good clientele, achieved thanks to the high quality of his workmanship.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio, un hombre joven de 34 años de edad vive en Laureles Norte junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Tiene un taller de soldadura y su esposa le apoya con una venta de comida, junto a su esposa han invertido en el negocio de ambos y a sus hijos le han garantizado su alimento y educación, son una pareja joven pero responsable y trabajadora. Solicita crédito para comprar materiales de soldadura, su taller cuenta con una buena clientela que ha conseguido con la calidad de su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for his welding shop

loans.name: Tania Maribel

texts.es:
Señora Tania Maribel M. A. is 26 years old and has completed her studies to the fifth year of secondary school. She has a son that depends on her for support. She lives on Deam Saavedra street in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

She is dedicated to the breeding of small animals such as: chickens, hens and ducks that she sells to her neighbors and friends after they have reached their ideal size. She also sells Avon beauty products. Her business was started with the sale of prepared meals. At present she also sells prepared meals but she only prepares a specific quantity that are ordered in advance.

She belongs to the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought the ingredients to cook.

With the loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy balanced food for her birds and beauty products that she would like to have in stock.

Her greater dream is to have a farm where she can increase the number of small animals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tania Maribel M. A. tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene un hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como: pollos, gallinas y patos que después de haber adquirido su tamaño ideal los vende a sus vecinos y amigos. Así también vende productos de belleza de la línea de productos “avon”. Su negocio se inicia con la venta de menú. Actualmente también vende menú pero solo prepara una cantidad determinada que le hacen pedido anticipadamente.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro los ingredientes para cocinar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará alimento balanceado para sus aves y productos de belleza que estén en oferta para tener en stock.

Su mayor sueño es tener una granja en la que pueda incrementar el número de animales menores.

loans.use: To buy balanced food for her birds and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Victoria A. B. is 44 years of age and has completed her studies to the fifth degree of grade school. She has three children in all but none depend on her for support. She lives on Deam Saavedra street in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

With the aid of a simple machine señora Victoria makes backpacks, briefcases and suitcases; products that she distributes in the different stores of the Sierra Libertaña and the north of Peru. Many of these establishments order from her in advance by the dozens and half dozen. At the age of 21 years she learned dressmaking. With her creativity, she designed backpacks of various models.

She belongs to the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought material to make the backpacks.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 20 meters of wet fabric, petron and four rolls of ‘vivo’ (material to make backpacks).

Her greater dream is to have a workshop with modern machinery.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria A. B. tiene 44 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene en total tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Con la ayuda de una sencilla maquina la señora Victoria elabora mochilas, maletines y maletas, productos que distribuye por las diferentes tiendas de la sierra liberteña y por el norte del Perú, muchos de estos establecimientos le hacen pedidos anticipadamente, vende por docenas y media docena. Desde la edad de 21 años aprendió el curso de corte y confección, con su creatividad, diseñó mochilas de varios modelos.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro material para elaborar las mochilas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprar 20 metros de tela mojada, petron y cuatro rollos de vivo (material para elaborar mochilas).

Su mayor sueño es tener su taller con maquinaria moderna.

loans.use: To buy materials for making backpacks.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Vilma Lucia

texts.es:
VILMA R. is 48, lives in Villa Reconciliación and is married. Her husband works in a farming co-op, and is the co-op's President in Matiguas, in the Matagalpa department of Nicaragua, an area with high agricultural production. They couple has a 19-year-old son. In order to contribute to her family's income, almost two years ago Vilma began selling perfume and cosmetics, starting the business with her husband's help. She is now seeking a loan to buy clothing and perfume in bulk for her business. The income resulting from her business has brought greater stability to their home, helping them to offset the high cost of food.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

VILMA R., de 48 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación , es casada y su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa Agrícola de la cual es Presidente en Matiguas, departamento de Matagalpa, que es una zona muy productiva. Tienen un hijo de 19 años de edad. Con la determinación de aportar en los ingresos del hogar desde hace casi 2 años trabaja en comercio vendiendo cosméticos y perfumes, negocio que inicio con apoyo de su esposo. Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa y perfumes por docena en el mercado y ofrecer a sus clientes, este ingreso ha sido importante en la estabilidad de su hogar, ya que contrarresta el alto precio de la comida.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of clothing and perfume

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
Emigdio Cáceres is 48 years old and is married to Victorina Mendoza, who is 44 years old. They have 6 children, of whom 4 are sons. They are 22, 18, 16, and 12 years old. Their daughters are 20 and 14 years old. The three oldest children all work and contribute to the family’s income; the three youngest are in still studying in secondary and high school. Emigdio is very proud of his family. He says that despite the fact that they are numerous, they have been able to stay close even during the most difficult moments. In spite of all that goes on with young people these days, his children have chosen to study and work in order to help out the family.

Emigdio has been selling charcoal for more than 25 years. Through this occupation, he has given food, a roof, and education to his family. Emigdio buys charcoal in large quantities and then divides it into 1 and 2 kilogram bags for sale to businesses in the area.

In addition to supplying area businesses, he also distributes charcoal to nearby towns like Villa Elisa and Ñemby.

Emigdio’s dream is that his children will finish a university degree and have a better future, since he had to work from the time he was very young so that he could help his parents. Today he is requesting a loan because a supplier has offered him a large quantity of charcoal at a very good price; he would like to take advantage of the occasion and increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Emigdio Cáceres tiene 48 años y esta casado con Victorina Mendoza de 44 años, ellos tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 4 son varones de 22 , 18 , 16 y 12 años respectivamente y dos hijas de 20 y 14 años; los tres hijos mayores trabajan actualmente y aportan a la canasta familiar y los tres menores van al colegio están cursando sus estudios secundarios. Emigidio esta muy orgulloso de su familia, dice que a pesar de que son numerosos ellos han sabido mantenerse unidos en los momentos más difíciles. Cuenta que a pesar de todo lo que ocurre en estos días con los jóvenes, sus hijos han optado por estudiar y trabajar para ayudar a la familia.

El sr. Emigdio se dedica a la venta de carbón vegetal hace ya 25 años, con este oficio a dado comida, techo y educación a su familia. Emigidio compra el carbón en grandes cantidades y luego los fracciona en bolsas más pequeñas de 1 y 2 kgs. para venderlas a los negocios de la zona.

Además de proveer a negocios de la zona, también distribuye a ciudades aledañas como Villa Elisa y Ñemby.

Emigidio sueña que sus hijos puedan culminar una carrera universitaria y tengan un mejor futuro, ya que el trabajo desde muy pequeño para ayudar a sus padres. Hoy el solicita un crédito pues un proveedor le ha ofrecido una buena cantidad de mercadería a muy buen precio por lo que el desearía aprovechar la ocasión y aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy large amounts of charcoal

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
PORFIRIO is 54 and is a single father with three small children. He lives in the Primavera neighborhood and has sold clothes and groceries from his small store for the past ten years. His business allows him to support his children and make sure that they have the food, medicine and education they need. He has taken out loans in order to increase his business and is now requesting a loan to be able to invest further in his business. He is very concerned about maintaining and increasing his business to be able to provide for his children's basic necessities. His oldest son is 12 and the youngest is 6. Porfirio has built a solid client base in his community and has been able to get ahead despite the difficulties he has encountered.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

PORFIRIO es un señor de 54 años de edad, es padre soltero de 3 hijos aun pequeños, vive en el Barrio la Primavera y tiene un pulpería y venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, con ese negocio mantiene a sus hijos y procura no les falta comida, medicamentos y educación, con créditos ha logrado ir creciendo en su negocio. Solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio el cual le preocupa mucho mantener y hacerlo crecer para garantizar a sus hijos sus necesidades básicas ya que son pequeños el mayor tiene 12 años y el menor 6 años. Ha logrado una buena clientela en su comunidad y en medio de sus dificultades ha logrado salir adelante.

loans.use: Investment for his business

loans.name: Yenediet De Los Ange

texts.es:
This young 22-year-old woman is married and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her husband and one-year-old son. Her husband works selling tomatoes at the market, and she sells clothing. They live with her mother while they work to buy their own home in which to raise their daughter and have more children. She began her business 3 years ago and is currently requesting this loan to buy a batch of clothes from a pawn shop that sells them at a good price. She will only have to invest in cleaning the cleans in order to earn 100% from their resell, a good investment for her.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta joven de 22 años de edad, es casada y habita en el Barrio de Laureles Sur junto a su esposo y un pequeño de 1 año de edad, su marido vende tomates en el mercado y ella vende prendas al crédito de oro y plata. Viven en casa de su madre mientras consiguen comprarse su propia casita en la que puedan criar a su hija y hacer crecer a la familia. Hace 3 años empezó este negocio y ahora solicita un crédito para comprar un lote de prendas a la venta en un negocio de empeño, las cuales son vendidas en un buen precio y solo invierte en limpiarlas, ha esto le gana el 100% y representa una buen inversion para ella.

loans.use: To buy a batch of clothes for her business

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla, 47, is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her husband owns a truck which they use for transportation jobs. She works selling used clothing. They have two grown, married daughters. However, their daughters still need some financial support from their parents. Leyla has been working for 9 years now selling used clothing, an endeavor she began to supplement her husband's income to pay household expenses. She is requesting the loan to buy materials to replace their home's corrugated iron roof that is quite old and in bad condition. They try to keep their home in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Leyla es una mujer de 47 años de edad que habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, casada, su esposo tiene una camioneta la cual trabajan como acarreo, y ella vende ropa usada. Tienen dos hijas mujeres que ya son mayores de edad y están casadas, sin embargo siempre que ellas lo necesitan sus padres le apoyan económicamente. Doña Leyla hace 9 años se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa usada, el cual inició como alternativa de ingreso para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales que le permitan cambiar el techo y zinc de su cuarto que esta viejo y deteriorado, siendo ya solos tratan de mantener su casita en buenas condiciones.

loans.use: To replace her home's corrugated iron roof

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fidencio is 44 years old and is married to Mercedes Samudio, who is 49 years old. They have 3 children. Their oldest daughter is 19 years old, has finished high school and is now studying computation. Their son is 17 years old and finished secondary school and now works in a locksmith’s shop. Their younger daughter is in high school. Fidencio explains that all of his children are very responsible in their studies and in their work, a fact which fills his heart with happiness.

Fidencio is a blacksmith by profession. He worked as a blacksmith since he was 16 years old in various shops until he decided to work independently almost 18 years ago, when he was 27 years old. His specialty is iron bars, sliding doors, and garage doors. He also makes scaffolding for metal roofs.

Because of the good work he does, and the responsibility he shows by having jobs done on time, Fidencio has many orders. He constantly has work and orders, especially from architects.

Recently he has received many jobs, for which he would like to buy more materials, such as iron pipes, iron sheets, and other materials that he needs to do his job, like welding equipment and some tools that will help him to work more quickly. Fidencio is requesting the loan to purchase these things.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Fidencio tiene 44 años y esta casado con Mercedes Samudio de 49 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos, la hija mayor tiene 19 años a terminado el colegio y ahora sigue la carrera de Informática, un varón de 17 años que termino sus estudios secundarios y trabaja en una cerrajería, y una hija menor que esta asistiendo actualmente el colegio. Fidencio cuenta que todos sus hijos son muy responsables en sus estudios y en el trabajo, eso es algo que le llena de alegría el corazón.

Fidencio es herrero de profesión, trabajó como herrero desde los 16 años en distintos talleres hasta que decidió trabajar en forma independiente hace casi 18 años, cuando el tenia 27 años de edad. La especialidad de Fidencio son las rejas de hierros, portones corredizos y basculantes, además fabrica también estructuras para tinglados.

Gracias a la delicadeza de su trabajo y su responsabilidad en la entrega de los mismos, Fidencio posee muchos pedidos de trabajo. Es por eso que constantemente tiene trabajo y pedidos especialmente de arquitectos.

Actualmente ha recibido varios trabajos por lo que desea adquirir insumos como caños de hierro, chapas y otros tipos de insumos que necesita para realizar su trabajo, como un equipo soldador y algunas herramientas más que le ayuden a agilizar su trabajo. Fidencio solicita el crédito para la adquisición de los mismos.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools such as: iron pipe, sheet iron, welding equipment, and some other tools

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
MARIA V., 24, lives in Memorial Sandino and has one daughter, 5. Together they live with her mother and stepfather in her mother's house. Her older siblings live independently. As she lives with her mother, she has enlarged and improved her room so that it is more comfortable for herself and her daughter. For two years now she has been working in the duty-free zone. Her daughter's father helps with household expenses, but she pays the majority of the expenses. She is requesting a loan to finish building her room, which is only halfway done.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA V. de 24 años de edad habita en Memorial Sandino y tiene 1 hija de 5 años de edad, vive con sus hijos, su madre y padrastro, todos habitan en la casa de su madre sus hermanos mayores son independientes y al vivir ella con su madre ha ampliado y mejorado su cuarto para mejor comodidad de ella y su hija. Hace dos años trabaja como operaria en una Zona Franca y el padre de su hija le ayuda con los gastos de su hija aunque la mayor parte lo proporciona ella. Solicita un préstamo para Terminar de construir su cuarto, tiene la mitad construida y espera con este préstamo terminarlo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building her room

loans.name: Scarlett Marisol

texts.es:
SCARLETT MARISOL M. is 26 years old and lives in north Batahola. She is married to an electrician with whom she has 2 small children, ages 6 and 10. They are her greatest joy in life. Her dream is to give them a better education so that they grow up to be productive individuals. This young entrepreneur spares no effort for the wellbeing of her family. She sells clothes and cosmetics from home and in the afternoon works in a pool hall as a cashier. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, increase her inventory, and improve sells.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

SCARLETT MARISOL M., de 26 años de edad. Esta Jovencita vive en Batahola Norte, es casada y su esposo es electricista, tienen 2 hijos pequeños de 10 y 6 años de edad que representan su mayor alegría, su sueño es darle la mejor educación y que crezcan siendo personas de bien. Esta Joven emprendedora no escatima esfuerzo para el bienestar de su familia, vende a domicilio ropa y cosméticos y por las tardes trabaja como cajera en un negocio de Billar. SOLICITA un crédito para comprar por docena en los mercados mercadería de la que ella vende y ampliar su inventario para mejorar sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.en:
The women of "Las Florecitas" ("The Bloomers") gather at the home of their president, Siona C., eagerly awaiting the approval of their second loan from Friendship Bridge. They are from a village just outsiD. Mazatenango, a coastal city whose gracious mixture of sun and rain make for rich, fruitful soil.

All 13 women have businesses related to agriculture. They are skilled in the fields, having learned the traD. as children. The main crop grown is corn, a food staple in Guatemala used for making the tortillas that accompany every meal, and filling corn-based beverages, both warm and cold. The loan will go to buy seed and fertilizer, all which is purchased in the city. Most women have small plots of land behind their homes, and one woman will use her loan to rent a plot of land for the first time. In addition to growing corn, three women also raise chickens on their land, selling eggs and meat. Two women have siD. businesses selling clothing from their home. They will use part of their loan to purchase large amounts of clothing from the city, which they will then sell in their village.

Las Florecitas express that they like Friendship Bridge, not only because it helps them move forward with their businesses and better proviD. for their families, but also because they learn about self esteem, how to raise their children, and how to be a good neighbor. One woman says that knowing how to raise your children is worth more than gold. They also love the dynamics of their group, the friendships they have formed, and each meeting is a chance for them to not only grow in business knowledge, but also grow in their relationships with each other.

They are asking for a group loan of 21,500 quetzales (about $2,825 USD) which they will pay back over the next 9 months.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer, to rent farmland, and to buy clothing in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Cesar Eli

texts.es:
Mr. M. C. is a 35-year-old surgeon who lives in house #99 in the Madrid neighborhood. He is married with two children, ages 3 and 3 months. His wife is a lawyer and works as a legal consultant for the DGI [General Directorate of Revenue] located in Juigalpa, Chontales. Mr. M. has been working as a surgeon for 8 years now and is well known in his professional organization. For 7 years he has been working at the Asuncion medical center. Together with his wife, he has been able to purchase a home. They would like to improve it with a new room, which is currently made of wood. This way they can have more security and better family living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Martínez C. de 35 años de edad, habita en el barrio Madrid, casa # 99, medico cirujano de profesión, casado, con 2 hijos, uno de 3 años y otro de 3 meses de edad, su esposa es de profesión abogado, labora para la DGI Juigalpa, Chontales como asesor legal; el Sr. Martínez tiene 8 años de ejercer su profesión de medio y de reputación conocida en su gremio, actualmente se desempeña en la Empresa Medica Asunción con 7 años de laborar en este centro; junto a su esposa han logrado adquirir su vivienda, que pretenden mejorar con una habitación, ya que en la actualidad ésta es de madera, y así tener mejor seguridad y condiciones de vida familiar.

loans.use: To make home improvements

loans.name: Enedina's Group

texts.es:
Victoria, Hida, and Enedina have been members of the “Poder” communal bank for 3, 3, and 6 years respectively.

Victoria is a 42-year-old married mother of 8. She and her husband sell herbal medicine that they prepare themselves, using herbs that have healing properties. They sell their products in the streets of the city of Ayacucho.

Hida is a 43-year-old married mother of 2. She makes trips to the markets and towns in the Ayacucho region, where she buys cereal, small animals, cheese, and other products sold in these markets.

Enedina is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her partner and 5 children. Four times a week, she makes trips to the local markets, where she sells fruit. From those markets, she brings cheese and small animals. Enedina also sells food for parties, and will prepare and sell local dishes during Holy Week.

Victoria, Hida, and Enedina need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of medicinal herbs, sangre de drago (dragon's blood--medicinal resin), copaiba balsam, wheat, peas, broad beans, meat, potatoes, and rice.

Victoria, Hida, and Enedina dream of owning a house, improving and stabilizing their businesses, and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria, Hida y Enedina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Poder hace 3, 3, 6 años respectivamente.

Victoria es casada, tiene 42 años y 8 hijos, Victoria junto a su esposo venden medicina natural que ellos mismos preparan a base de hierbas con propiedades curativas, sus ventas lo realizan ambulantemente por las calles de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Hida es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Hida viaja a las ferias y pueblos de la región de Ayacucho, donde compra cereales, animales menores, quesos, productos que son vendidos en los mercados de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Enedina es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Enedina viaja a las ferias 4 veces por semana, donde vende frutas, y de las ferias trae queso, animales menores. Además Enedina por fiestas vende comida y por la Semana Santa venderá comida típica.

Victoria, Hida y Enedina necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas medicinales, sangre de drago, aceite de copaiba, trigo, arveja, haba, carne, papa, arroz.

Los sueños de Victoria, Hida y Enedina son tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda estable.

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal herbs, sangre de drago (medicinal resin), copaiba balsam, wheat, peas, broad beans, meat, potatoes, and rice

loans.name: Christiam Guadalupe

texts.es:
She is a 37-year-old teacher  in the rural area and resides in Juigalpa, in the SILAIS Chontales department (Local Systems of Integrated Health Care). She is the single mother of a one-year-old daughter. With her loans, she has been improving her grandmother's house, where she lives as well. There are still a few improvements that need to be made in order to achieve her goal of having a decent house. This is why she is applying for a loan, to continue to build her home, and therefore give her small daughter and dear grandmother a proper house. 

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Profesora de la zona rural, de 37 años de edad, habita en Juigalpa contiguo al SILAIS Chontales, soltera con 1 hija de 1 año de edad, con sus créditos ha mejorado la vivienda de su abuelita donde ella también habita, aun faltan algunos detalles para lograr sus objetivos de tener una vivienda digna, por esa razón ha solicita el crédito para poder seguir construyendo la casa de habitación y así poderle dar una casa mas digna a su pequeña hija y a su abuelita.

loans.use: To continue to improve her house

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. R. Pérez works as a cashier in the Juigalpa's Town hall. She is 41 years old and single, and it's her first time asking for a loan in order to improve her home in Juigalpa, east from Shell 1c. She has two children: one is a high school student and the other is student at college. Ms. R. Pérez will use the money from this loan to change the roof of her bedroom (for the purchase of materials and zinc). Her deepest desire is to improve her home to provide a better life to her children so they feel proud of her and her achievements as a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. R. Pérez trabaja en la Alcaldía de Juigalpa como cajera, soltera y con 41 años de edad, esta solicitando su primer crédito para mejorar su vivienda habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa, de la Shell 1c al este, con 2 hijos, 1 estudia la secundaria y la otra la universidad, su crédito lo utilizara para cambiar el techo de su dormitorio (compra de perlines y zinc). Sus deseos más profundos son empezar a mejorar su vivienda para así poderles dar una mejor vida a sus hijos y que se sientan orgullosos de lo que ella ha logrado como madre soltera

loans.use: Change the roof of a bedroom at her home

loans.name: Maura's Group

texts.es:
Maura, Teodora, and Delia have been members of the Los Claveles communal bank for 11, 10, and 10 years respectively.

Maura is a 59-year-old married mother of 8. She has a mini market and liquor store in her home. She also knits bedspreads, embroiders sheets, and does other handicrafts that she sells to friends and family.

Teodora is a 31-year-old single mother of one child. She buys tara pods, and cochineal insects in her district of residence, Pacaycasa, then sells her products to middlemen in the city of Lima.

Delia is a 55-year-old widow with 2 children. She sells wholesale meat to the markets of Ayacucho. She buys her livestock throughout various markets in the region.

Maura, Teodora, and Delia need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 Peruvian soles respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of cooking oil, noodles, rice, milk, sugar, tara pods, cochineal insects, and pork.

Maura, Teodora, and Delia dream of providing an education for their children, seeing them become professionals, expanding their businesses, and building their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maura, Teodora y Delia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 11, 10, 10 años respectivamente.

Maura es casada, tiene 59 años y 8 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda de abarrotes y licores en su casa. Además Maura teje colchas, borda sabanas, entre otras manualidades que vende a amigos y familiares.

Por otro lado Teodora es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Teodora compra tara y cochinilla en el distrito donde vive, Pacaycasa, y lo vende a intermediarios que llevan a la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Delia es viuda, tiene 55 años y 2 hijos, Delia vende carne al por mayor a los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los compra en la diferentes ferias de la región.

Maura, Teodora y Delia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, fideo, arroz, leche, azúcar, tara, cochinilla, cerdo.

Los sueños de Maura, Teodora y Delia son que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, tener una negocio más grande y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of cooking oil, noodles, rice, milk, sugar, tara pods, cochineal insects, and pigs

loans.name: Zoila Azucena

texts.es:
Ms. C. G. is a young woman of 27 years old who works in the Town hall of Juigalpa. She is enterprising and bought her house located in the Residencial Bosques of Juigalpa. Her house is located in the Rotonda (traffic circle) 2c, south 1/2, west W-3. She is making improvements to her house such as building a wall and upgrading the floor with ceramic tiles, so that her house will be decent, safe and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer
