Joven de 27 años, trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, es emprendedora, ya que compro una casa en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, su casa esta ubicada de la Rotonda 2c al sur ½c al oeste, W-3, donde realizara mejoras como son la construccion de una tapia y mejorar el piso con ceramica para tener una casa digna, segura y reconfortable.

loans.use: To buy the building materials in order to build a wall

loans.name: Lea

texts.es:
Ms. D. E. is a 39-year-old teacher at the school Colegio Tierno Galván in Juigalpa. She is married and has three sons who are students thanks to her husband's support and the previous 4 loans that they requested earlier. With this new loan she wants to start making improvements to her house since her house is still a work in progres and she needs to make improvements to it for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Profesora del Colegio Tierno Galván de la ciudad de Juigalpa, tiene la edad de 39 años, casada con 3 hijos varones, los cuales estudian con la ayuda de su esposo y los 4 créditos anteriores han podido salir adelante, con este ultimo crédito pretende iniciar las mejoras de su vivienda, ya que es una casa de proyecto y necesita mejorarla para tener mejores comodidades para su familia.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Guillerma's Group

texts.es:
Guillermina, Guillerma, and Julia have belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for 8, 8, and 7 years respectively.

Guillermina is married, 45 years old, and has five children. She has a store where she sells general goods, vegetables and fruits in her community of Huayllapampa in the Pacaycasa district. In addition, Guillermina buys and sells the products of the native tree, tara. Guillerma, on the other hand, is married, 44 years old, and has five children. She sells fruits from a traveling cart in the boulevard near the cemetery, and she also prepares fruit juices.

Juila, meanwhile, is married, 36 years old, and has four children. Julia has a grocery store in Huayllapampa. She also sells beverages outsiD. the local stadium.

Guillermina, Guillerma, and Julia need loans for 1400 soles, 600 soles, and 800 soles ($1000 total) that they will invest in buying rice, sugar, noodles, oil, various native fruits and vegetables, including chirimoya and lúcuma, plantains, oranges, cookies, candles, soap, and detergent.

Guillermina, Guillerma, and Julia dream of making of their businesses prosper, of providing a good education to their children, and of improving their houses.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina, Guillerma y Julia pertenecen Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 8, 8, 7 años respectivamente.

Guillermina es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Guillermina tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas en su comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Distrito D. Pacaycasa. Además Guillermina compra y venD. tara.

Por otro lado Guillerma es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Guillerma venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria en la alameda del cementerio y también prepara jugos D. frutas.

Mientras que Julia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Distrito D. Pacaycasa. Además Julia venD. bebidas en el estadio D. su comunidad.

Guillermina, Guillerma y Julia necesitan préstamos D. 1400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, chirimoya, lúcuma, plátano, naranja, galletas, vela, jabón y detergente.

Los sueños Guillermina, Guillerma y Julia son que sus negocios prospere, sus hijos tengan una buena educación y mejorar sus casas.

loans.use: Invest in the womens' businesses with groceries, fruits, vegetables, and general goods.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.es:
LIsbeth, Martha and Liz have belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for three years, one year, and four months, respectively.

Lisbeth is married, 20 years old, and is expecting her first child. She has a small hardware store in a rented shop, a task she has performed for a year now. With this loan, she will improve her business more.

Martha, on the other hand, lives with her partner, is 26 years old and has one five-year-old son. Martha sells food in a rented stand, and she only sells in the evenings.

Liz, meanwhile, lives with her partner, is 20 years old and has one two-year-old daughter. Liz sells food in the community of Huayllapampa, in the Pacaycasa district. Liz plans to expand and stock her store more.

Lisbeth, Martha, and Liz need loans for 1000 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles ($925 total) that they will invest in buying tools, tables and chairs, meats, and soft drinks.

The dreams of Lisbeth, Martha and Luz including having her own house, having a car to transport merchandise, running a grocery store, and sending their children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lisbeth, Martha y Liz pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 3 años, 1 año, 4 meses respectivamente.

Lisbeth es casada, tiene 20 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Lisbeth tiene una pequeña ferretería en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza hace 1 año, con el préstamo que obtendrá implementará más su negocio.

Por otro lado Martha es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo de 5 años, Martha vende comida en un local alquilado, sus ventas lo realiza solo por las noches.

Mientras que Liz es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija de 2 años, Liz vende comida en su comunidad de Huayllapampa, Distrito de Pacaycasa. Liz tiene proyectado ampliar y surtir más su negocio.

Lisbeth, Martha y Liz necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de artículos de ferretería, mesas, sillas, carne, gaseosa.

Los sueños Lisbeth, Martha y Liz son tener casa propia, un carro para trasladar su mercadería, una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Invest in the womens' businesses, including buying tools, tables and chairs, meat, and soft drinks.

loans.name: De Cristal Group

texts.en:
Slightly timid, but sure of their reasons for being here, the women of De CristA. gather for their first loan from Friendship Bridge. Gradually they open up, sharing their goals and hopes for the future. With a variety of businesses, the women are bound by the common goA. of providing a better life for their children and grandchildren.

Three women prepare breakfast and lunch from their homes, serving plates of beans, eggs, and tortillas, as well as tamales and rice. They will invest their loan in the ingredients to prepare these meals, as well as more plates that will allow them to serve more people at one time.

Five women raise animals. They will invest their loan in feed for their cows, pigs, and chickens. One of the five women is also planning on buying a calf that she will use to make milk and cheese.

Two women are weavers, specializing in "huipiles," the traditionA. Mayan blouse, as well as skirts like the ones you see in the picture. They will use their loan to purchase thread in bulk, something they’ve never been able to do before. Until now, they had to travel to the market and purchase just enough thread for a single blouse, which meant they had to pay retail price and spend a lot of time traveling.

Two women rent small plots of land where they grow corn and milpa, the leaves used to wrap tamales. They will invest their loan in seed and fertilizer, and to pay the rent on their land. These women provide the milpa for the other women in the group who sell tamales.

After only a couple meetings, the women already know they love being a part of their village bank. They say it is a support group that allows them to laugh and joke around while learning to improve their businesses and better provide for their families. The twelve women are asking for a group loan of 17,100 quetzales, about $2250 USD. They will pay this back over the next nine months.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation, feed for animals, a calf, thread, and seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.es:
Mercedes, Paulina and Eugenia have belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for 4, 2, and 4 years respectively.

Mercedes lives with her partner, is 24 years old, and has two children. She sells clothing in the Los Incas market., and is planning on traveling to fairs to sell clothing as well. Also, Mercedes will begin to make adobe-style bricks.

On the other hand, Paulina is married, is 48 years old, and has seven children, four of whom live with her. Paulina crafts bricks in her community of Huayllapampa. In addition, she sells food in the afternoons.

Meanwhile, Eugenia is married, is 36 years old, and has six children. Eugenia and her husband dedicate themselves to crafting adobe-style bricks for their community of Huayllapampa. Eugenia also raises native trees, tara, and piglets.

Mercedes, Paulina, and Eugenia need loans for 600 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles, $575 total, money that they will invest in buying sand, meat, potatoes, condiments and in paying her laborers.

Mercedes, Paulina, and Eugenia dream of buying more land for making their bricks, of running a restaurant, and of their children having stable jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes, Paulina y Eugenia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 4, 2, 4 años respectivamente.

Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes vende ropa en el mercado Los Incas, Mercedes tiene proyectado viajar a las ferias para vender ropa. Además Mercedes comenzará a fabricar ladrillos.

Por otro lado Paulina es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Paulina fabrica ladrillos artesanales en su comunidad de Huayllapampa. Además Paulina vende comida por las tardes.

Mientras que Eugenia es casada, tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, Eugenia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en su comunidad de Huayllapampa. Además Eugenia tiene cultivos de tara y cochinilla.

Mercedes, Paulina y Eugenia necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena, carne, papa, condimentos y para el pago de los peones.

Los sueños de Mercedes, Paulina y Eugenia son comprar más terrenos para elaborar ladrillos, tener su restaurante y que sus hijos tengan trabajo estable.

loans.use: Mercedes, Paulina and Eugenia need loans to invest in brick making, running a restaurant, and paying employees.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a young father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture tasks for the past 8 years, cultivating potatoes, beans, and forage crops for animals. His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits, so that his three children can continue their education. Antonio has dreamed of extending his lands and wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva voluntter.

Antonio es un joven padre de familia que durante 8 años se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas de manera independiente cultivando así la papa, habas y también forraje para el alimento de animales, los esfuerzos que realiza diariamente y el cuidado de sus campos aseguran una buena cosecha y también las ganancias para que sus 3 hijos sigan estudiando, Antonio tiene el sueño de extender sus terrenos y desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en sus terrenos actuales a fin de obtener mayores ganacias para cumplir la meta que se ha trazado.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.es:
For 2, 5, and 3 years respectively Ruth, Flor and Paulina have belonged to the communal bank "Ccatarisun," a Quechua expression that means "Let's Move Up."

Ruth is a single mother of a four-year-old daughter; she is 23 years old. Ruth is a computer technician, and she also sells groceries out of her home. Ruth occasionally works at a business selling computers.

Flor is a single mother of two children, and is 32 years old. Flor has a bar in her home, an activity that she has performed for a year. Also, Flor sells cosmetics by catalog. With this loan, Flor will make a down payment on a mototaxi.

Paulina is married, 50 years old, and has five children, three of whom live with her. A nurse by profession, Paulina sells clothing and shoes on credit to her friends and family, products that she brings from the city of Lima. Paulina also sells cosmetics and jewelry from cosmetics. Paulina will use the loan to open a phone center.

Ruth, Flor and Paulina need loans for 600, 1500 and 1000 soles ($1125 total), money they will invest in purchasing soft drinks, noodles, sugar, vegetable, and in making down payments for a motor taxi and a phone center.

Ruth, Flor, and Paulina dream of having a computer sales business, a wholesale grocery store, of purchasing a car, and that their children will grow up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth, Flor y Paulina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2, 5 , 3 años respectivamente.

Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 4 años, Ruth es técnica en computación, Ruth tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Ruth trabaja eventualmente en empresas de venta de computadoras.

Por otro lado Flor es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Flor tiene un bar en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 1 año. Además Flor vende cosméticos por catálogo. Flor con el préstamo que obtendrá pagará la inicial de una mototaxi.

Mientras que Paulina es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, de profesión enfermera, Paulina vende zapatos y ropa a crédito a amigos y familiares, sus productos los trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Paulina vende cosméticos, joyas por catálogos. Paulina con el préstamo que obtendrá abrirá un locutorio.

Ruth, Flor y Paulina necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1500 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, fideo, azúcar, verduras, para la inicial de su mototaxi y locutorio.

Los sueños de Ruth, Flor y Paulina son tener una empresa de venta de computadoras, una tienda de abarrotes por mayor, comprar un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, and down payments on a motor taxi and phone center.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
For two years, Sonia and Felicitas have belonged to the communal bank "Ccatarisun", a Quechua expression meaning "Let's move up"

Sonia is married, is 36 years old and has four children. Sonia sells cheeses and trout, selling through the streets in the city of Ayacucho. She brings her goods from San Felipe. Also, Sonia sells old newspapers by the pound at art stores.

Felicitas is married, 47 years old, and has four children. She sells breakfasts in the Nery García market on foot. Also, Felicitas goes on to sell typical dishes at fairs.

Sonia and Felicitas need loans for 1000 and 750 soles ($625 total), money that will be invested in buying cheese, trout, tables, chairs, and fixing up her cart.

Sonia and Felicitas dream of having a restaurant selling ceviche (a dish maD. from fish and lemon juice), of improving their businesses, of their children going to school, and of improving their house.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia y Felicitas pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2 años .

Sonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Sonia venD. quesos, truchas, sus ventas lo realiza caminando por las casas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus productos los trae D. la feria D. San Felipe. Además Sonia venD. periódicos pasados por kilos, a tiendas D. pinturas.

Mientras que Felicitas es casada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas venD. desayunos en el mercado Nery García D. manera ambulatoria. Además, Felicitas eventualmente venD. comida típica en las ferias.

Sonia y Felicitas necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. queso, trucha, mesas, silla y arreglo D. su carretilla.

Los sueños D. Sonia y Felicitas son tener un restaurante cebichería, mejorar sus negocios, que sus hijos estudien y mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Sonia and Felicitas need loans to invest in buying foods and equipment for restaurants, and for improving food carts.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora is married, 36 years old, and has two children who are 10 and 18 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver. Maria Auxiliadora is a hairstylist and cosmetologist and has her own beauty salon. She also works on an on-call basis. She started her business as a hairstylist and her biggest desire is to set up a whole beauty salon with all the products that she needs for her customers. Maria Auxiliadora is asking for a loan in order to buy the equipment and beauty products necessary to start the expansion of her business and for her growth as a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Auxiliadora tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 10 años. Su esposo es taxista. Ella es estilista y cosmetóloga, y posee un salón de belleza pero también hace trabajos a domicilio. Inició su actividad cortando cabellos, su deseo es poder poner un salon de belleza completo con todos los productos necesarios para ofrecer. Solicita el crédito para comprar equipos y productos de belleza para empezar así su creciemiento tanto profesional como del negocio

loans.use: To buy equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo L. lives in the city of Leon, in the county of Achuapa which is where he is a farmer, and has his own animals such as cows, bulls and calves which he raises to sell and to bring them to the slaughterhouse.

He has 2 young kids that need his help, in their studies as much as morally, so that they can move forward in life. Despite his difficult financial situation this young father has managed to partly improve his family's situation, and as there is no electricity in his community, he has fitted a solar panal in his house. He now needs to cancel his debt so that his wife and kids can have light from the panal, and a TV in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Danilo L. es un caballero habitante de la ciudad de León específicamente del municipio de Achauapa en donde se dedica al negocio de la ganadería teniendo sus propios animales como vaquillas, toros y terneros que los cría para luego proceder a comercializarlos y llevar a cabo el proceso del destace de los animales.

Es padre de dos pequeños hijos que necesitan del apoyo de su apoyo tanto en los estudios como en apoyo moral para salir adelante. A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado este joven padre, ha logrado mejorar en parte la situación de su familia y para ello al no tener acceso de energía eléctrica en su comunidad ha solicitado que se le implemente un panel solar en su casa de habitación el cual hoy en día tiene la necesidad de cancelar para brindarle a sus hijos y esposa el acceso a la iluminación por medio del panel y el acceso a un televisor en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To pay for a home solar panal/Pago de panel solar para su vivienda

loans.name: Dina Lisette

texts.es:
In the city of Leon, in the county of Achuapa, Dina Lisette Narvaez is a farmer, and helps her husband by working near their home and in many other places too. She has 2 daughters who are both school age, and who are both excellent students.

In order to solve the problem of living in a home with no electricity, Dina Narvaez has fitted a solar panal in order to get light. Now she would like to cancel the debt that she has because of this panal, and this is why she would like a loan from Ceprodel. She will use it to pay off the debt as the solar panal is just what they need in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la ciudad de León en el municipio de Achuapa la señora Dina Lisette N. se dedica al negocio de agricultura en apoyo a su esposo trabajando en las cercanías a su hogar de habitación y a la vez en lugres muy distantes a su hogar. Ella es madre de dos hijas ambas en edades escolares que se han destacado por ser muy excelentes estudiantes.

Para solucionar la problemática que viven en su hogar como es la ausencia de energía eléctrica, la señora Dina N. ha implementado un panel solar para aprovechamiento de la energía eléctrica y al haber obtenido dicho panel está en la obligación de cancelar esta deuda y para ello ha acudido a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con crédito que le permita saldar la deuda y de esta manera darle uso al panel solar que tanto necesita en su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To pay for a home solar panal/Pago de panel solar para vivienda

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. M., 22-year-old, is married and has e a one-year-old son. Her husband is a sales assistant. They live in Haileah. Mrs. M. has been selling used clothing for five years now, and she hopes to have her own store and expand her business.She is asking for a loan in order to buy used clothing in bulk to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Tiene 22 años de edad, habita en Hialeah. Es casada. Su esposo es auxiliar de ventas. Tienen un pequeño de un año de edad. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, aspira tener una tienda y ampliar su negocio. Solicita un préstamos para comprar una paca de ropa de usada para surtir mejor su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a used clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana O. is originally from the county of Achuapa in the city of Leon where she has been sewing seeds in order to sell their produce for many years. With her experience in this business she, along with her husband, has been able to support their 2 kids, who are now school age, and this is why she puts in so much effort; so that one day in the future she would see her kids become professionals.

Nowadays one of Juana's greatest needs is a solar panal for light as it is useful to have light at night in order to control the harvest and also so that their kids can study as their community does not have electricity.

This situation has left Juana needing a loan from Ceprodel so that she can pay off her debt and therefore give her humble family and their home better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana O. es originaria del municipio de Achuapa de la ciudad de León donde se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de siembra de semilla para luego comercializarla en su sector de habitación en esta comunidad. Con mucha experiencia en el negocio ella ha logrado junto con su esposo mantener a sus dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y por esta razón se esfuerza para ver realizado su sueño de que sus hijos algún día no muy lejano lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.

Hoy en día una de las mayores necesidades que atraviesa la señora Juana es la urgencia de adquirir un panel solar para su iluminación debido a que le es útil por las noches tener acceso a la iluminación para controlar la cosecha y además para que sus hijos estudien debido a que en la comunidad no se cuenta con energía eléctrica.

Esta situación ha dado lugar a que la señora Juana O. acuda a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan saldar su deuda y así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su humilde familia en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To cancel the debt of a home solar panal/Cancelacion de deuda de panel solar para su vivienda

loans.name: María

texts.es:
It is with much effort and sacrifice that Maria Martinez Chavarria, a young mother of 2, has been able to look after her kids, and provide what they need. Her husband also helps to cover the household costs, as he is a farmer in the county of Achuapa, which is where they currently live. Achuapa is a community without electricity as it is very far from an urban centre. Even so, this has not stopped Maria Martinez, and she has acquired a solar panal to provide light.

In order to cancel this debt she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel and so that the panal can continue to be used by their kids who so need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio la joven madre de dos hijos Maria M. Chavarria ha logrado cuidar a sus pequeños y velar por sus necesidades y de igual manera las necesidades del hogar gracias al apoyo de su querido esposo que se dedica a la agricultura en el municipio de Achuapa que es donde viven actualmente. El municipio de Achuapa es una comunidad que no posee energía eléctrica por condiciones de lejanía de la zona urbana, sin embargo esto no ha sido impedimento para la dama Maria M. ya que ha adquirido un panel solar para su respectiva iluminación.

Para cancelar dicha deuda ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel con el único fin de cancelar esta deuda y utilizar el panel sin ningún problema beneficiando directamente a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo

loans.use: To pay for a solar panal/Pago de panel solar

loans.name: Flora Martha's Group

texts.es:
Juana, Flora, and Sonia joined the communal bank "Poder" five years, five years, and four months ago, respectively.

Juana lives with her partner, is 34 years old and has five children. She travels to fairs twice a week where she sells groceries. From the fairs, she brings home grains that she sells in the Nery García market. Also, Juana sells fruit out of her house.

For her part, Flora is married, is 32 years old, and has three children. Flora travels to various fairs in the Ayacucho region where she buys grains, cheese, young animals, and other products that she sells at market in the city of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Sonia is married, is 24 years old and has three children. She weaves beautiful sweaters, and embroiders blankets and bags, an activity she does for businesses and shops. With this loan, Sonia will make a down payment toward purchasing a motortaxi.

Juana, Flora and Sonia need loans for 1500, 400, and 400 soles ($825 total), money that will be invested in buying wheat, quinoa, barley, broad bean, peas, corn, cheese, and the down payment on a motortaxi.

Juana, Flora, Sonia dream of their children becoming professionals, of improving their businesses, and of having homes of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juana, Flora y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Poder hace 5 años, 5 años, 4 meses respectivamente.

Juana es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Juana viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana, donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias trae cereales que vende en el mercado Nery García. Además Juana vende frutas en su casa.

Por otro lado Flora es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Flora viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de Ayacucho de donde compra cereales, queso, animales menores, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Sonia es casada, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Sonia teje bellas chompas, borda manteles, mochilas, actividad que realiza para empresas y tiendas. Sonia con el préstamo que obtendrá pagará la inicial para comprar una mototaxi.

Juana, Flora y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 1500 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, quinua, cebada, haba, arveja, maíz, queso y para la inicial de su mototaxi.

Los sueños de Juana, Flora y Sonia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for resale and for down payment on a motor taxi

loans.name: Marisel

texts.es:
Marisel M. is a very hard working woman who is originally from the county of Achuapa, in the city of Leon, in Nicaragua. She has been a farmer there for many years, and she has her own farmyard in her house. Her young son is very proud to have such a hard working mother, and he has already done a lot towards becoming the best student at his school.

In order to give him a better life style, Marisel looked into ways of improving their situation, and has implemented the use of a solar panal as their community has no electricity, and has to use candles at nightime, which can be dangerous and cause accidental fires. To cancel the debt of the panal she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel as it is the only way forward, and would allow for good use of the panal, and give her son the necessary conditions for his intellectual development.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Marisel M. es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio Achuapa de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua el cual se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de ganadería teniendo su propio corral en su casa de habitación. Su pequeño hijo se siente muy orgulloso por tener una madre muy trabajadora y ha hecho todo lo posible por ser el mejor alumno en su sección en el colegio donde estudia.

Para brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijo ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación y para ello ha implementado un panel solar ya que en su comunidad no poseen energía eléctrica con que iluminarse sino que ocupan candiles por la noche que hasta cierto punto son muy peligrosos por la exposición a incendios accidentales. Para cancelar la deuda del panel ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel con el único fin de liberar esa deuda y así darle el uso adecuado al panel para continuar proporcionándole las condiciones necesarias a su hijo para que se desarrolle intelectualmente.

loans.use: To pay for a home solar panal/Pago de panel solar para vivienda

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia is a 30-year-old single mother. She lives in the Reparto el Carmen with her two children, 9 and 6 years old, who are elementary school students. Karla Patricia opened an local store 6 years ago which became general store. She plans on providing her children with a good education so they can enjoy a better future. Karla Patricia wants to expand her inventory and infrastructure. She's requesting a loan in order to invest the money in her business, buy school supplies, basic grains, and expand a room that she uses to sell clothing and beauty products, her main source of profit.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Karla Patricia es una madre soltera de 30 años de edad. Habita en el reparto el carmen y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad que actualemnte se encuentran estudiando en primaria. hace 6 años montó una pulpería que con el tiempo se convirtió en una miscelanea. sus planes es darle educación a sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor. Quiere expandirse en inventario e infraestructura.Solicita un prestamo para invertir en su negocio, utiles escolares y granos básicos y ampliar un espacio que usa para la venta de ropa y cosméticos, de donde ellos obtienen mejores ganancias

loans.use: To buy basic grains, school supplies, and imitation jewelry

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
Marta Elena R. has 6 kids who are all studying in the county school of Achuapa, in the city of Leon. That is also where they live, in their own home. Mrs R. has been a farmer since she was young, sewing seeds, harvesting them and then selling them, and this is her and her kids' only form of income.

Her only worry at the moment is that she needs some financial resources as in their village there is no electricity and they have therefore got a solar panal, but she needs to pay for it at this time. This is why she has asked Ceprodel for a loan so that she can pay her way and use the panal for the needs of her household and for her kids' education, which is what she cares about most.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Marta Elena R. es madre de seis hijos todos estudiantes de un colegio del municipio de Achuapa de la ciudad de León que es donde ellos viven en un hogar propio. La señora R. se dedica desde muy joven al negocio de agricultura sembrando semillas y luego al momento de la siega la recoge y la comercializa siendo este su único ingreso con el que mantiene su hogar y a sus hijos.

Su preocupación actualmente es la necesidad de obtener recursos económicos debido a que en su localidad no cuenta con energía eléctrica y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar en estos próximos días. Por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con crédito que le de la oportunidad de saldar su cuenta y utilizar el panel para los quehaceres del hogar y el estudio de sus hijos que son lo que mas quiere según comenta.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel/Pago de panel solar

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is originally from the Achuapa area of León, Nicaragua, and is a dedicated housewife who cares for her school-age son. Her husband breeds livestock and works every day from very early in the morning until nightfall with the sole objective of putting food on the table.

Achuapa is very rural and currently does not receive electricity. To remedy this, Mercedes has acquired a solar panel to power two lamps and a television set. In doing so, she took on a debt that she wishes to erase, and is requesting a loan to pay it off so she and her family can make the most out of the energy and take on household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Mercedes C. es originaria del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León y se dedica a la labor de ama de casa y cuido de su pequeño hijo en edad escolar. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de ganadería trabajando todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta que anochece con el único objetivo de llevar el alimento a su mesa y así poder sobrevivir en la vida

El municipio de Achuapa actualmente tiene la problemática de que no posee energía eléctrica por su ubicación a una larga distancia de la zona urbana. Al atravesar esta necesidad, la señora Mercedes ha adquirido un panel solar que le permite tener acceso a dos lámparas y un televisor. Al adquirirlo ha adquirido una deuda el cual debe de cancelar y es por dicho motivo que hoy acuda a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita cancelar la deuda y así ella y sus hijos puedan aprovechar la energía para llevar a cabo las tareas del hogar.

loans.use: Pay for solar panel / Pago de panel solar

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara lives with her husband and three children in their own home in a rural zone of Achuapa, Nicaragua. Together they work on their farm, dedicating themselves to raising livestock and sowing seeds for an abundant harvest.

Xiomara's family have stood out a lot by being so hard-working; her kids also lend their hands daily to the farm work.

Because they live in a remote area, Xiomara and her family aren't able to get electricity. To improve the living conditions for her children, she has requested adding a solar panel to her home to provide energy for two lamps, an electric grill and a small television set. To cover these costs, she's requesting a loan so she can still continue fighting hard to improve the conditions for her small children who need their parents so much.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El municipio de Achuapa es una localidad ubicada en una zona rural donde habita la dama Xiomara T. con su esposo y tres hijos en su propia casa de habitación. Ambos trabajan en el negocio agropecuario dedicándose a la crianza de ganado y siembra de semilla para obtener abundante cosecha.

La familia de la señora Xiomara se ha destacado mucho por ser muy trabajadora ya que sus hijos también forman parte del trabajo diario en el negocio agropecuario.

Para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños, la señora Xiomara al no contar con energía eléctrica en su sector por estar muy alejado, ha solicitado que le implementen un panel solar en su casa de habitación para iluminarse por medio de dos lámparas y tener acceso a una plancha y un pequeño televisor. Para cubrir este gasto ella ha acudido a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito necesario para cancelar esta deuda y así continuar luchando fuertemente para mejorar las condiciones de sus pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de sus padres.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home / Pago de panel solar para la vivienda

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Victoria and Marleny have belonged to the Power Communal Bank for 8 and 4 years respectively. Victoria is married, 40 years old and has one child. Victoria travels to the markets where they sell bread and fruit and she brings cheese and meat, products that she sells in the markets of Ayacucho in a traveling manner. Marleny is single, she is 27 years old and has one son who is 4 years old, Marleny sells vegetables in an area of the city of Chincha. Furthermore Marleny purchases rubber, pig, and leather that she sells. Victoria and Marleny need loans of 400 soles, 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cheese, gum, pig, and leather. The dreams of Victoria and Marleny are that their children will be professionals, to construct a house, to have a car to transport her merchandise and that their businesses prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria y Marleny pertenecen al Banco Comunal Poder hace 8, 4 años respectivamente.

Victoria es casada, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Victoria viaja a las ferias donde vende pan, frutas y de las ferias trae queso, carne, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.

Mientras que Marleny es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1hijo de 4 años, Marleny vende verduras en un pueblo de la ciudad de Chincha. Además Marleny compra tara, cochinilla y cuero de animales, que vende a intermediarios.

Victoria y Marleny necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, carne, tara, cochinilla y cuero de animales.

Los sueños de Victoria y Marleny son que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa, tener un carro para trasladar su mercadería y que sus negocios prosperen.

loans.use: Victoria and Marleny need loans of 400 soles, 1000 soles, money that they will invest in the purchase of cheese, meat, gum, pig, and leather.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.es:
Hilda and Delia have belonged to the Ccatarisun Communal Bank which means “lift us” in Quechua, for 2 years. Hilda lives with her partner, she is 24 years old and has 3 children. Hilda sells spare parts for cars in a rented place, an activity she has done for 6 months. On the other hand, Delia is single and is 22, Delia works with her brother, they have a printer and Internet booths, located on a central street of the city of Ayacucho. Hilda and Delia need loans of 1000 soles, 750 soles, money that they will invest in the purchase of spare parts for cars, and memory for the computers. The dreams of Hilda and Delia are to improve their business, that their children study, and to have another printer.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda y Delia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2 años .

Hilda es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Hilda venD. repuestos para motos en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses.

Por otro lado Delia es soltera y tiene 22 años, delia junto a su hermano tienen una imprenta y cabinas D. Internet, ubicados en una calle céntrica D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Hilda y Delia necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. repuestos para motos, memorias para las computadoras.

Los sueños D. Hilda y Delia son surtir su negocio, que sus hijos estudien, tener otra imprenta.

loans.use: Hilda and Delia need loans of 100 soles, 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for cars and memory for computers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia has belonged to the Ccatarisun Communal Bank that means “Lift us” in Quechua, for 2 years. Lucia is single and 28 years old, Lucia together with her sister has a restaurant in a central street of the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore Lucia together with her mother has a grocery store. Lucia needs a loan of 1750 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, pumpkin, tomato, and meats. Lucia’s dreams are of supplying her store, entertaining in her home, finishing her studies and to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2 años .

Mientras que Lucia es soltera y tiene 28 años, Lucia junto a su hermana tienen un restaurante en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Ademas Lucia junto a su mama tiene una tienda de abarrotes.

Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, zapallo, tomate, carnes.

Los sueños de Lucia son surtir su negocio, tener un recreo en su casa, terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.

loans.use: Lucia needs a loan of 1750 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, pumpkin, tomato, and meats.

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa is 39, a mother with four children. She received her first loan from SPBD several years ago in order to increase the diversity of the products she sells. She did very well with her loan and felt proud that she was able to make her payments on time while also increasing profits. She is requesting a new loan so she may continue to increase her sales, and maybe even venture into making prints on clothes in the future.

loans.use: Purchase more materials and tools for her sewing business.

loans.name: Nee

texts.en: Nee, a mother of six, age twenty-nine, has requested a loan of $500 so that she can purchase more goods for her BBQ to sell. She has been a great client with SPBD in the past. All of her loans have been repaid with no delays. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist Nee as she continues to develop her business. She’s a very energetic mother that wishes to provide her children the best education.

loans.use: Purchase additional meats and other ingredients for her barbeque business

loans.name: Ula

texts.en: Ula has 3 years experience selling handicrafts and vegetables. She was motivated to start by her friend, who is in the same line of business and is very successful. With the help of a close friend who lent her money, Ula was able to start up her business. She sells her goods by visiting the homes of family, friends and acquaintances. Like her, the clients she sells to often lack cash flow and must pay for the products in installments. Part of Ula’s work is to collect the weekly and biweekly payments owed to her by clients. She feels that her work is getting tougher, but she’ll never give up for she believes her business has a future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her flea market stall.

loans.name: Patisepa

texts.en: Patisepa owns a small shop at Toamua village. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having own her business for 10 years. She tries to maintain a good selection of items in her shop that would be in demand by passing shoppers. Patisepa’s business is a large source of income for her, her husband, Lafi, and their 12 children. She makes $700 (local dollars) profit in a typical month. She has requested a loan of $900 (U.S. dollars) to purchase new inventory. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting Patisepa as she works to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her retail shop

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabella has a banana plantation at her home at Vailele. She started her business 12 years ago, working out of her parent’s land. Recently Isabella has taken the opportunity to sell banana’s to her neighboring islands. This gives her a second source of income to support herself, since she is raising seven children alone. Isabella is a repeat lender under our program with Kiva. Her first loan was invested successfully and resulted in her being able to improve her home. She would use this, her third loan, to purchase equipment and supplies needed for her bananas. With these additional earnings she would like to continue improving her home and her business.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment, agricultural supplies and planting material for her banana plantation

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is thirty-one years old and has 2 children. She is the only source of income in the household, since her husband abandoned her and left her with full responsibility for the family. Unfortunately one of her sons has a motor disability. She does not have sufficient resources to invest in a special school for him. She aspires to increase her earnings in order to support her children and give them an education. With the financial support that we have been giving, she was able to start her small business that is now successful with the help from her parents. She has been saving money to make her one wish come true, which is sending her disabled son to a special school.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials and inventory for her bakery.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina has a business selling pancakes and ice cakes at a busy market in Apia, Samoa. She is a sharp businesswoman who always tries to keep the recipe of her products secret so that it will be in demand with her customers. Business growth is one of her biggest goals for the future. She has requested a loan to increase her business. This will allow her to purchase new ingredients for her new menu and continue her business development while serving many grateful customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her pancake and ice cake business

loans.name: Kilitia

texts.en: Kilita S. is a married 49-year-old. Her husband has had a lawnmowing business for the past 15 years, and he  specializes in offering this service. His experience began at the age of 14 when working for the reverend's family in his village. He got into an accident one day and injured himself badly. From then, their business was having difficulties, so that it nearly closed up. Kilitia then joined SPBD, and that helped her shape up the business into what is it right now. With her requested loan she will be purchasing two new lawnmowers.

loans.use: To purchase 2 new lawn mowers

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa T. runs a pork cake business in her village of Lalovaea. She mainly supplies to nearby companies and village stores. Lisa T. is a very active woman, and is still willing to stay in the program for as long as she can live. With the financial support that SPBD have provided, it has helped her in many ways, which she is thankful for. Without this support she would never be at where she is right now. With her requested loan she plans to buy more ingredients to increase her production.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her pork cake business

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa is a single mother of three children. She is the only source of income in the household, since her husband abandoned her and left her with full responsibility for the family. She has had an immaculate account history with her first loan and will continue to repay current debt levels in full and on time. With her requested loan she plans to purchase printing boards for her elei business that is in high demand by her clients. Leafa aims to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more printing boards and ink for her elei printing (a traditional way of printing textiles for shirts and dresses) business.

loans.name: Aperila

texts.en: Aperila is a mother of 4 children; she is age thirty-one. Her husband is also underemployed like her but does fishing business to help support their family. Her business is making pancakes, and she supplies them to their village primary school and nearby families. Rosa enjoys doing her business everyday because she relies on its income to support her family. With her requested loan she plans to purchase more ingredients to increase her daily production, and also to extend her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and ingredients for her pancake business

loans.name: Asiasiaga

texts.en: Running a shop for over six and a half years has heped this member pay off all her loans, and it has improved her business. Asiasiga is a married woman who has two grownup children. Her shop is located in her village, and it’s open from the wee hours in the morning until late at night, because she has a lot of clients. She is one of our very good clients who has shown so much effort in the program and is still going strong. Her personality has kept her relationship with her clients. So with her requested loan, she will buy more stock (inventory) for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her retail shop

loans.name: Puapuaga

texts.en: Puapuaga is a hardworking woman with three children. She spends hard labor on the farm that supports her family. She repayed her previous loans well and is always trying to better her small business. She sells her bananas every week at the Fugalei Market in Apia town. With her requested loan, she plans to purchase more planting materials and agricultural supplies to expand her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional planting materials, agricultural supplies, and some farm tools like long knives, rakes, planting sticks.

loans.name: Filitaa

texts.en: Filitaa F. is a mother of 5 children. She is a hardworking woman who has been committing effort to the program. She is always trying to improve her small business. With the loan she could manage the hard problems better and be able to increase the plantation's productivity and profitability. With her requested loan she plans to buy additional planting materials and farm supplies and implements for her plantation.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural supplies, planting materials, and farm implements

loans.name: Thi Chien's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chiến, 48 years old, is married with three school age children. They have a pet food shop. She also raises some livestock for extra income. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to buy feed for her livestock. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lê Thị Nga applies for a loan to buy scrap metal and feed for pigs.
  • C. Thị Luân applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thuý applies for a loan to buy piglets.
  • Ngô Thị Thư applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock.
  • Nguyễn Thị Liễu applies for a loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Chiến năm nay 48 tuổi. Chị có chồng và ba con đang đi học. Anh chị mở một cửa hàng bán thức ăn cho gia súc phục vụ nhân dân quanh vùng. N.ài ra chị cũng chăn nuôi lợn để góp phần tạo thu nhập nuôi các con ăn học. chị vay 2006000 đồng để chị mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi. Chị rất muốn được tham gia chương trình mãi mãi. Trong nhóm gồm có các chị: Lê Thị Nga vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám cho lợn và một phần thêm vốn đi chợ sắt vụn hàng ngày. Chị C. Thị Luân vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn cho gà, lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuý vay 2006000 đồng để mua lợn giống. Chị Ngô Thị Thư vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị Liễu vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Tae

texts.en: Tae P. is a longtime member in the program, and she fully paid off her $500 loan in just 48 weeks. Before joining SPBD, she already had an existing business which is a flea market, but she didn’t have enough stocks (inventory). She used her loan to buy good quality handicrafts, and she says it’s all sold out. She is now requesting for another loan to buy more handicrafts for her market. This lady also has a good savings account, which she is preserving for bad days.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (handicrafts) for her flea market stall

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S., 29, is married with two children who works selling groceries in her village, normally making around $1 a day. Her husband Mr. Sang, age 24, works as a construction worker building house. On average, he earns around $2 a day.  This couple would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike. This motorbike will be used to transfer the groceries to the market and also use it for commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transfer the groceries to market.

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Hoa, 43 years old, is married with two children. They are rice farmers. She also raises livestock for extra income. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to buy feed for her livestock. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • C. Văn Quỳnh applies for a loan to buy feed for poultry.
  • Nguyễn Thị Lý applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock and to buy breeding pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Lan applies for a loan to buy breeding pigs.
  • Đàm Thị Hương applies for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.
  • Trương Thị Kim Dung applies for a loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đinh Thị Hoa năm nay 43 tuổi. Gia đình chị làm nghề nông nghiệp như bao gia đình trong thôn khác. Chị không những làm nông nghiệp giỏi mà chăn nuôi cũng giỏi. Chị tham gia vay vốn để mua thức ăn cho gà, tăng thu nhập để nuôi 2 con đi học. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Anh C. Văn Quỳnh vay để mua cám chăn nuôi gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý vay để mua lợn giống và mua cám chăn nuôi. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lan vay để thêm vốn đi chợ và mua lợn giống. Chị Đàm Thị Hương vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà và thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị Trương Thị Kim Dung vay để thêm vốn đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for poultry and livestock

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Mrs. Noun C. is a used goods broker and earns about $3 per day. Her husband Chhin Vuthy makes $4 per day as a bricklayer. They also have a rice field. C. and Vuthy live with their parents and children in Mong Ti 7 Village, Kampong Cham Province. All three of their children are students. C. requests a $700 loan to buy a plow (machine) for her rice field and also to rent to her neighbors. This investment will improve her rice production and bring in extra income through the plow rental. The photo is of C. and her mother.

loans.use: To buy a plow (machine) for her rice field and also to rent to her neighbors

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Pao R., age 26, is a mother of one child and works making small flat baskets (made from bamboo). On average, she earns less than $1 of profit per day. Her husband Mr. Phat Phal, 28, works as a construction worker. Normally he makes about $4 a day.To reduce expenses, this couple needs a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy N. is a 30-year-old farmer who earns $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Uch Pou, is also a farmer as well as a fisherman. They live with their three children in Dang Korb Village, Kandal Province. She requests a $800 loan to purchase fertilizer and a pumping machine for irrigating crops. N. hopes this loan will help her provide for her family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a pumping machine for irrigating crops

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en: Mrs. Chamroen R. is a 29-year-old farmer who earns $2.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Kan Choeurn, earns $3 per day farming and fishing. They live with their only child in Dang Korb Village, Kandal Province. R. requests a $500 loan to purchase a pumping machine to irrigate crops. She hope this loan will improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine to irrigate crops

loans.name: Sahdullo

texts.en:
D. Sahdullo is 21 years old. He is a market vendor. He is selling clothing for kids, like socks, in the local market. In spite of his young age, Sahdullo is a rather experienced businessman. He knows what goods to choose and what prices are the most attractive for his clients.
Sahdullo has just married and he is working even harder to support his young family and make savings for their future life. Now Sahdullo needs to increase the working capital in to enlarge his range of goods. With this purpose, Sahdullo requests $950.00 for the term of 6 months. This is the first loan for Sahdullo, and he promises to repay it promptly, and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: To increase capital and enlarge the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. Chen S., 45, is married with four children and works selling Khmer food in her village. She earns less than $1 a day of profit. Her husband owns a plot of farmland growing rice. He makes approximately $1 a day of profit. This couple requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow to assist in farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to assist in farm work.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
N. Mahbuba is 44 years old. She is raising three children alone. Seven years ago, after she had lost her husband, Mahbuba found herself in a situation where she had to support her large family by herself. She tried to find a job, but was not successful. Then she decided to sell old clothing of her neighbors. She barely made both ends meet. 
At this point Mahbuba decided to take her fist loan from the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON. The loan provided by IMON helped Mahbuba find her source of stable income. She is selling socks in the local market. 
Working hard, she managed to make her business profitable and generae sufficient income to support her family. Today, Mahbuba is planning to increase the working capital with the purpose of further development of the business. With this purpose, she requests $950.00 for the term of 6 months. She proved reliable with her last loan from IMLF IMON. And now Mahbuba thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To increase her working capital, to develop the business and increase the level of income.

loans.name: Barohat

texts.en:
R. Barohat is 42 years old. She is married with two children. Barohat is a market vendor. She and her husband sell clothing for teenagers in the local market. Barohat travels to the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan to purchase goods to sell. In the meantime, her husband helps with the sales in the market. 
In general the business is stable and has a strong trend for further development. However, Barohat stresses that after loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON she managed to accelerate the development of her business considerably. With one of the loans, Barohat purchased one more trading place in the market. 
Today she is planning to increase the working capital to expand her business. She requests $950.00 for the term of 6 months. Barohat promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she did all the previous ones, and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To increase the turnover capital with the purpose of developing the business.

loans.name: Lou

texts.en: Mrs. Lou C., age 45, is a widow with six children and works selling porridge. On average, she makes around $2.5o a day of profit. One of her children is a police man and one other is a teacher. The rest  are students.To raise the family’s income she requests a loan from Kiva for raising pigs.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to raising pigs.

loans.name: Chahbar

texts.en:
C. Chahbar is 35 years old. Though educated as a teacher, Chahbar is running his private farm. Mainly he is growing crops such as potatoes, onions, and rice. At the same time he is fattening cows and calves for sales. Chahbar manages his farm successfully. He generates sufficient income to support the family. Now, at the beginning of the season of planting, Chahbar is planning to plant potato and onion.

At the same time, he needs additional funds for purchasing cattle for fattening. With this purpose Chahbar requests $1000.00 for the term of 12 months. Chahbar has already had a loan by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, and proved himself an honest client. He promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and also fertilizer.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. He is married and has one daughter who is five months old. He is living with his parents in the same house. He has a computer shop and he applied to get $1200 to purchase new computer supplies. He also wants to make new shelves, paint the shop, and make advertising to increase his income and save for a better life for his small family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new computer supplies

loans.name: Ab

texts.en:
Mrs. Ab S., age 27, is a mother of one small child and works selling souvenirs at the Bayon temple, earning around $5 in revenue a day. Her husband works making traditional musical instruments. Normally he earns about $7 a day in revenue. Their child is too young to attend school.
Mrs Ab S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase more souvenirs to sell at the Bayon temple. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Ab S. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs to sell at  the Bayon temple.

loans.name: Hea

texts.en: Mrs. Hea S., 43, is a mother of four children and works as a housewife staying at home looking after the children and cooking food for the family members. Her husband Mr. Kong Kan, age 50, is a cow broker in the village, earning around $10 a day in revenue. One of their children is a construction worker and the rest are students. To expand the cow business, Mr Kan needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more cows for resell when the price is high.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for resale when the price is high.

loans.name: Chrok

texts.en: Mrs. Chrok C., age 31, is a mother of four children and works selling Khmer cake, which is made from banana, earning around $1.50 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Chon Nith, 38, owns a plot of farmland growing rice normally, making around $2.50 a day. To make the crops grow faster he needs a  loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizers to put on his farm and the leftover will be used to buy wood to install in his house. (Mr. Chon Nith is pictured because Mrs. Chrok C. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and renovate the house.

loans.name: Khamrooi

texts.en:
L. Khamrooi is 50 years old. She and her husband raised 5 children. Khamrooi started her entrepreneur activities in 1997. She used to travel to the neighboring city Uzbekistan to purchase goods for selling. Now Khamrooi has a wide range of goods. And now she is also selling fabrics for sewing national dresses, as well as shoes and houseware goods.

Except for this, Khamrooi, with her family, is working on her farm as long as they have 3 hectares (about 7 acres) of land. She is producing tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, and other melons and grounds. The active work of Khamrooi allows her to contribute significantly to the family budget.

Now Khamrooi requests $800.00 for the term of 12 months. She is to spend the loan to purchase of niter (fertilizer) required for planting crops. Khamrooi has had a loan by IMLF IMON and has proved herself a reliable client, and she promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all for the support.

loans.use: Purchase niter for planting.

loans.name: Sea

texts.en: Mrs. Sea M., age 51, lives with her husband and eight children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She stays at home, looks after the children and cooks food for her entire family. Her husband works as a motorbike mechanic, earning around $3 a day of profit. One of their children works at a hotel in Siem Reap province with a salary $180 a month.  To increase the growth of the mechanic business, the family must purchase additional mechanic tools. This loan will help them to increase the income of their family and which will help finance their younger children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional mechanic tools.

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Mrs. Ngov S., age 33, is a mother of three children and works selling fish, earning around $10 a day in revenue. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes about $3 a day. This couple needs a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to ship fish from the river to the market. This will reduce their expenses and allow the family saves forthe future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to ship fish from the river to the market.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S., age 26, lives with her husband and works as a housekeeper at the Hotel Angkor with a salary of $90 a month. Her husband is a car mechanic. Normally he earns around $3 a day. They have no children but they live with two younger brothers. This couple would like to borrow from Kiva to purchase wood to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair their house.

loans.name: Miyassar

texts.en:
M. Miyassar is 43 years old. She is married with five children. Miyassar has been an entrepreneur already for fifteen years. She started by selling chinaware. She used to travel to the neighboring country Uzbekistan to sell her goods. However, After the borders closed, it became complicated to cross the border without a visa.

Miyassar changed her business, and concentrated on the fattening of the cows and the calves. Miyassar believes that the current business is more profitable, and allows her to help her husband support their large family.

Today Miyassar needs additional funds for purchasing cattle. She requests $775.00 for the term of 12 months. Miyassar is a repeat client for the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, and has already proven herself a reliable client. She promises to repay the current loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing  cattle for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Touch Thy, 48, earns $2.50 per day as a grocer and farmer. Her husband, Mr. Nov M., is also a farmer and makes $1.25 per day. They live with their 8 children in Banteaydey Krom Village, Pursat Province. Four of their children are married. One is a farmer and grocer, and another makes marble statues. M. requests a loan of $600 to purchase marble for his children to carve and sell statues. He hopes this loan will help increase his family’s income. The photo is of his children because Mrs. Touch Thy and Mr. Nov M. were not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase marble for his children to carve and sell statues

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en: Mrs. Chhet K., 45, is a widow who lives with her son in Preah Mlou Village, Pursat Province. She earns $2 per day selling beef at the village market. K. requests a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike so she can transport beef to the market more easily than before. She feels this investment will improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike so she can transport beef to the market more easily than before

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan P., age 53, is a mother of seven children, five of whom still live at home.  She stays at home, looks after the children and cooks for the family members. Her husband, Mr. Chem Chin, age 54, owns a plot of land growing rice and also raising buffalos, normally earning around $1 a day of profit.
Mrs. Kan P., who wants to make an income for the family, is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries to sell. With the remainder, she wants to hire a plot of farmland and grow yams to add more profits. This will allow the family to establish  good living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell and hiring a plot of farmland to grow yams.

loans.name: Nea

texts.en: Mrs. Nea S., age 26, is married with two children and works on her field as a farmer. On average, she makes about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kon Saroeun, 31, has business milling rice for the local farmers. With his rice grinding mill he takes the husks off the rice. In revenue, he earns $10 a day. The couple have 2 children, one is a student and the other is too young to attend school. This couple has applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to assist on their field. They will also rent it to the local villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to assist on the farmland.

loans.name: Nea

texts.en: Mrs. Nea S., age 26, is married with two children and works on her field as a farmer. On average, she makes about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kon Saroeun, 31, has business milling rice for the local farmers with his rice grinding mill to take the husks off the rice. In revenue, he earns $10 a day. Children, one is a student and one other is too young to attend school. This couple has applies for a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to assist on their field. They also hire it to the local villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to assist on the farmland.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mr. Kim D., 66, lives with his wife Lim Heang and their 6 children in Bak Rotes Village, Pursat Province. He earns $10 per day as a house construction foreman. D. also has a side business raising fish. His children have finished studying and help him raise fish. D. requests a $1,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle and more fish for his business. With a motorcycle, D. will be able to transport and sell fish more efficiently at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and more fish for his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is an internally displaced person (IDP). He started working as electrician assistant when he was 17 years old. When he started working on his own, he understood that there’s a big need for education in this field because you can’t learn only in practice. So he got his professional education as an electrician from Baku Technical Profession School in 2000. Now he has his own chain of clients who feel happy when they leave his garage because they know that they won’t be going back there for a long time. He needs this loan to change his tools and purchase materials.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Mr. Pum T., age 43, has business to raise the family’s income as a motor-taxi driver around the market in his village. Normally he earns around $3 a day of profit. His wife, Mrs. Soeun Eith, 39, supports the family as a farmer and grows rice which makes on average about $1 a day. They have six children. To make the family earn more incomes Mrs. Soeun Eith would like to request a loan from Kiva to establish a new business by purchasing groceries to sell in front of her house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell in front of her house.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Mrs. Vong S. is a 45-year-old grocer and rice farmer who lives with her husband and 8 children in Sala Komrou Village, Pursat Province. One of their children is still in school, while the others have completed their studies. S. earns $5 per day and her husband Sim Cheoun also makes $5 per day as a construction foreman. She requests a $500 loan to increase her grocery stock, as well as to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice crop.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock, as well as to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice crop

loans.name: Balyelesa Development Group

texts.en: Clement, age 49, is the chairperson of the Balyelesa Development Group in Mukono. She is married with 7 children, as well as caring for 6 other relatives. She has 3 businesses; she is a farmer growing maize and beans both for sale and home consumption, she makes yogurt, and she has sold milk for over 10 years. She has been able to succeed, especially with the help of her kids at home. She needs a loan to help with her yogurt business, since she intends to get packages with her own label for more sales. She sells the yogurt mainly to the nearby shops and schools, but with the new label, she intends to sell to supermarkets.

loans.use: Clement needs a loan to help with her yogurt business by buying packages with her own label for more sales.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguon S., age 46, lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of farmland growing rice which makes $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kean Ky, 48, works as a blacksmith in Phnom Penh city. One child is a motor mechanic, making around $2 a day. Another child works as a garment worker with a salary $80 a month. The rest  are students.
To increase the growth of the motor mechanic business, the family must purchase  additional mechanic tools. This loan will help them to increase the income of their family and which will help finance their younger children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase an additional mechanic tools (motor).

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan has a retail shop in Mukono, her home area; she is a farmer and has a piggery business at home. She is 39 years old and married with 5 children, while she cares for 4 grandchildren. She needs a loan to help with the expansion of her shop by buying sugar, salt, bathing and washing soap, and bread; and when I asked her about the expansion of the piggery, she said she uses the savings from the shop for that, and this is really good business. Suzan is really lucky because she works together with her husband.

loans.use: Suzan needs a loan to help with the expansion of her shop by buying sugar, salt, bathing and washing soap, and bread.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San N., 34, supports the family’s income as a rice dealer. She makes about $4 a day of income. Her husband Mr. Son Song, age 35, works as a logger, normally earning around $5 a day. They have four children, two of whom are students and two others who are too young to attend the school.
This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice to gain more income to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice to gain more income to support the family.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat P. is a 63-year-old widow who lives in Rom Lech Village in Kampong Cham Province. She earns $1.50 per day planting dry season rice and growing soybeans. Five of her seven children are married. One daughter is a garment weaver in Phnom Penh, while another is a worker harvesting tobacco in Kampong Cham Province. P. requests a loan of $250 to rent plots of land for her soybean crop, as well as to purchase seeds for planting. She hopes this loan will improve her finances and expand her business. The photo is of Mrs. Sat P. and her daughter.

loans.use: To rent plots of land for her soybean crop, as well as to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: At 24 years old, Godfrey is married with 2 kids and helps to care for his sister’s son. He is a farmer, growing mostly maize, groundnuts, and cassava, and on top of that he has a retail shop in Mukono. His wife is a stay-at-home mother, as the husband toils, but this is no threat to Godfrey since he wants his kids to enjoy their mother’s love to the fullest. He has been getting loans for 1 1/2 years now, and they have really been helpful, especially with the expansion of his shop. He needs a loan now to include a third business of brick laying, and the loan will cater to the manpower needed and later to buying firewood. With this loan, nothing can stop him from achieving his dream.

loans.use: Godfrey needs a loan for brick laying, and the money will cater to the manpower, rent, and water, and later to buying firewood for burning the bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase hair chemicals, weaves & braids

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In T., age 71, is an old man who lives with his wife, age 77 at home and make no income. They have three children, two of whom are farmers and one other who has a business fishing for a living.
To improve the fishing business, the family must purchase more fishing tools like nets and so on. This will allow the son to catch more fish to sustain the family’s income. (Mr. In T. is pictured on the right hand side, his son, the fisherman, is in the middle and the woman on the left  is his daughter)

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools like nets and so on.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a very hard-working widow with 6 children and 2 dependents. She is 51 years old and sells charcoal, firewood, and dry fish from her home, where she conducts her 8-month-old business. She only changed businesses from piggery after her pigs fell sick and died without proper medication, but with this loan, she intends to reintroduce it in her business, after attaining proper training; she has high hopes that such a disaster will not occur again.

loans.use: With this loan, Christine intends to buy pigs and their feed, as an addition to her charcoal, firewood, and dry-fish businesses, in order to increase her savings.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em S., 34, is a mother of four children who lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To sustain the family’s income, she owns a plot of farmland growing rice. Normally she earns less than $1 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. San Chomreun, age 38, is a chief construction worker building houses, making about $7 a day.  One of their children works at the construction site at a salary of $50 a month. Mr San Chomreun  has applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to assist with his construction work.

loans.use: To purchase wood to assist with his construction work.

loans.name: Preng

texts.en: Mrs. Preng V., 29, and her husband Chap Samoeun are goldsmiths from Takoy Village in Battambang Province. V. earns $5 per day and Samoeun earns about $10 per day. They have two children, both of whom are students. V. seeks a $1,100 loan to purchase gold to create jewelry. With this loan she hopes to both expand her business and continue to provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase gold to create jewelry and to sell to customers more efficiently

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Mityana Group

texts.en: Mary is the chairperson of Zibula Atudde Women’s Group, which meets every Tuesday in Mityana. The group has been together for 5 1/2 years, getting loans every 4 months, and they have always been prompt with the repayments. Mary has a shop selling second-hand bed sheets that she buys from Kampala, about 60 kilometers from Mityana, and she has been doing this for 30 years. She is 54 years old and married with 12 children, while she caters to 6 school-going grandchildren. Her husband is a retired medical assistant; therefore, all the responsibility is on her, and this is the reason she is so hardworking.

loans.use: Mary has planned to buy more bed sheets for her shop in Mityana, as well as use part of it to complete payment of school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.name: San
