texts.en: Mrs. San H., age 53, is a widow who lives with her eight children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, She works on her farmland growing rice and generally earns around $1 a day. One of her children is married. Two children are employed as garment workers with a salary $75 each a month and one other son is a motor-taxi driver, making about $3 to $4 a day of profit. The rest stay at home and help her with farming. Now Mrs. San H., is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive as a business to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive as a business.

loans.name: Kosimova

texts.ru:
M. Kosimova is 35 years old, is married and has 2 children. M. and her husband have a bakery in their home where they make flatbread. M. sells the flatbread at the market. Her flatbread is in high demand at the market and 8 people currently work in her bakery. M. has been a client since May of 2007. She felt that taking out her first loan would increase her sales and product assortment. She plans to us her next loan to open an additional sales point to sell her products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимова Муаззам возрост 35 лет , замужем имеет 2 детей .Она со своим мужем на дому имеет хлебопекарный цех, по выпечке лепешек. Сама Муаззам продает на базаре лепешки. Ее лепешки имеют хороший спрос на рынке.У нее в цеху сейчас работает 8 человек.Муаззам кредитуется с мая 2007 года.Она почувсвовала что взяв первый кредит у нее увеличился оборот,и ассортимент.В дальнейшем она планирует взяв следующий займ открыть ще одну точку реализации своей продукции.

loans.use: Make and sell flatbread

loans.name: Atim Irene's Group

texts.en: Irene is a petite 26-year-old married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4, and she helps to look after her sick mother. She is a medical officer, having worked in a hospital in Mityana, but now she has a clinic and has been self-employed for 3 years now. She needs a loan to enable her to buy more drugs for the clinic, like Panadol, Fansidar, Coartem, and syrups, so that she can increase her savings. Her dream is to see her clinic grow into a maternity home to save the village mothers the burden of trekking long distances from Semuti, her village, to Mityana.

loans.use: Irene needs a loan to enable her to buy more drugs for her clinic, like Panadol, Fansidar, Coartem, and syrups, so that she can increase her savings.

loans.name: Semuti Development Group

texts.en: Ever since Annet lost her husband some years ago, life has really changed. Being the sole bread winner for her 7 children and now 2 grandchildren, Annet believes working hard is the only solution, and she is not regretting the effort. She has a 12-year-old hardware shop in Semuti, Mityana, has 7 cows at home that provide milk both for sale and home consumption, and has had a piggery for 9 years. She is grateful for the loans she has received, since she started from nowhere and now she is somewhere. Annet is 60 years old and a member of the Semuti Development Group. In all her businesses, she works with her children, who will take over while she is away.

loans.use: Annet has planned to expand her hardware shop by buying cement, barbed wire, lime, and iron sheets for the shop.

loans.name: Faga 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 9 women of Faga 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business's development and help each other guarantee on-time payments. Aiulu T. (33, married, 4 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a knife, an axe and a knife filing in order to increase production of taro and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet. Her husband does the farming. She sells the produce once a week at the Salelologa market.

Vaivao L. (54, divorced, 7 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a bush knife, an axe, a knife filing, a mixing bucket and rubber gloves in order to increase production of taro. Her children help her with the planting.

Vaelua I. (76, married, 7 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a can and a wheelbarrow in order to help her and her husband farm taro.

Faalogoifo S. (43, married, 4 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a bush knife and a filing in order to expand her taro business.

Kuka T. (31, married, 3 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, bush knife, wire, pesticides and knife filing in order to increase her production of taro.

Elena L. (25, married, 2 children): purchase a sewing machine, weed-killing sprayer, pesticides and a mixing bucket. She will use the new equipment to raise taro and make puletasis (dresses) and T-shirts.

Tala S. (25, single, no children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a spade, a bush knife, an axe and a knife filing. Her brothers do the farming and she sells the taro once a week.

Molly T. (35, married, 4 children): purchase a stove, oil, kerosene, pots, salt, plastic bags and bananas. She is starting a banana chip business. She will sell the banana chips 6 days per week.

Tagi A. (23, married, 1 child): purchase a weed-killing machine, barbed wire, pesticides, 2 bush knives and knife filing in order to increase her taro-selling business.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, knives, etc…

loans.name: Taga 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 6 women of Taga 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faasee S., 56, is married to a farmer and has 4 children. Elisapeta I., 26, is married with 2 children. With their loans, they will purchase 2 weed killing sprayers, pesticides, 2 bush knives, an axe, a knife filing and a wheel barrow to support their year-old vegetable businesses. On their plantation, both of their husbands farm taro, bananas and yams, staples of the Samoan diet.

Mafutaga T., 34, is married with 4 children. She wishes to produce cream buns and sell them at her food stall in Taga. Her husband is a good baker. With her loan, she will purchase flour, sugar, oil, yeast, baking pans and other ingredients. Her main customers are school children and the village people.

Luaipou I., 29, is married with 4 children. Her husband is a plantation farmer. She plans to sell a wide variety of produce: cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, etc. to village people, the public and passing traffic. She will use her loan to purchase cabbage seeds, a hose and laborers.

Tapaga L., 35, is married with 5 children. Her business is selling coconuts. The bulk of her loan will be used for delivery costs, the costs of labor and food for the laborers. Additionally, she will purchase a wheel barrow. She will sell coconuts 6 days a week at affordable prices.

Meli F., 52, is married to a farmer and has 3 children. She is in the business of both selling produce (taro, bananas, etc.) and raising chickens. Her loan will allow her to purchase a weed killing sprayer, a knife, pesticides, filing and laborers.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, knives, etc…

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca was born and raised in the Ochocienta community of Santo Domingo. She is a very active and responsible woman. Francisca lives with her husband and a son.

Francisca sells shoes, slippers, and tennis shoes to men and women of her community in order to supplement the family’s revenue. “’Sell, sell and sell’ is my motto”, she says as she explains that her goal is to maximize her profits and improve her family’s lifestyle. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy customer-recommended products and new styles of shoes so as to attract more people to her business.

Francisca’s group members are: Merys F. J., borrowing for her small clothing store; Lidia C. F., borrowing to purchase beauty products for a hair salon; Cristobalina Q. M., borrowing to expand her pants and shirts trade; and Marilin C. M., borrowing for her fried vegetables business.

(In the picture, from left to the right: Lidia, Francisca, Merys, Marilin and Cristobalina)

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and slippers for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena runs a small grocery store in a busy market near the main bus station in Simferopol, Ukraine. She sells a wide variety of dry goods, including canned foods, vegetable oil, pasta, seasonings, tea and coffee, to a long list of customers.

Elena has been in this business for about four years. She went to school, trained to be a merchant and is hard-working and determined to succeed as an entrepreneur. She is also married and has three children in their twenties. One of Elena’s goals is to be able to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions.

Elena has requested a loan of $500 to buy additional dry goods such as sugar that are sold by weight. She is concerned that prices will go up soon and would like to buy in bulk now, when prices are lower. The loan will help Elena increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy additional products that are sold by weight

loans.name: Sili 2 Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
For these 10 women of Sili 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faanimo Tuua (43, married, 5 children) for puletasi (dress) and t-shirt business: sewing machine, thread and material.

Loketi A. (45, married, 4 children) for fish and chips business: a stove, a fryer, oil, a sack of potatoes, 2 pots and tongs.

The following women will use their loans to purchase the below items for their taro plantations:

Leu F. (56, married, 4 children): 10 laborers, 4 knives, 2 knife filings, 3,000 taro roots and pesticides.

Paepae M. (28, married, 4 children): 2 knives, filing, wheel barrow, spade, axe and 1,000 taro roots.

Pelepesite Tafu (45, married, 8 children): knife, filing, 2,500 taro roots and laborers.

Siaana Tsang Y. (29, married, 3 children): 3 bush knives, 3 filings, 3 laborers, 3,000 taro roots, wire and a spade.

Lufi Leuelu F. (43, married, 5 children): 5 bush knives, 5 filings, 5 workers, 2,000 taro roots and a spade.

Tufaina F. (45, married, 6 children):2 knives, an axe, a filing, a spade, weed killing sprayer and 7 workers. She also produces bananas.

Matavai T. (44, married, 5 children): 2 bush knives, 2 filings, a spade, an axe, 5 workers and 3,000 taro roots.

Foloi F. (36, married, 3 children): 4 knives, 4 filings, 4 spades, 6 workers, 2 boots, 1,500 taro roots.

loans.use: Purchase knives, laborers, filings, taro roots, etc.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a busy entrepreneur who lives in the southern Ukranian city of Simferopol on the beautiful Crimean peninsula. He owns a taxi company and also offers luggage delivery services in Simferopol and surrounding areas.

Business is good because Simferopol is a major crossroads, with many thousands of tourists passing through each year on their way to resorts near the Black Sea. Transportation companies such as Salim’s stay busy helping people get around. Salim has been in business for about four years and loves driving and talking to his passengers. He is married and has two sons in their early 20s and a daughter who is 19.

Salim has requested a loan of $500 to help pay for the registration of five additional taxis for his company. This loan will help him expand his business and increase his income. One of Salim’s goals is to buy a home for his family. We are happy to have this opportunity to help him with his business and provide a better life for himself, his wife and his children.

loans.use: To pay the cost of registering five new taxis

loans.name: Maltina's Group

texts.en:
Maltina is a hard-working woman and mother of a thirteen-year-old boy, her only child. She lives in the Ochocienta community of Santo Domingo. Her husband is a police officer.

Maltina owns and operates a beauty parlor out of her house. The entrepreneur offers such services as nail trimming, nail polishing, hair cuts, hair coloring, and the like. She also sells a collection of beauty products to her customers. Maltina is requesting a loan which could allow her enlarge her business. She will buy an assortment of new products and some materials for her beauty parlor. Maltina hopes that her business will grow to the point where she’ll have to hire one or two girls to help her offer better and faster service to her customers.

Maltina’s group members are: Mercedes Liranza, who is borrowing to buy a small freezer to keep producing ice cream and gelatin treats; Celeste M. G., to buy clothing in bulk; Josefina Jacqueline F. M., to expand her business of selling fresh chicken meat; and Aneisy S. R., to buy cleaning materials for re-sale.

(In the picture appear from the left to the right: Maltina, Celeste, Josefina, Mercedes and Aneisy.)

loans.use: To buy a collection of products and materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Iva B Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 6 women of Iva B on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

The women will use their loans to purchase the below items for their taro plantations:

Fiapule M. (43, married, 4 children): weed killing sprayer, pesticides, bush knife, spade and shovel. She also produces bananas and makes fine mats.

Ruta H. (27, married, 3 children): weed killing sprayer, fertilizer, pesticides, bush knife, spade and shovel.

Magalelei O. (43, married, 8 children): fishing boat, flashlight, pesticides, bush knives and a spade. She also sells fish that her husband catches.

Ana G. (59, married, 6 children): weed killing sprayer, pesticides, knife, filing and 2,000 taro roots.

Soloau S. (35, married, 4 children): wire, spade, pesticides and fertilizer. She also raises cattle.

Sesilia L. (55, widowed, 6 children): weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 3 bush knives and a shovel.

loans.use: Purchase weed killing sprayer, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Saasaai 1 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 12 women of Saasaai 1 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business's development and help each other guarantee on-time payments.

Tuliloaina May G. (36, married, 3 children): to grow taro, bananas and tuamu, she needs weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knife filings, 2 bush knives, fertilizer and laborers.

Legogo E. (20, married, no children): to start a cattle farm, 2 cows and 2 ropes.

Siiae V. (58, married, 8 children): for her retail shop: canned herring, rice, milk, chicken, sugar, flour and noodles.

Sina S. (24, married, 2 children): to sell BBQ plates: boxes of chicken, soy sauce, onions, Chinese onions, bananas, plates and other items.

Sina E. (45, married, 5 children): to grow taro, bananas, tuamu and raise cows: 1 cow, 2 ropes, a knife, a knife filing, a spade and pesticides.

Aitasi S. (29, married): to sell pancakes: flour, oil, sugar, soda, baking powder and a fryer.

Vaaipu Sageli T. (39, married, 4 children): to grow taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knives, 2 filings and 5 laborers.

Faisealofa F. (50, married, 5 children): to grow taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a filing, a knife and boots.

Ivapene S. (43, married, 7 children): to sell BBQ plates: wires, 2 pots, a box of chicken, sausages, tomato sauce and other ingredients.

Eseta F. (51, married, 7 children): to sell taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, knife filing and 2,000 taro roots.

Sina F. (28, married) to sell taro, bananas and tuamu: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knives, a filing, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and an axe.

Leone F. (55, married, 7 children) to sell cabbages, beans, cucumbers, etc.: weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, filing, axe and 2 spades.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Isoboeva

texts.ru:
M. Isoboeva who is 27 years old, is married and is a mother of two children. She is in the retail business of selling fabrics for curtains. She has secondary education and was not able to study at the university because her family could not afford it and she had to start earning money since she was very young. Her husband is her only support in this business. She began taking out loans in 2003 and proved to be as a brave, punctual and a very responsible client of MicroInvest. She had $200 in assets when she took out her first loan and which have now increased up to $550. In the future she plans to sell wholesale and improve her vendor space.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исобоева Мавлюда- 27 лет. Замужем ,мать двоих детей .Занимается торговлей тканями для штор Образование среднее так как уровень жизни в семье не позволяла ей учиться в университете а зарабатывать на жизненные расходы уже с детства. Опорой в сфере торговли является ее единственная опора ее муж. Начала кредитоваться с 2003-го года и за это время проявила себя как мужественная, пунктуальная и очень ответственная клиентка «Микроинвест». Начала кредитоваться с активами на 200$ а сейчас они достигают 550$.В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу и улучшить место торговли.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Mamadalieva

texts.ru:
F. Mamadalieva who is 37 years old, is married and has two children. She has secondary education and sews and sells national Tajik dresses. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to find work so she now has the responsibility of the only caretaker in her family. She has a very big experience in this field because she has loved sewing since she was very young and it has been the main source of income for her family. F. started taking out loans at MicroInvest in 2005 and step by step began to purchase materials wholesale and make European clothing. In the future she plans to open a sewing shop and hire more employees.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мамадалиева Фируза- 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей . Образование среднее. Занимается шитьем и продажей национальных платьев. Муж находится в РФ на заработки, поэтому все заботы о семье лежат на ее плечах. Имеет большой опыт в этой сфере, поскольку с детства любила шитье, и это являлась основным источником дохода семьи. Стала кредитором МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2005-ом году и постепенно после шагового кредитования начала закупать оптом материалы и шить европейскую одежду. В будущем планирует открыть цех и увеличить количество сотрудников.

loans.use: Open a sewing shop and hire employees

loans.name: Mamadalieva

texts.ru: Мамадалиева Фируза- 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей . Образование среднее. Занимается шитьем и продажей национальных платьев. Муж находится в РФ на заработки, поэтому все заботы о семье лежат на ее плечах. Имеет большой опыт в этой сфере, поскольку с детства любила шитье, и это являлась основным источником дохода семьи. Стала кредитором  МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2005-ом году и постепенно после шагового кредитования начала закупать оптом материалы и шить европейскую одежду. В будущем планирует открыть цех и увеличить количество сотрудников.

loans.use: открыть цех и увеличить количество сотрудников

loans.name: Mansurova

texts.ru:
M. Mansurova who is 42 years old, is married and has four children. She has secondary education and is in the retail business of selling threads for sewing. She has more than nineteen years of experience in this field.

She became a client of Microinvest in 2006 with $800 in assets. This program has allowed her to purchase inventory in cash which has increased her sales and of course her profits. In the future, M. plans to start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мансурова Мавлюда – 42 года, замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Образование среднее, занимается торговлей нитями для шитья. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 19 лет.

Стала клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест в 2006-ом году с активами на 800 долларов. Продукт программы позволил ей приобрести товар за наличные что способствует увеличению товарооборота и конечно же дохода. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: To start selling wholesale

loans.name: Mahkamova

texts.ru:
H. Mahkamova is 49 years old, married and is a happy mother of four children. She has secondary education. Her husband is physically not capable to feed the entire family and this is why H. started her retail business selling groceries and food to sustain the quality of life of their family. Before she knew of Microinvest she took out loans from local illegal organizations which charged her high interest and fees and this did not allow her to make any profits. Now she buys inventory with cash and plans to start selling wholesale soon.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махкамова Хабиба- 49 лет. Замужем, счастливая мать 4-х детей. Образование среднее. Муж физически не в состоянии прокормить свою семью и поэтому Хабиба начала заниматься торговлей продуктами питания для поддержания уровня жизни семьи. До кредитования в МЗФ она брала кредит у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие процентные ставки, что не позволял автоматически увеличить доход. Теперь она покупает товар за наличные и скоро планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Start selling wholesale and improve vendor space

loans.name: Firdos' Group

texts.en: Firdos I. lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan, and is married with three sons and two daughters.  All of her children attend school except the eldest boy, who works at an ice-cream factory, and the eldest girl, who withdrew from school due to a lack of interest in studies. Her husband runs a restaurant and wants to expand it.  Group members who will share in the loan are: Zakia B., who runs a toy shop; Rukkiah B., who is borrowing for her family’s CD and DVD shop; Saima B., who is acquiring a loan to buy a donkey cart; and Maqsooda B., who sells ready-made garments.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,275.00.

loans.use: To expand the family restaurant.

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
My name is Khadija S.. I was married 25 years ago and reside with my family in Lahore, Pakistan, where I am the mother of seven: six boys and one girl. My husband is a turner and I sew pants, for which I receive $1 for every twelve pants I stitch. I would now like to get more orders for stitching and require a loan to buy some items for this purpose.

My group members are: Parween B., who sews clothes; Shaheen B., whose husband operates a snacks stall; Shahida, who knits wool items, and Balqees B., who will use her share of the loan to expand the family’s grocery store. All these women are hardworking entrepreneurs, and I want them to prosper in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase some items for the stitching business.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zahida P., and I have lived all my life in Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: three boys and two girls. Both of my daughters are married, and the boys are currently working. Unfortunately, I could not educate my children due to our impoverished conditions. I cut almost 100 bags daily out of cloth on order from a factory, which then stitches them on machines. My husband drives a horse cart, a popular means of transport here in Pakistan, but he sold his horse for our daughter’s marriage; we now need a loan to buy a new horse.

The women in my group who will share in the loan are: Sajida B., who sews bags; Rubina H., who will pay off the remaining installment for her business; P. Q., who intends to expand the family plastic pipes manufacturing business, and Fazeelat B., whose husband sells fruits.

loans.use: To purchase a new horse.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is a successful trader who sells rice, sugar, and gari. She is married to a headmaster and has two children with him. She wishes to increase sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42023

loans.name: Sarwer's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sarwer B.. I am married and a mother of six: five boys and one girl. All attend school except for my daughter, who is not yet of school age. I embed sequins on shawls ordered from various traders, and my husband is a rickshaw driver. To supplement our household income, we also have a floor grinding machine which we rent out. We now plan to buy an additional grinding machine that will enable us to save for our children’s higher education, but we require a loan to make this purchase.

The other women who have joined me in my loan group are: Rehana Bibin, whose family has an iron business; Ayesha B., who will use her share of the loan to pay off the remaining installments of her family’s rickshaw, and Saira B., who is borrowing for her window glass sales.

loans.use: To purchase an additional floor grinding machine

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana O. sells gari in large quantities and then distributes them to her customers. She also prepares food for sale. Her husband sells traditional clothes. Business is good but she lacks enough capital to produce food in large quantity.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to purchase more stock to meet her rising customer needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to meet rising customer demand

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42025

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina N. sells stationery and cosmetics. She is married and has no children. Business is going very well and she plans to increase sales, which will improve her income and enable her to support her family.

She is asking for $225.00 as additional capital to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery and cosmetics to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42026

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
I am Nazia N. from Lahore, Pakistan. I have four children: two boys and two girls, all of whom attend school with the exception of my youngest son, who is a year old. I embed sequins on shawls, and my husband supplies medicines to various pharmacies in the city. We need a loan to buy additional medicines in large quantities.

The group members who will share in the loan are: Bano S., who embroiders clothes; Halima B., who wants to buy a horse; Kishwer’s husband, who is a welder, and Razia B.’s husband, who trades in used items.

loans.use: To buy medicines in large quantities.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. sells rice and mineral water. Her husband is a Lotto agent and they have three children. She wishes to expand her business to generate more income and help support the family.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42028

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
I am Asha M.. I was married 19 years ago and have four children: two boys and two girls. All of them attend school except for my eldest daughter, who works at a beauty salon. My deepest wish is for my children to finish school and prosper in life. My husband creates beautiful dresses for women, which he sells at his ready-made garments store, and I request a loan to enable him to expand the store.

This loan will be shared amongst my group, consisting of: Maya B., who needs a loan for her family’s used items business; Shabana A., who is also borrowing for her ready-made garments trade; Rukhsana Y., who sells cloth, and Najma A.’s son, who has a motorcycle repair workshop.

loans.use: To expand my husband's ready-made garments business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a trader. She sells alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. She is married and has one child. She wants to increase sales to meet her rising costumer needs.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more stock to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42030

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more stock for sale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is a baker--baking and selling bread. She is married and has five dependents. Demand for her bread has increased but she lacks enough funds to expand.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more raw materials for bread production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for bread production

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42032

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita Y. is a trader who sells provisions like Milo, milk, sugar, rice, and other items. She is married to a commercial driver and has two children. She wishes to expand her business but lacks enough funds.

She is asking for $225.00 as additional capital to purchase more stock for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 42033

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu J. is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  He sells goat meat in the market and, in the evening, his wife sells roasted goat meat in one of the night clubs. The couple work hard to improve their living status. Amadu would like to increase his business and would like a loan of Le.3, 000,000 to purchase a number of goats for the meat and to raise some for the future.

loans.use: To build his supply of fresh meat and purchase goats for future use

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a teacher and is earning less than $100 a month. Adama’s business income supplements her husband's. With her previous loan, she started a small restaurant in the own of Kabala in Sierra Leone and, at the same time, she manages a small grocery kiosk in the house. Adama would like to expand her restaurant and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000.

Adama works hard to manage both a restaurant and a small grocery shop. She would like a small loan to help expand her restaurant business so she can meet the demans of her hungry customers.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 33 years old and married with 3 children. Fatmata owns a small grocery store and needs to purchase a variety of different items to attract new customers. Her business is the main source of income for the family because her husband is unemployed.

With her previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), she expanded her business, and her income also increased. This enabled her meet most of the family expenses. She is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to increase her grocery stock.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is 22 years and married with a child. Amadu is a new husband and father who needs additional business capital to begin building their family business. He sells African cotton clothes in Kabala market.

With his previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Amadu increased his stock and has involved his wife to manage the business in the homestead. The couple would like to build a stable family life and Amadu is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand his clothing business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 22 years old and married with a child. A school drop out, he takes care of his mother and two brothers. Ibrahim wants to put his brothers through college and needs to grow his business to do so.

Ibrahim sells clothes in the town, and with a previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), he increased his stock and income. His dream is to educate his two brothers to a college level. He would like a loan of Le.2,000,000 to be able to purchase the goods from the Republic of Guinea, where it is cheaper.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 28 years old and married with 3 children.  Her husband is a teacher and earns less than $100 a month. Fatu’s income plays a crucial role in meeting family expenses. Fatu would like to expand her market stall of vegetables and food items. She needs additional business capital to do so and hopes that Kiva can help her to build her business.  She would like to expand the business and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable stall

loans.name: Poreh

texts.en: Poreh sells fresh fish in the town of Kabala.  At 27 years old, she is married with 3 children.  Her husband is a police officer whose income is insufficient to meet the family expenses.  To sell more fish to her demanding customers, Poreh would like to increase her stock and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000. She wants to earn additional income and expand her fish mongering business for the purpose of providing for her children's education. Her future plan is to have the best education for her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fish

loans.name: Sunkari

texts.en: Sunkari is 26 years old and married with two children.  Her husband is also a small trader and both are working hard to meet family expenses.  Sunkari sells rice and beans in the street of Kabala town.  The location of the business is inappropriate. To help ease Sunkari's burden and boost her business revenue, she needs to rent a stall in the main market and increase her selection of food items for sale. To do that, she needs to increase her stock to earn income that can enable her to pay the rent and also earn a profit.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.800, 000.

loans.use: To rent a stall in the main market and increase her selection of food items for sale.

loans.name: Cherinor Hassan

texts.en: Cherinor is a hardworking man.  His wife makes soap and he assists by selling the soap in various villages.  With the income from the soap business, they decided to purchase reconditioned freezers and started selling cold soft drinks in Kabala town, but at a very small scale.  Cherinor is excited to grow and expand his business.  He needs additional business capital to purchase a larger quantity and assortment of drinks. Cherinor would like to expand his business and is requesting a loan of Le.3.500, 000, to purchase different types of drinks.

loans.use: To purchase cold soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 42 years old and a widow with 3 children. She inherited her husband’s business and therefore she is responsible for all of the family expenses. With the children growing and leaving for college soon, Hawa needed to generate sufficient income for their school expenses. She is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 to increase her stock.

Hawa wants to be able to supply her children's school fees when they enter college in the near future. She needs additional business capital to supply her grocery store with the a wide assortment of items.

loans.use: To supply her grocery store

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor U. is married with 3 children. He is 42 years old and hails from Imo State, Nigeria. He is a commercial motorcyclist and has been in the business since 2002. He needs the loan amount of $625 to buy a new bike. He said this will help him serve his customers better. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph B.

texts.en:
Joseph owns a small pharmacy in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Joseph is 46 years old and married with 4 children. His business is the main source of income for the family. Joseph supplies many small pharmacies and individuals. Recently, various non-governmental organizations (NGOs) requested that he supply them with medicines in their clinics, but Joseph did not have enough capital to do that. He is requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 to meet his customers' demands.

Joseph has a great opportunity to work with local NGO's in his area. He needs to be able to supply them with an adequate amount of the medicines they need.

loans.use: To increase his stock of medicine to supply the NGOs in his area

loans.name: Magdonio

texts.es:
Magdonio M. is 55 years old and is married to Ninfalina Velazquez who is 49. They are parents to two children, a 31 year old young man who works independently fixing electronics like his father, and a 25 year old daughter who is currently studying Business Administration at the National University of Paraguay. Magdonio and his wife are very proud of their children, since they see the fruit of their labor in them: children who are responsible and mature in their decisions.

Magdonio repairs electronics. He studied and, in 1972, he obtained the title of electrician and then later also obtained the title of electronics technician.

Among some of the items that Magdonio repairs is sound equipment, televisions, computers, and cellular phones, among others. Continuously, Magdonio, despite his age, seeks new training since today the diversity of items is large and there are always new models coming out.

In order to keep up-to-date, Magdonio, besides seeking training, needs new tools in order to repair items that his customers demand. As a result, he is seeking a loan with which he can obtain a digital tester and a program for cellular flashing, which he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Magdonio M. tiene 55 años y esta casado con la sra. Ninfalina Velazquez que tiene 49 años. Ellos son padres de dos hijos, un varón de 31 años que trabaja de forma independiente arreglando artículos electrónicos igual que su padre y una hija de 25 años que esta cursando actualmente la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Nacional del Paraguay. Magodonio y su esposa están muy orgullosos de sus hijos, ya que ven en ellos el buen fruto que han dado, hijos responsables y maduros en sus decisiones.

Magdonio se dedica a la reparación de artículos electrónicos y eléctricos, estudio, y en el año 1972 obtuvo el titulo de técnico electricista y luego mas adelante obtuvo también el titulo de técnico electrónico.

Entre algunos de los aparatos que Magdonio repara podemos citar: equipos de sonido, televisores, computadoras, celulares y otros más. Continuamente Magdonio, a pesar de su edad, busca capacitarse constantemente, ya que hoy por hoy la diversidad de aparatos es grande y cada vez salen modelos mas nuevos y mayor corto tiempo.

Para poder seguir actualizado, Magdonio además de capacitarse necesita nuevas herramientas para poder reparar los artículos que sus clientes le demandan, es por eso, que solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir un tester digital y un programador de flasheo de celulares que necesita.

loans.use: Purchase a digital tester and program for cellular flashing.

loans.name: Michael Mohamed

texts.en: Michael S. is a builder by profession. After his training, he obtained a certificate from a vocational school. He started a small shop selling cement and zinc sheets for homebuilding and, with time, his shop expanded.  Michael would like to extend the service to the nearby town of Magburaka and is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials to expand his business into a neighboring community

loans.name: Elyambiz

texts.en:
Elyambiz is 38 years old, married and has two children aged 11 and 6. He owns a cosmetics shop, which he opened in 1997. He works at this shop from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily and makes about $155 a month in profit from his sales.

Elyambiz has applied for a loan to buy more cosmetics for his business. He is a member of the loan group Upendo (Swahili for "love"), which is made up of 47 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell in a small shop.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma was born in 1984 and lives in Vukovije, a small village near the town of Živinice. Her husband  has a full-time job from which he earns about 700 KM a month. In addition to his salary, they earn income by farming and raising animals. Alma has applied for her first loan from us, for $850, to buy seeds and compost . She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to help secure a good life  for her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson sells cellular phones at the 12 de Octubre zone market in the city of El Alto. This is his primary source of income with which he supports himself and covers his university expenses. He is currently studying law at the Universidad Publica El Alto (UPEA). He lives in the Los Villa Tunari zone in the city of El Alto.

He needs this loan in order to purchase more cellular phones, thus allowing him to increase his earnings and pay for his studies.

This is Edson’s second loan with Impro. His credit history allows him to be approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Edson es comerciante de celulares, los mismos que comercializa en la feria de la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con la que se mantiene y cubre sus estudios universitarios en la Universidad Publica El Alto UPEA de la Carrera de Derecho; vive en la Zona Los Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para aumentar su mercadería de celulares e incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir sus estudios.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase of more cellular phones for his business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo works as a chef in a restaurant located in the southern zone of La Paz. This job is his main source of income with which he helps support his underage siblings and his father. He lives in the Huayna Potosí zone in the city of El Alto.

He needs this loan in order to purchase a plot of land, thus taking the first step that will help him one day have his own house.

This is Guillermo’s second loan with Impro. His credit history allows him to qualify for another loan. He has been our customer since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermo trabaja como cocinero profesional en restaurante de la Zona Sur de La Paz, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con la que ayuda con la manutención de sus hermanos menores y padre; vive en la Zona Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la compra de un terreno y así dar el primer paso que le ayudara a tener su vivienda propia.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitada por el prestatario. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Purchase of a plot of land to build his own house

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy works as a seamstress in a workshop. She also makes ‘rellenos de papa’ (meat-stuffed potato balls) and desserts, food which her mother sells in markets in Rió Seco, El Alto City. These two activities are her main source of income, which she puts towards caring for her mother and her two young daughters. She lives in Zona Villa Yunguyo in El Alto City. She requires this loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can become an independent worker and have her own sewing workshop, her own mini-business. This is her first loan with Impro and the evaluation has approved her application, given her experience and her determination to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Nancy trabaja como costurera en un taller particular; también elabora rellenos de papa y postre, comida que comercializa su madre en la ferias populares de la zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. Estas dos actividades son su principal fuente de ingresos con las que mantiene a su Madre y a sus dos pequeñas hijas que dependen de ella; vive en la Zona Villa Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para comprar maquinaria de costura para de esa forma independizarse y tener su propio taller de costura como microempresaria independiente. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite otorgarle el préstamo, en vista de su experiencia y de su afán de superación.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine so that she can become independent and work for herself

loans.name: Kudzovi Agbessi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kudzovi Agbessi A. was born on May 28, 1979 in Agou Gadjagan a village located 110km from Lomé. He is married and has three children. His main activities are publishing and the sale of books. Meanwhile, he also provides photocopies and word processing. His business, named NETO Sarl, is located in the neighborhood of Bè-Kpéhénou in Lomé. This first loan in the amount of 300.000FCFA should allow him to acquire a new copying machine in order to replace the old one that broke down 2 weeks ago.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kudzovi Agbessi est née le 28 mai 1979 à Agou Gadjagan localité située à 110 km de Lomé. Il est marié et a trois enfants. Son activité principale est l’édition et la vente des livres. Cependant, il fait également la photocopie, le traitement de texte. Il a dénommé son entreprise NETO Sarl située au quartier Bè-Kpéhénou à Lomé. Son premier crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA devait lui permettre d’acquérir un nouveau copieur pour remplacer l’ancien qui est tombé en panne depuis deux semaines.

loans.use: Purchase of a new copying machine

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.en: Mr. Mawussi A., 39 years old,  is the person sitting down in the front left of the photo.  He is the head of this team of mechanics that repairs motorcycles and sells parts in Aventonou, Togo.  This service is always in demand, as most people do not own cars and instead drive scooters or motorcycles which are less expensive to buy and maintain.  Mr. A. is the father of 5 children and uses the income from his business to provide for them and send them to school.  With this loan, he would like to buy new tools to increase the quality of his work as well as to rent additional space to expand the part of his business that sells used parts.  He hopes that these improvements will help him to increase his profitability and satisfy the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy new tools and to rent additional workspace

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi A. was born in 1958 in Lomé. He is married to Mrs. Rosaline Tossa who is a seamstress. He is the owner of a small bar “BAVARIA” located in the neighborhood of Bè Kpéhénou. He manages his business in a professional manner in order to always meet the demand of his clients. This business started in 1988 and it has allowed him to develop loyal customers. Mr. Yaovi A. wishes to borrow a loan in the amount of 300.000FCFA to buy fifty (50) cases of beer, and twelve (12) cases of sparkling beverages.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yaovi est né en 1958 à Lomé. Il s’est marié à mademoiselle TOSSA Rosaline qui est une couturière. Il propriétaire de la buvette « BAVARIA » sise dans le quartier Bè Kpéhénou et gère professionnellement pour répondre toujours à la demande de ses clients. Cette activité qu’il a commencée en 1988 lui a permis de fidéliser ses clients. Monsieur A. Yaovi désire faire un emprunt d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour acheter cinquante (50) casiers de bière et douze (12) casiers de boissons gazeuses.

loans.use: To increase his stock of beer.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is hardworking and trustworthy. With the help of your husband, in a short time she has transformed a small area of her home into a tile and brick workshop. Every morning she starts early in order to create mixtures and fire up thhe bricks, so that she has time to spend with her pets while, little by little, the bricks take shape and consistency. Both she and her husband have the same ambition to increase the business capital investment in order to cover the recent customer demands.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Maria, es muy empeñosa y trabajadora. En sociedad con su esposo hace poco tiempo ha instalado en un pequeño espacio de su domicilio su taller de fabricación de tejas y ladrillos. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se listan para realizar las mezclas y cocción de los ladrillos a fin de retirarse a pastar a sus animalitos mientras estos poco a poco van tomando forma y consistencia.Ambos tienen el noble deseo de incrementar su capital de inversión para cubrir las recientes demandas de sus clientes.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to increase production

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
Linda is a dedicated and enthusiastic mother. Since childhood, she has been associated with embroidery work as it was her dear mother’s and aunt’s occupation. Now, with her husband, she has established a seamstress business in her home and offers services to whomever wishes to convert their clothing into colorful and well-liked items. In a small amount of time, thanks to her dedication and the recommendations of her closest customers, she has been able to obtain a large order. She is requesting a loan so that she may acquire a greater quantity of raw material to satisfy the demand of her large client.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Linda, es una madre de familia dedicada y muy entusiasta, desde pequeña ha estado vinculada a la labor de los bordados debido al desempeño de su querida madre y tía. Ahora en sociedad con su querido esposo han puesto en su hogar un taller de bordados que presta servicios a todo aquel que quiera convertir su vestimenta en un artículo vistoso y de muy buen gusto.Hace poco tiempo gracias a su dedicación y a las recomendaciones de sus clientes más cercanos han podido obtener un gran pedido y solicitan un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima a fin de satisfacer la demanda de su nuevo gran cliente.

loans.use: Purchase raw material in order to continue making her beautiful embroidery.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is a selfless father who works daily in his crop fields. He sows his fields with the help of some oxes which he rents in order to plow the soil, potatoes and maize; he now awaits his harvest, which he hopes will give good results so that he can buy manure and fertilizers with the aim of giving his fields and crops the necessary treatment so that they are healthy and productive.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

FERNANDO, es un abnegado padre de familia que se desempeña diariamente en sus campos de cultivo, ha sembrado con ayuda de unos bueyes que alquiló para trazar los surcos profundos, papa y maíz; a hora se encuentra en espera de su cosecha y necesita para tener muy buenos resultados comprar abonos y fertilizantes naturales a fin de otorgarle el tratamiento necesario a sus plantas para que crezcan sanas y le otorguen buenos frutos.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Jesús is characterized as being an entrepreneurial woman, who has many plans for the future to benefit her family and community. She is in charge of the management of her San Roque transportation line that covers the route from Huancayo to Concepción daily at established times. Her husband drives one of the vehicles and she is in charge of maintaining the order and the security of passengers when they go in search of their services. She wishes a loan so they may repair one of their vehicles since spare parts are very costly and their money has already been invested in vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Jesús, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchos planes a futuro en beneficio D. su familia y comunidad. Está a cargo D. la administración D. su línea D. transportes San Roque, que cubre las ruta D. Huancayo a Concepción, diariamente y horarios establecidos. Su esposo conduce una D. las unidades y ella se encarga del mantener el orden y seguridad D. sus pasajeros cuando acuden en búsqueda D. sus servicios.Desea un préstamo para repara una D. sus unidades debido a que los repuestos son muy costosos y el dinero con el que contaba los había ya invertido en el mantenimiento D. sus vehículos.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair the tools of her job.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria’s years of dedication have helped her be a decisive woman and today have become the motor that drives her family’s progress. She is dedicated to the sale of wool and, at the same time, she teaches crafts to her customers who each day visit her stand, located in her town’s little market. In this way, Maria enjoys life and strives to improve. With this purpose, she has decided to improve her workshop and not to neglect her animals which she keeps in a small stable outsiD. of the city. She wants to continue and support her youngest child’s studies who will apply for entry into university. In order for those wishes to come true, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the wholesale purchase of wool and have more merchandise available for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Los años D. dedicación a Maria la han ayudado a ser una mujer decidida que hoy se ha convertido en el motor que impulsa el progreso D. su familia. Ella está dedicada a la venta D. lanas y a su vez enseña manualidades a sus clientes que cada día acuden a su pequeño stand ubicado en un mercadillo D. su localidad, así Maria se gana la vida y desea seguir mejorando, con este propósito está decidida a implementar mejor su taller y a no descuidar a sus animales en un pequeño establo que tiene fuera D. la ciudad, quiere continuar y apoyar los estudios del menor D. sus hijos que postulará para ingresar a la universidad. Para que estos anhelos se concreten solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra D. lana al por mayor a fin D. tener mayor mercadería disponible para sus ventas.

loans.use: Capital for offering a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith is a diligent mother. She and her husband make an excellent pair, who with effort and work want to improve their financial situation. For her part, she has dedicated her attention to a Cybercafe which they established in their own home. They achieved this dream thanks to a loan which they received through a group of partners. She feels very fortunate, due to the fact that her children have become her “right-hand man” and the force that drives her forward. She wishes to improve her establishment by implementing a telephone shop also in the Cybercafe. Meanwhile, her urgent needs are to improve some of the computers that worn out over time and need repair and immediate attention.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

es una madre de familia diligente; ella y su esposo hacen una dupla excelente, con empeño y trabajo quieren mejorar cada día la economía de su hogar, ella por su parte está dedicada a la atención de una cabina de internet, que instaló en su propia casa. Este sueño lo consiguió gracias a un préstamo al que accedió a través de un grupo de socios. Se siente muy afortunada, debido a que sus hijos ahora se han convertido en su brazo derecho y la fuerza que la impulsa a seguir adelante. Desea mejorar su establecimiento implementando en ese mismo lugar un locutorio telefónico, pero mientras tanto sus necesidades urgentes están en mejorar algunas computadoras que con el tiempo se han desgastado y necesitan de reparación y mantenimiento inmediato.

loans.use: Repair her work’s tools.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
During a period of financial difficulty for her family, Clara discovered a timely exit. She decided to sell vegetables at her local market and she has continued to do so for the past five years. You will always see Clara with a warm smile attending to her customers with great care - a quality that has led to increased sales. Now, she plans to improve her business, which is why she is seeking a loan. With you valued support, Clara will continue with her noble work.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La salida más oportuna fue hallada por Clara en un momento difícil y de escasez económica para su familia. Decidió vender verduras en el mercado de su localidad y ya lleva 5 años dedicándose a este trabajo, siempre verán a Clara con una cálida sonrisa atendiendo con mucha gentileza a sus clientes y esta cualidad ha hecho que sus ventas vayan en aumento por lo que ahora tiene proyectado mejorar su negocio y ese es el motivo de su petición de un préstamo. Con tu valioso aporte Clara continuará con su noble labor.

loans.use: To increase the variety of vegetables she offers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma has a very important role in her house as a motivator who sees that work moves forward. She and her husband provide transportation services using a vehicle they purchased more than 2 years ago thanks to many years of shared effort. Today, she is delighted that they have turned this vehicle into a valuable source of income for their home. Throughout the day, she covers the route from Huancayo to Ancalá. While her husband drives, Irma actively supports him, often serving as fare collector and also preparing lunch for him. To continue and improve her business, she wants to repair her vehicle and continue with the development of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Irma, tiene una función muy importante y protagónica en su casa es la que impulsa y alienta el trabajo para que todo salga adelante, ella y su esposo se dedican al transporte en un automóvil que compraron hace ya más de 2 años producto de muchos años de esfuerzo compartido que hoy les llena de satisfacción al haber convertido esta herramienta en un instrumento de trabajo muy valioso para la economía de su hogar y es así que durante todo el día se dedican a trabajar ofreciendo el servicio de transporte cubriendo la ruta de Huancayo hacia Ancalá,mientras que su esposo es el conductor de la unidad de transporte, Irma apoya activamente siendo muchas veces el cobrador y también preparando el almuerzo diario para su esposo.Para continuar y mejorar su labor desea reparar su herramienta de trabajo a fin de continuar con el desarrollo de su familia.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Kozo Group

texts.fr:
KOZO de Togblékopé (Agoè) is a solidarity group, created in 2006, and composed of three women. Its objective is to improve the living condition of its members by the practice of an economic activity, by creating solidarity within and forging mutual aid between its members. The members’ ages vary between 22 and 24 years old. All the members are illiterate except for its secretary who holds all the official and accounting documents. The group has already enjoyed three loans of 240.000FCFA and 320.000FCFA each. They have all been paid back without problems. The association KOZO is requesting a loan of 240.000FCFA to buy four bolts of fabric, six boxes of milk and various products of first necessity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

KOZO de Togblékopé (Agoè) est un groupe de solidarité constitué de trois femmes crée en 2006. Il a pour objectif, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres par l’exercice des activités économiques et de créer une solidarité en son sein et faire des entraides mutuelles entre les membres. L’âge des membres varie de 22 ans à 24 ans. Tous les membres sont analphabètes à l’exception de la secrétaire qui tient les documents administratifs et comptables. Le groupement a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectivement 240.000FCFA et 320.000FCFA qui ont été bien remboursés sans incident. L’association KOZO sollicite un crédit de 240.000 FCFA pour acheter quatre rouleaux de tissus, six cartons de lait et divers produits de première nécessité.

loans.use: Increase the stock of merchandise

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Day after day, Loida works tirelessly to ensure that her family is secure, which is why she and her husband offer transportation services in their van. She wakes up very early and feeds her three children, taking great care attending to them. By mid-day, she delivers lunch to her husband and, depending on their shifts, she also works as the van driver. She works hard all day, until 10pm, but despite this endless, arduous labor, she works toward the goal of seeing her children overcome each day. Her goal is to hire another driver to increase their earnings, which is why she is now seeking a loan to repair their vehicle so they can increase the number of routes they travel.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Loida, día a día trabaja incesantemente para lograr que los suyos estén seguros, es por ello que junto a su esposo ofrecer el servicio de transporte en un vehículo de transportes, labor para la cual se levanta muy temprano y prepara los alimentos para sus 3 hijos y se esmera por atenderlos para finalizar al medio día y llevar el almuerzo a su esposo, dependiendo de sus turnos ella también colabora como cobradora, el trabajo dura todo el día, hasta las 10 de la noche, a pesar de esta ardua labor que no cesa porque trabaja con la finalidad de ver a sus hijos superándose cada día, su anhelo es obtener otra unidad para incrementar sus ganancias es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para reparar su movilidad a fin de acumular mayores espacios recorridos.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia has not neglected her noble roots and decided to stay in her homeland of Tingo Paccha to build a life full of satisfaction. She is a humble farmer who year after year labors on the land to proviD. daily sustenance. She cultivates potatoes principally, and she also cares for animals. Her dedication to raising cows has helped her econically through tough times, especially when early freezes hurt her harvest. She desires to keep working and wishes to acquire larger quantities of feed for her animals and seeds for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Dalia, no ha negado sus nobles raíces y decidió quedarse en su tierra natal D. Tingo Paccha para construir una vida llena D. satisfacciones, es una humilD. agricultora que año tras año labró y sigue labrando la tierra que le provee del sustento diario para vivir, cultiva papa principalmente, y también está dedicada al cuidado D. sus animales, su dedicación por la crianza D. vacas le permite sostener la economía D. su hogar en tiempo D. escasez, más aún cuando en muchas oportunidades la helada perjudicaba su cosecha, ahora ella está muy deseosa D. seguir trabajando, y desea incrementar su capital D. trabajo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. comida balanceada y semillas para sus campos D. cultivo.

loans.use: Purchase feed for her cattle and seeds for her potato fields / Compra de comida balanceada para sus vaquitas y semillas para sus terrenos de cultivo.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz is a young mother who works hard to continue the legacy of her parents, farming and raising animals on their lands. She daily tends to her crops to observe their growth, since the harvest is where she obtains her income. Her wish is to extend her farm lands, and she has thought of investing in maintaining them through manure and natural fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mariluz, es una joven madre de familia que se esfuerza para continuar el legado de sus padres en sus tierras de cultivo y a la crianza de sus animales para lo cual diariamente se traslada hacia sus chacritas para observar su crecimiento ya que de eso dependerá la cosecha y la obtención de sus ganancias, su deseo es extender sus tierras de cultivo y tiene pensado invertir desde ahora en el alquiler y mantenimiento a través de abonos y fertilizantes naturales.

loans.use: Purchase manure and natural fertilizers to prepare her land for the next sowing season / Compra de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para preparar la tierra para su próxima siembra.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto has big dreams of become a well-known livestock farmer on his beautiful land and knows that with big dreams comes big effort, so he now works with a definitive goal. He cultivates potatoes to sell at market in the city of Tarma, and he also has cows that he dedicates a lot of care for. His three children help him take them to remote fields to graze. He wants to set up a cow shed and has decided to invest a large portion of his harvest earnings to acquire breeding cows.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Edilberto, tiene el gran sueño de ser un ganadero reconocido en su linda tierra y sabe que detrás de un sueño hay gran esfuerzo, es así que él desde ahora trabaja con un norte definido, cultiva papa que es vendida en el mercado de Tarma y también tiene vacas a los cuales cría con mucha dedicación y en familia, sus 3 hijos son su ayuda los lleva a campos recónditos para pastarlos. Desea implementar su establo y ha decidido invertir gran parte de la ganancia de sus cosechas para adquirir vacas de raza.

loans.use: Acquire breeding cows / Compra de vacas de raza.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina is very persistent and dedicated to give her children what's needed to get ahead in life, and for this reason she works daily in the fields tending and harvesting potatoes, which afterwards she takes to the city of Tarma to sell. A lot of the time the chores in the fields results in little compensation, and so recently she set up a sales post in her home for fruits and candy, which allows her to tend to her home as well. She wishes to have more capital to invest in her work so she can increase her income and improve her beloved family's well being.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Agripina, es muy empeñosa y dedicada a brindar a sus 2 hijos lo necesario para su superación, por esa razón trabaja diariamente en sus campos de cultivo y siembra papa que después de cosecharla llevará a la ciudad de Tarma para venderla. Muchas veces las tareas del campo suelen ser poco compensadoras es así que Agripina también ha puesto recientemente en su casa un puesto de venta de frutas y dulces, es por ello que con estos esfuerzos diariamente puede atender y solventar su hogar. Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para elevar sus ganancias y el bienestar de su querida familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to improve production / Incremento de capital para elevar su producción.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Marie-Reine Group

texts.fr:
Marie-Reine d’Agoè is a solidarity group composed of four women. Its objective is to offer mutual aid to group members. The group Marie-Reine was created in 2007 and its members’ activities are hairdressing, sale of extensions, plates and wrap around fabric (pagnes) in the neighborhood of Agoè (North Lomé). All the members of this group are married women. The group already enjoyed a loan of 300.000 FCFA, which it paid back. Currently, they wish to renew their loan for 300.000 FCFA to buy four boxes of extensions and twelve pieces of wrap around fabric (pagnes) in order to improve their sales and clear a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Marie-Reine d’Agoè est un groupe de solidarité constitué de quatre femmes. Il a pour objectif, de faire des entraides mutuelles entre les membres. Le groupe Marie-Reine est crée en 2007 et ses membres ont pour activité la coiffure, la vente des mèches, des assiettes et de pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè (Nord de Lomé). Tous les membres de ce groupe sont des femmes mariées. Le crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA que le groupe avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé. Actuellement il désire renouveler leur crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter quatre cartons de mèche et douze pièces de pagne pour pouvoir améliorer leur vente et dégager beaucoup de bénéfice.

loans.use: To increase their stock of hair extensions

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
By making her clothing products with great care and dedication, Judith's work has become in demand by the different education centers and the general public for uniforms and diverse clothing articles. She wishes to improve the quality of her sewing materials and set up her small shop to better serve her clients, and is requesting the loan to fulfill these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Por su dedicación y esmero en la elaboración e prendas de vestir Judith es muy solicitada por los diferentes centros de estudios y publico en general para la confección de uniformes y diversas prendas.Desea incrementar la cantidad de materia prima para la confección de las prendas que le solicitan y condicionar su pequeño taller para mejor estadía de sus clientes durante sus peticiones.

loans.use: Improve her sewing shop and purchase higher quality supplies / Acondicionamiento del pequeño taller y compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz has loved making clothes since she was very young thanks to the passion and example of her loving mother. She has five children and now lives in a humble home with only her beloved husband. Her execution and excellent products have made her well known in her city and she receives many orders a day. Her wish is to acquire a larger quantity of supplies and enlarge her small shop, and she is requesting a loan to fulfill these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Beatriz, manifestó su amor por la confección de prendas de vestir desde muy pequeña debido a la gran pasión y desempeño de su amada madre. Tiene cinco hijos y ahora habita su humilde morada sólo en compañía de su querido esposo. La práctica y los excelentes acabados de sus bellas prendas la han hecho muy conocida en su ciudad y a diario recepciona muchas peticiones. Su deseo de adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima y de ampliar su pequeño taller la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para llevar a cabo a este propósito.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of sewing supplies and enlarge her shop / Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima y ampliación de su pequeño taller de costura.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda is a very determined woman. She is the owner of a “mototaxi”, the same she rents. In a short time, she has turned into a woman with a business vision, since she sells products to the different bordering hamlets to her city. She also sells carved wood all the different places of her area. She is a teacher elementary school. She is 34 years old and she is a mother of a son. He wants to keep her working tools in good shape and for this she wants to buy spare parts and repair them. Furthermore she wants to open a restaurant to sell the typical dishes of her region. In order to achieve this objective she needs a working capital that will make her wishes come true. You can help this hard-working mother make her dreams become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Amanda, es una muy decidida, es propietaria de un mototaxi, el mismo que alquila y en poco tiempo se ha convertido en una mujer con visiones de negocio, puesto que también lleva a vender productos de primera necesidad a los diferentes caseríos aledaños a su ciudad, también vende maderas talladas por todos los lugares de su zona. Ella es maestra de educación primaria, tiene de 34 años de edad y es madre de un hijo. Quiere tener en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo y para ello quiere comprar repuestos y repararlo, también más adelante desea instalar un restaurante donde quiere vender los platos típicos de la región, para lograr este objetivo le urge un capital el mismo que hará realidad su sueño esperado. Con tu ayuda harás realidad el propósito de esta madre trabajadora.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to improve the state of her working tools.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha is 31 years old. She sells clothes and books. She is a single mother, and she has 3 daughters. She has managed to make her small business one of the most visited places in her area. Her daughters who are already teenagers help with the work of their dear mother and they are very eager to refit store to turn it into a eye-catching and comfortable place in order to service her clients with more freedom.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirtha de 31 años de edad, se dedica a la venta ropas y la venta de libros, es madre soltera, y tiene 03 hijas, su dedicación y buen gusto ha hecho que su pequeño espacio de ventas sea uno de los más visitados. Sus hijas ya señoritas colaboran con la labor de su querida madre y están muy ansiosa de implementar el local para convertirlo en un sitio más vistoso y cómodo para atender a las clientes con mayor libertad.

loans.use: Refit the space where she sells her products.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mohamed D. was born on June 11, 1976 in Kri-Kri in the county of Tchamba located about 370 km from Lomé. He is married and the father of six children all attending school. His main business is the manufacturing of cauldrons in the neighborhood of Agoè. This activity consists of melting the aluminum and transforming it in cauldrons, after the addition of some components and the use of specific techniques. He started this activity in 1998 and his income has allowed him to support his family. His first loan in the amount of 400.000 FCFA, already reimbursed, allowed him to equip his workshop with tools for his trade. Currently Mr. Mohamed D. is requesting another loan of 400.000 FCFA to buy aluminum and seven bags of wood coal.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 11 juin 1976 à Kri-kri dans la préfecture de Tchamba située à 370 Km de Lomé, D. Mohamed est marié et père de six enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son activité principale est la fabrication de marmites dans le quartier d’Agoè. Cette activité traditionnelle consiste à fondre de l’aluminium et de le transformer en marmite après ajout de certains composants et utilisation de certaines techniques. Le revenu de cette activité qu’il a commencé en 1998 lui a permis de supporter les charges de sa famille. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 400.000 FCFA qu’il a déjà remboursé lui a permis d’équiper son atelier en outils de travail. Actuellement Monsieur D. Mohamed reconduit le montant de 400.000 FCFA pour acheter de l’aluminium et sept sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum to manufacture cauldrons

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es:
Gilber is 30 years old and he is single. He is a young man with many objectives and to reach each of his objectives he works very hard. He is a driver of a motocycle that he uses to transport passengers. He wants to buy spare parts for his “Mototaxi” and then to have it repair with the intention to keep up his work load and be able to reach each of his goals. He hopes to have the disinterested help of your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Gilber, de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, es un joven con muchos objetivos y para conseguir cada uno de sus objetivos se esfuerza mucho. Él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (chofer). Quiere comprar repuestos para su mototaxi para luego mandarlo a reparar con el objetivo de seguir manteniendo su ritmo de trabajo y alcanzar cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto.Él espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for the motorcyle used to transport passangers.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is 36 years old. She has been selling fish now for quite a long time. She sells her products outside her domicile and she offers a good service to all of her clients. Perhaps for this reason she doesn’t worry about having to sell on the market since all of her main clients are those who live in her own area. Maria is a mother of 5 children, 2 of them are already independent, and the remaining three children are in elementary school. Her dear husband supports her very much. He is a fisherman so he is in charge of bringing the fish to Maria. She really likes this business, so she decided to refit the small space where she sells her products, for this reason she needs a bigger working capital to fulfill her wishes as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria de 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace ya mucho tiempo, oferta sus productos fuera de su domicilio y brinda a todos sus clientes una buena atención quizá por esa razón no se preocupa por ir a vender en el mercado ya que todos sus clientes principales son los de su propia zona. Maria es madre de 5 hijos siendo 2 de ellos ya independientes, quedando sus tres últimos niños que cursan el nivel primario. Su querido esposo la apoya mucho, pues él es pescador y el encargado de traer a Maria el pescado que degustan muchas personas. A ella le gusta mucho este negocio es por eso que decidió implementar más su pequeño espacio de ventas y requiere de un capital de inversión lo más pronto posible para cumplir su propósito.

loans.use: Refit the space where she sells her products.
